loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a forty-two-year-old widow who lives with her three children in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her family dream is to own a permanent house and educate her children. 

She sells second-hand clothes for a living. She has been in business for twenty years. Her business has allowed her to pay school fees for her children. Alice intends to use the money to buy clothes because we are nearing the festive season.

loans.use: To buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Aiymbubu's Group

texts.en:
Aiymbubu K. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of the small town of Kochkor, which is in the Isykul region. Aiymbubu is 57 and married. She has raised three sons and five daughters. Most of the children are married and live separately with their families. 

Aiymbubu and her husband are engaged in cattle breeding. In order to make money to cover family expenses, they breed cattle and then sell them at a higher price after fattening. In this way they made money to purchase a tractor. With the money from this loan the family plans to purchase a sheep for breeding. In the future they wish to purchase a house in Bishkek.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a sheep

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda M. is from the town of Talibon. She is 28 years old. Roda is married and has four children. She buys and resells fruits like mangoes. Since she is living in one of the islands in Talibon, she goes to the mainland to buy fruits and vegetables that she can resell on the island. She also buys ingredients for making "halo-halo," a popular Filipino dessert/snack. 

Roda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Roda is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which she will use to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
52-year-old Joana S. is a father of ten children with seven still attending school. He has been farming for thirty years in his hometown of Kisii in western Kenya. His produce of tea, bananas, milk and maize are sold locally. His farming challenges include prolonged drought and hailstorms.

Joana has applied for this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. Joana hopes income from this investment will pay school fees for his children and uplift his family’s living standards in terms of food. He aspires to run a retail shop within the local market.

Joana is glad Juhudi offers these loans.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en:
Adelita P. is 44 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. She is from the village of Punta, part of the municipality of Panaon, Misamis Occidental province on the islands of Mindanao. Adelita plants and harvests a variety of vegetables to sell. Adelita has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Adelita joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. Adelita successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Adelita is requesting a new loan, her third from GDMPC, of 5,000 PHP that will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Kikoma Women's Group

texts.en:
Prossy N. is 42 years old and married with eight children, six of whom are in school. She is the leader of the Kikoma group in Mubende. Prossy has a retail shop in Kikoma that has been in existence for twenty years. From her shop she is able to make 100,000 UGX in weekly profits. These profits have helped her with her children’s school fees along with help from her husband.

A retail shop is a marketable business in her area, and this is what inspired Prossy to start this business. She was a farmer before opening her shop. Now she has succeeded in life. Her plan is to be able to finish up her house so that her children can lead a decent life.

loans.use: To restock her shop with more general merchandise.

loans.name: Altantuul

texts.en:
Altantuul N. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son currently attends a construction college and her younger daughter is in kindergarten. 

Altantuul operates a vegetable business to support her family. She sells a variety of vegetables in Narantuul, the main market in the city. She has been engaged in this trade for 11 years and has gained significant experience and many regular customers. 

She has been planning to expand her business and have her own work place. Altantuul is requesting a 2500000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve a large amount of vegetables when prices for such produce are cheap.

loans.use: To purchase and preserve a large amount of vegetables

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en:
Lolito L., age 42, offers transportation services in his local community. Lolito has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. He and his wife have one school-aged child and live in the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. 

Earlier this year, Lolito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. He hoped to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Lolito is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other necessary accessories. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lolito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other necessary accessories for his transportation business

loans.name: Jesicca

texts.en:
Jesicca P. is from the town of Talibon. She is 35 years old. Jesicca is married and has nine children. Her eldest child is now 20 years old and the youngest is aged 2. To make a living, Jesicca provides waste management services, operating jeepney transport services. Jesicca works hard to help provide for her large family. She hopes to venture into other kinds of business that could help increase her income.

Jesicca joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesicca has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase wheels and spare parts. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase wheels and spare parts

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel B. is from the village of Bayabas, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 29 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Roel owns and operates a general store. Roel has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Roel joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Roel is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his fifth from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Evas

texts.en:
Evas, age 48, is a widow with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Evas is charged with the sole responsibility of looking after her family. She longs be able to provide a good education for her children. 

For two years she has been a poultry keeper, and this has provided her with many benefits, such as building a house for the family. Her business goal is to add more birds to her business and to begin to supply larger areas. Evas is a requesting a loan in order to buy more chicks.

loans.use: To add more chicks in order to supply larger areas

loans.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en:
Dinara R., age 46, is a cattle breeder. She sells dairy products for a living and earns approximately 3,900 soms per month. Her husband works as a security guard at the local school. They live in Karabalta. Together they have brought up five sons: the eldest is married and lives separately with his family, two sons are working in Russia, and the two younger sons are students. 

Dinara hopes to obtain a loan to help her to purchase coal for heating during the winter season. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.
 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds a triple bottom line: 
- People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), 
- Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and 
- Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase coal for heating during the winter

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 44-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She works as a beautician who has developed her business in her home. She works independently on her business and she lives on her own. She has been involved in this business for almost 20 years. She offers different types of beauty services to her clients such as make up, manicure, pedicure etc.  With her requested loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., she will invest in purchasing new beauty supplies.  She said that with the help of the loan, she will expand her work operation significantly and increase her overall profit. She is able to serve a wide range of clients from her home.

loans.use: To purchase new beauty supplies

loans.name: 02.10.1.3 Group

texts.en:
Tuyet N. T. (9) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Tuyet is the leader of a five-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 10.1.3 Nam Ngan (02.10.1.3).
Tuyet is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Tuyet owns and operates a food stall selling a variety of food products in the local community. Tuyet has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.
In 2010, Tuyet joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women for 5,787,900 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. Tuyet plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About the other borrowers in the group
1. N. T. Phuong (10) is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. 2. N. T. Tham (11) is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall. 3. D. T. Phuong (12) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. 4. C. T. Nhan (13) is a 47-year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

About Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Tuyet N. T. (9) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Tuyet là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 10.1.3 Nam Ngan (02.10.1.3). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương. Tuyet thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 1 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Tuyet kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND. Vào 2010, Tuyet đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Tuyet đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.787.900 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. T. Phuong (10) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. N. T. Tham (11) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 3. D. T. Phuong (12) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 4. C. T. Nhan (13) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is a resident of the town of Kisii in western Kenya and has been engaged in mixed farming for 15 years. He produces maize, beans, millet, bananas, and milk, and sells these at the local market. His primary challenges are crop diseases and unpredictable weather conditions.

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He is confident that milk from the dairy cow will supplement the family diet and generate income that will help him support his family and to pay school fees. 

He has eight children, five of whom are attending school.

loans.use: The purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Levitico

texts.en:
Levitico B., age 54, provides transportation services to local community members. Levitico is just starting this business. He and his wife have five grown children and live in the city of Loboc, Oroq. City. 

Earlier this year, Levitico joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. His goal was to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Levitico is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Levitico from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his family's house. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda D., age 57, prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have two grown children and live in the village of Alimannao, Peñablanca, Cagayan.

Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan from ASKI. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make her products for sale. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Yolanda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase the raw ingredients needed to make her cooked food products for sale

loans.name: El

texts.en:
El P., age 30, sells coffee and soft drinks from her store, which she built in front of her home. Her customers are her neighbors and fellow villagers. She is running her business smoothly because she has skills in public relations which she uses successfully with her customers. 

El P. believes that this is a good time to expand her business so that she can earn extra profit, but she does not have the necessary funds to make such an expansion possible. She is therefore applying for a loan which she will use as capital to accumulate a quantity of various products to sell. 

El P. currently resides with her mother and seven other family members under one roof. The family lives in the city of Phnom Penh. El P. was not available the day of the photo, so her mother is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To accumulate a quantity of various products to sell in her store

loans.name: Ben

texts.en: Ben is a 44-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He lives in a rented house and his mission is to build his own house in the next three years. For two years he has been selling shoes in the market. Financial challenges make it hard for him to meet the specific demands of his customers. Ben is requesting a loan to purchase shoes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase shoes for resale

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo A. is from the town of Talibon. He is 34 years old, married and has 4 children aged 11, 9, 7 and 4. To make a living, Eduardo owns and operates a business gathering and selling seaweed to the market. Eduardo works hard to build his business. He hopes it will be stable.
Eduardo joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Eduardo is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: 1.1.2 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Thuy N. T. is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of T. Hoa. Thuy is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 01.1.2 Nam Ngan (02.01.1.2 ).

Thuy is married and has two adult-aged children. To making a living, Thuy owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling pork products in the local community.  Thuy has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Thuy joined T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thuy is requesting a loan from T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women for the first time. She is now requesting a new loan of 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for saL.. This will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thuy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the other borrowers in the group:


1. L. T. T. Van (7) is a 20-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her food stall business.


2. N. T. T. Thuy (8) is a 21-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her retail store.


About T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Fund for T. Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the T. Hoa province.

Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto E. is from the town of Talibon. He is 62 years old. Ernesto is married and has four children. To make a living, Ernesto owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. Ernesto has been working hard to build his business.

Ernesto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ernesto has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ernesto is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Altanzul

texts.en:
Altanzul S. is a 26-year-old young man who lives with his sister and her two children in an apartment in Selenge province, Mongolia. His sister works as a chairman of the transportation section in Suhbaatar's train station. Altanzul operates a photo studio in his town. He began his business in 2004 when he was student at Mongolian National University, by operating a photo studio in a rented space on Student's Street, Ulaanbaatar. After graduating from the university in 2005, he started to work in his town's train station as an agent. In 2006, he decided to operate a photo studio, which he opened in a rented space. 

Since then, he has expanded his business by obtaining a loan in dollars equal to 10,000,000 MNT from Xacbank and purchasing high quality equipment and tools that are used in the professional studio. Over the years, he has built a stable operation and has been providing a professional photo service to his community. He hired one more worker and they run their business at a sustainable level. Altanzul is a very hardworking man and hopes to get permission the establish a legal entity and expand his business in the future. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary supplies, material and equipment for his photo studio.

loans.use: To purchase necessary supplies, material and equipment

loans.name: Sisinio

texts.en:
Sisinio J. is from the town of Talibon. He is 53 years old. Sisinio is single. To make a living, he owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fuel and firewood. Sisinio has regular customers already and he hopes to serve more by expanding his business.

Sisinio joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sisinio has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Sisinio is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Inganzabunebwe Group

texts.en:
Claudette is 32 years old and married to a carpenter. She has three children who are between one and four years old. None of her children go to school. Claudette is the leader of this borrowing group, called Inganzabunebwe, which means 'Fight Laziness' in English. The group members are committed to changing their mode of life by requesting this loan. All of them have different businesses. 

Claudette, as the group leader, sells clothes. She has been in this business for seven years. She has requested the loan with her group members to buy more clothes to sell, and she says the profit from this business will be used to pay school fees for her children in the future. She says that her business is successful because it makes profit. 

At the time when this picture was taken, the group leader was not around, but she was later interviewed.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella B. is from the village of Saranay, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 59 years old, married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Estrella owns and operates a general store selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Estrella joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her eighth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Shinechuluun

texts.en:
Shinechuluun, age 37, is a fruit and vegetable vendor. She sells her wares from a stall that she rents at the Kharaa food market, which is the most crowded market in this area because of the cheap prices offered there. She has been running this business for six years and has gained a loyal customer base.

Shinechuluun lives with her husband and their three children in a "ger," which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. They live in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Their two eldest sons, ages 9 and 17, attend secondary school. The youngest daughter attends a kindergarten.  Shinechuluun’s husband Batdorj, age 37, is a craftsman at a factory that produces double-glazed windows. 

Shinechuluun owns a small family car, which she uses for taking her children to school and to transport her products to and from the market. She is requesting a loan in order to buy some spare parts to repair and service her car. She hopes eventually to have the resources to perform necessary renovations to the family dwelling.

loans.use: To buy spare parts in order to repair and service her car, which is her primary method of transporting her wares to and from market

loans.name: Kajubwe Tukore Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
Pasikazia T. is the leader of Kajubwe Tukore group A in Kihihi. A married mother of nine children, all aged above eight years, she grows beans and maize and sells goats from Nshegi, earning as much as 160,000 in monthly profits.

Pasikazia is now requesting a loan to expand her farm by buying more goats and fertilizers. She has been in business for over 20 years and is happy to have grown over the years. Very hardworking and determined, Pasikazia hopes to grow even further now that she is a client of Pearl microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more goats and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: perform maintenance on his photocopy machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn D., age 22, engages in a fishing business. She goes out in a fishing boat to catch assorted fish, which she then sells at market. 

Gemalyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Gemalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Gemalyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

Gemalyn and her husband have two small children under the age of four. The family lives in the town of Talibon.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Buyan-Orshih

texts.en: Buyan-Orshih is 54 and lives with her husband in their own house in Selenge province, Mongolia. She has two grown children who live on their own. Her daughter works in Ulaanbaatar as a company legal advisor and her son is an assistant engine driver in the train station. Buyan-Orshih operates a retail clothing business. She started it in 1996 and has since gained much experience. She has found success in her trade and has used her earnings to support her family. Her earnings have enabled her to not only pay her children's tuition fees but also purchase an apartment in Ulaanbaatar for her daughter. In order to increase turnover, she sells her products at under-market prices. In the future she hopes to continue her success and grow her business and support their children. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to add to her savings of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase a car.

loans.use: To purchase a car

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single woman from Lebanon. This young woman lives alone to attend the university because her family home is far from her college.  

Despite her young age, she has proven to be a successful entrepreneur as a radio program director. She started this type of business in 2008 and she works on a freelance basis. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a laptop to be able to do the needed preparations for her occupation from her home instead of staying late at the radio station. This way, she will also be able to deliver  her service faster. In the future, she hopes to continue in this type of occupation and develop her career, and she dreams of having her own radio program.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop so she can do her work at home

loans.name: Baasandorj

texts.en: Baasandorj D., 27, lives with his wife and daughter in a rented house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughter, aged two, is in kindergarten. Baasandarj and his wife operate a meat-trading business in a rented stall at Harharin market, one of the largest markets in the city. They have had this business for the last three years and have built a stable operation. Baasandorj is responsible for purchasing meats from wholesale traders while his wife works as a salesperson in their meat stall. Their working capital has grown to 3,000,000 MNT. Baasandorj is a modest man who plans to expand his business and have his own work place. He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve more meat.

loans.use: To purchase and preserve more meat

loans.name: Gogaya Women's Group, Mubende

texts.en: Florence N. is the leader of Gogaya group in Mubende. She is 36 years old and is married with 4 children, all of whom are in school. Florence has a bar business where she has been selling beers, sodas, wines and other drinks for over seven years. Before setting up the bar business, Florence was a civil servant and was just as hard working as she is today. She is requesting a loan to buy more beers and sodas for resale. Her dream for the future is to be able to construct a commercial building for the business and to provide and education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beers and sodas for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 39-year-old married man and the father of two young children. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a dairy products shop for over 5 years. He offers all types of dairy products in addition to Lebanese products made from milk. His freshly prepared goods are enjoyed by members of his village and neighboring towns. He is the only income provider for his family. 

He opened this type of shop after seeing much need for such a business in the region. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to further develop his shop and increase his productivity.  He is planning to continue expansion of his business and he is positive about the coming year. His shop is an important source of income for his family.

loans.use: to further develop his shop and increase his productivity

loans.name: Narynkul

texts.en:
Narynkul A. is 57 years old, married, and has six grown children. Her husband, Jumabek, is a pensioner and helps her in the household. Four years ago, in order to find means of subsistence and to make some savings for old age, Narynkul decided to engage in cattle breeding. 

Using her starting capital of only 2,000 KGS, Narynkul decided to start her business in cattle breeding and bought bull calves. She concentrated all her efforts on supporting and expanding her household and managed to raise her capital to 40,000 KGS.  Now, Narynkul wants to take out a loan of 70,000 KGS to buy three bull-calves and four sheep for fattening and reselling. With the revenues from this investment, Narynkul plans to develop her farm by means of livestock breeding. In the future, she dreams to open a small shop with meat products. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and sheep

loans.name: Bayarjargal

texts.en: Bayarjargal T. is 27 years old and lives with his wife and three-year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia’s capital city. He and his family live in their own house. His wife works as a company cook. Bayarjargal purchased a mini truck with one ton capacity which enabled him to start his own transportation business in 2008. He hopes to expand his business so that he can improve his family's standard of living. He is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan in order to fix his house.

loans.use: To fix his house

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet G. is from the village of Saranay, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 44 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet has a retail store selling calamansi (citrus fruit). She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Juliet joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Juliet from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dorca

texts.en:
Dorca is a mother of 8 children aged between 23 and 8 years old. She has been doing mixed farming in her hometown of Kisii in Western Kenya. She produces millet, milk, maize, coffee, tea, bananas and vegetables and sells locally.

She has applied for this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She believes the income generated will improve the family’s standard of living in terms of food and pay school fees for the children. She aspires to have 5 dairy cows and run a retail shop locally in five years.

Her challenge is fluctuating prices within the local markets. She is glad Juhudi's loan services will help fight poverty.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old single woman living with her parents. She is from Lebanon. She has been working in a clothing shop in her town for five years. In 2008, she opened her own shop. With her business income, she helps her father who works as a farmer, to cover the family expenses. She displays women's and children's clothes in her shop. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her store’s inventory of new collections. The diversity of her merchandise selection will help her increase her sales and therefore her income. In the future, she is hoping also to sell shoes in her store. Currently, she mostly sells clothes.

loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory of new collections

loans.name: Gan-Ochir

texts.en: Gan-Ochir is 43 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia’s capital city. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in his brother-in-law's yard. His wife operates a fruit and dairy products trading business out of a stall in the local market, while Gan-Ochir uses his truck in a transportation business. He has been engaged in this business since 2003 and has built a stable operation. For the future, he hopes to continue expand his business. Gan-Ochir is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan in order to paint and purchase spare parts for his truck.

loans.use: To paint and purchase spare parts for his truck

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a larger amount of goods to increase sales

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov S. is a 31-year-old married woman who currently resides in the middle of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Pov S. is a cleaning woman and also spends times at home taking care of her kids and doing housework. She has four children and all of them are unmarried. She also relies on income from her husband’s work selling fish and fish-paste, and his business is running well now. So that Pov S.’s husband has needed more funds to expand his business in order to make more profits for supporting the family’s needs. To solve this problem, Pov S. will request a loan as fund for her husband to purchase more fish and fish-paste for resale. Pov S. was not available at that day, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and fish-paste for resale.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a resident of Kisii Town in Western Kenya and has been doing mixed farming for 9 years. She employs two farmhands on her farm. Her produce of maize, tea, beans, bananas, milk and millet are sold locally. She has one 8-year-old child.

She requested the loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says this loan will improve her family standard of living in terms of food. She is focusing on buying a pick-up truck in five years time to help in transportation of milk to the market.

She laments on the poor road networks and low prices for products within the local markets.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina S. is a 39 year old married woman, and she was introduced to KADET LIMITED by another client of the company.  She operates a farming business and grows pineapples and tomatoes, which she sells to clients in various areas.  The farm is located in Malindi, where Amina lives.

This is her second loan with KADET LIMITED, and she intends to use her loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings for her farm, and continue farming.  She hopes to use the anticipated profit to continue caring for her family and keep the business growing.

Amina hopes that one day she will own a bigger farm, and the she would be able to practice both crop and animal farming.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings for the planting season

loans.name: Hishigjargal

texts.en:
Hishigjargal A. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent (also known as a "yurt"). Her oldest daughter is a student in the Mongolian National University, her younger two daughters attend high school and her youngest son is in kindergarten. 

Since 2004, she has been operating a watch repair shop and selling religious items in the Han Talst trade center. After many years of running this business, she has gained significant experience as a businesswoman and has built a stable operation. Today, her working capital exceeds 800,000 MNT and her daily sales income has reached 40,000 MNT. 

Hishigjargal is a very clever woman and says, "All I want is to provide a good education for my children."

She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to increase her working capital for her business.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Kipsoi

texts.en:
B. K. Kipsoi, age 28, buys potatoes in bulk and sells them in small quantities at a profit. He has been in this business for two years now and he gets a monthly income of Kshs 30,000 shillings. He and his wife, Joan K., are blessed with two beautiful children. They live in Kibigos in Tot, Kenya.

B. has applied for a loan from KADET, which he plans to use to add more sacks of potatoes to offer for resale. He will also buy chemicals for spraying potatoes while in the farm to avoid insects from infecting the crop.

In future, he plans to buy a plot and build rental houses. These will supplement his income so that he can provide for his family's basic needs.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of potatoes to offer for resale

loans.name: Peou

texts.en:
Peou V. is a 41-year-old, married mother. She has a small shop in the local market in Phnom Penh City. She always gets up early in the morning in order to travel to the market. She sells rice and meatball to people who have no time to cook for themselves and can come to eat at her shop.  

Her husband is car taxi driver in around city and other province. The main incomes in her family come from her husband’s business. This family normally earns an average of $12 per day to help cover their family’s daily living expenses. The couple has only one child who is still a student in school. 

Unluckily, an existing car often has broken down during use. Because of that, Peou V. has decided to seek a loan, which she will use for her husband to fix the broken car.

loans.use: To fix the broken car.

loans.name: Odonchimeg

texts.en:
Odonchimeg Y. is 29 years old and lives with her parents and brother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent (also known as a "yurt"). 

Since 2006, she has been operating a computer and printer, as well as billiard services in the basement of an apartment building. After years of successful operation, her working capital has exceeded to 2,500,000 MNT, includes her business equipments and tools, and her daily average income is 40,000 MNT. 

Odonchimeg hopes in the future to expand her business and have her own work place. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary equipment for her service in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Yanjinlham

texts.en:
Yanjinlham N. is 61 years old. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and grandchild in their own house and yard in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Yanjinlham operates a vegetable business to support her family. She sells a variety of vegetables out of a rented stall at the Han Talst trade center. She has been engaging in this trade for past eight years and has gained significant experience. After many years of running this business, she has gained many permanent customers. She has been planning to expand her business and to start renting one more stall where she will sell a variety of dairy products to supplement her earnings. Her daughter-in-law helps with her business by working as a salesperson in the stall. 

Yanjinlham is a hardworking businesswoman and says, "I want to have a work place for my children". 

She is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan in order to increase her working capital for her business.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married man with five school-aged children. After retiring from the army, he opened a grocery shop in his town in 2008. Next to the shop he has prepared a small coffee shop where he serves clients. His wife who works as a farmer helps him with the heavy family expenses and to pay for his five children's school fees. It is very common in Lebanon to see the two family members’ working to be able to raise their children. 

Today, the borrower is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase merchandise for his grocery store and for the coffee shop to reinforce his business level.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Elias Kiplagat

texts.en:
Elias Kiplagat K., age 23 and unmarried, is a potato farmer in Kapsowar, Kenya. He harvests his potatoes and sells them to his customers at a profit. He has been in this business for about a year now.

Elias was introduced to KADET Ltd by one of our credit officers and he has no other history with any microfinance institute. He is applying for his first loan of Kshs 20,000 with KADET Ltd, which he plans to use to plant more potatoes next season.

In future he hopes to purchase a plot as well as to build rental houses and a family house for his future family.

loans.use: To use toward planting potatoes in the coming season

loans.name: Shabnam's Group

texts.en:
Shabnam (pictured holding the Asasah Passbook) is a homemaker in the city of Kamokay in Pakistan. She has resided for over five years with her husband, brother-in-law, and father-in-law in an area named Aulakh Abad in a two-room brick house. She stays at home and devotes herself to her numerous household responsibilities. She and her husband have no children.  
  
Her brother-in-law is involved in a medicine-selling business. At present, he operates his business from a room of the family house. He has been in this business for over three years and has developed a good reputation among his customers. People come to him to buy medicines to treat their illnesses and diseases.
 
Shabnam has applied for a loan for the first time from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother-in-law's business. With the loan he will buy medicines as well as renting a shop from which he will operate his business and reach a greater number of customers.
  
Shabnam is sure that through this investment her brother-in-law’s business will expand and become more profitable.

loans.use: To buy medicines and to rent a shop from which to operate the pharmacy business

loans.name: No

texts.en:
The woman shown in the picture is Mrs. No S., 55 years old, who lives in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. Mrs. No S. is a housewife and most of her time is spent working in her house, fulfilling her duties of caring for the children, cooking, and other duties.

She has a life partner with her husband, who is on staff in the state sector, and has a proper salary every month. This couple has eight children, two of whom are single, and six of whom are married. Besides working in the house, Mrs. No S. also plants rice crops, which is her annual business. Mrs. No S. is looking for a loan as capital to support her farming business. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela, age 38 (pictured holding the Asasah Passbook), engages in embroidery work in order to financially support her family. She is very skillful in her work and keeps abreast of the latest trends and fashions, which helps her to stay current with her clients' demands. She and her husband, M. J., have four sons, the elder three of whom are enrolled in school. The family lives in a two-room brick house in Kamoki, a small industrial city in Pakistan. 

Jameela's husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He provides transport services to his customers. He also provides pick-up and drop-off facilities to children attending different schools. 

Life is very difficult for the family as it takes a great effort from both Jameela and her husband to manage the household expenses. They work very hard to pay the children’s school fees. Jameela's greatest aspiration is to see them complete their education and become successful in life. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah on behalf of her husband, who wants to repair his rickshaw because its engine is creating problems and doesn’t allow him to work for the hours required to earn a good profit from the business. The fully repaired rickshaw will allow him to work for longer hours and gain more income. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and is confident that it will be a profitable experience for her family.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw used for transportation services

loans.name: Merima

texts.en:
Merima N. is from the village of Saranay, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 48 years old. Merima is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Merima owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Merima has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Merima joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merima has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Merima is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Merima from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 50-year-old married man with three children. He has been working as a baker for over fifteen years. His freshly prepared breads, cookies and sweets are enjoyed by members of his village and neighboring towns. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a car to offer a delivery service to the customers. He is planning to continue expansion of his business and he is positive about the coming year. His bakery is an important source of income for his family. Lebanon has many pastry shops and bakeries and it is easy to buy fresh goods in one’s village or neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase a car to make bakery deliveries

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia (pictured holding the Asasah Passbook) is a homemaker in Kamoki, a small city in Pakistan known for its rice industry. She and her family live in a two-room brick house in an area named Aulakh Abad. She is a very active and caring lady and is devoted to the performance of her numerous household responsibilities.

Nazia's husband, M. S., is a private entrepreneur involved in utensil sales. In his shop, he sells a variety of glass and plastic utensils. He has been in this business for the past seven years and has achieved a good reputation among his customers. 

Nazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will add a greater variety of utensils to his shop, such as spoons, plates, and trays. This expanded inventory will increase his sales. 
 
Nazia is hopeful that a loan investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and improve the financial condition of her family.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of utensils to offer for sale

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea H. is an older woman who has been living in Phnom Penh. Chea H. has learned how to combine different kinds of tree roots for natural medicines and she uses her knowledge to earn an income in order to meet the needs of the family. Chea H. also travels to sell her medicine by walking around her community. She has six children: three are married and live away from home, and the other three are single and live under her management.

Her husband is currently a recycling seller - he buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The used goods he deals in are mostly leftover electrical wires and plastic. Chea H.'s husband wishes to earn extra profit and make the business more successful by expanding his business, but he lacks the funds. So Chea H. will be using her loan to support her husband’s business to purchase a larger amount of used goods to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a larger amount of used goods to sell.

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Fish is the main vital fresh food for everyone, in particular families, and Mrs. Lorn K. L. is among those people currently depending on selling fish at the local busy market. She sells fish that she gets from her wholesale supplier and earns an income of approximately $10 per day by selling fish. Her husband is a fish-paste seller in his community. This couple has given birth to three children, and all of them are single.

Mrs. Lorn K. L. is a hard-working woman who never wastes time while engaging in her business activities. As a result of the increasing needs of her clients, Mrs. Lorn K. L. is applying for a loan so she can purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans, age 31 and the father of three children, is a dairy farmer in his home town of Kisii in western Kenya. He sells his produce of maize, bananas, potatoes, and kale at the local market.

He has applied for a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes this will improve his income and ensure that his children get a good education. He aspires to expand his farm to two cows over the next five years. He works as a mason for additional income.

Lack of finances remain Evan's greatest challenge in business. He is very happy to be able to benefit from Juhudi's loan provision initiative.

loans.use: The purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La sra. Gloria E. tiene 33 años , es separada y tiene 2 hijos , un varon de 9 años que esta realizando sus estudios primarios y una nena de 4 años.
La misma se dedica a la compra-venta de chatarras , hierros, cobre , bronce y acumuladores en deshuso desde el año 2007.
Para dicho trabajo cuenta con un camion Daihatsu año 1980 que es manejado por un chofer al que paga en forma semanal.
El préstamo solicitado lo invirtio en la compra de dichas mercaderias para la venta a las recicladoras de la zona.
texts.en:
Gloria E. is 33 years old.  She is separated and has 2 children; a 9 year-old boy who is in elementary school and a 4 year-old girl.

Gloria buys and sells scrap metal, iron, copper, bronze and disused storage batteries.  She has been doing this since 2007.

To carry out her work, she has a 1980 Daihatsu truck which has a driver who she pays weekly.

She is requesting this loan to invest in buying more of the aforementioned merchandise which she can sell to recycling companies in the area.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal, iron, bronze, copper and disused storage batteries

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther N., age 32, has operated a retail shop at Tala market for ten years. Tala is a well-populated area and so her business is doing well. She and her husband Alfred, age 41, have one nine-year-old son. Her retail shop business gives her a monthly profit of Kshs 10,000.

Esther was introduced to KADET Ltd by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office. With the loan she has applied for, she intends to increase her stocks of cooking fat, maize flour, wheat flour, sweets, and biscuits to offer for resale in her shop. If the loan boosts the business, she will add more stocks until she can grow the retail shop into a wholesale business.

In future, Esther wants to open a big wholesale shop and give her child a quality education. She describes herself as hard-working.

loans.use: To increase her stocks of cooking fat, maize flour, wheat flour, sweets, and biscuits to offer for resale in her shop

loans.name: Lucy Wangui

texts.en:
Lucy, age 34, is a dairy farmer. She has been in this business for a period of four years now and this is her primary business. She is the mother of three children and lives in the Gathangari area of Kiambu. 

She got to know about KADET Ltd through a friend who was already a member, and she has never borrowed from any other financial institution. With the loan she has applied for, she plans to buy another dairy cow so that she can increase milk yields. This increase will ensure a steady income for her family and herself. 

In future, Lucy plans to open a retail shop so as to diversify her trade. She hopes also to educate her children in the best schools possible.

loans.use: To buy a second dairy cow for increased milk production

loans.name: Batuli

texts.en:
Batuli A. M., age 43 and unmarried, supports her nuclear family. She runs a cafe business in Bombolulu and has operated this business for the last two years with good profits.

This will be her first loan with KADET Ltd and she plans to expand her business by purchasing more foodstuffs such as tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, rice, and maize flour, as well as more chairs for the hotel. She hopes to use the anticipated profits to start another business that she has been considering starting for some time.

Her dream is to live happily and to see her business flourish.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and chairs for her cafe business

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is 46, and is married with 6 children. He lives in Nabatieh, in the south of Lebanon. He has worked as a taxi driver for 28 years and also provides school transportation for the locA. students.

Imad is asking for a loan of $2,500 to pay university fees for his children. He has had a previous loan with A. Majmoua and has always maintained an impeccable repayment history.

loans.use: To pay children's university fees.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has been engaged in mixed farming in his home town of Kisii in western Kenya for ten years. He produces tea, maize, milk, and bananas and sells these locally at market. He is married with four children between the ages of 8 and 2 years.

He has requested this loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes this will raise his family's living standards in terms of food and education. He aspires toward a venture into public transport through the eventual purchase of a vehicle in the next five years.

Price fluctuations in the market for produce like maize and milk are his greatest challenges.

loans.use: The purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Rubare Ole

texts.en:
Rubare Ole K. is 47 years old, married to Nkarana Kimwathi and a father of two children who attend school. Rubare is a businessman involved in the livestock trade and he gets good profits after fattening the animals and later selling then to other clients.

Rubare learned about KADET LTD from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his first loan and he is planning to spend it on more animals to fatten and eventually sell. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his business and become a commercial animal seller.

Rubare‘s dream is do well in this business and start dairy farming. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: buy more animals to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. He operates a fruit selling business in the market where he has a small rented shop. With the loan, he will buy more fresh seasonal fruits to sell through his shop. 
He has been engaged in this business for some time now and Azra is hopeful that a loan investment will bring more profits to his business. 
Azra is the resident of a small city named Vehari in Pakistan. She has been living there with her family in a two room brick house for over 2 years. 
She doesn’t have any children and spends most of her time by doing her household works. She is very helpful person and tries her best to provide comfort to her family by doing her household responsibilities in a timely manner. 
She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She hopes it will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for a fruit selling business

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva N., age 38, sells shoes in Tala market. She is married to Timothy G., who is a driver, and together they have two children:  Brian, age 11, in class seven, and Vivian, age 4, in class four. Silva has been in business for 7 years and her monthly income is 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Tala office. With a loan of 20,000 KES, she will increase her stock of shoes. If the loan boosts the business, Silva will open another shop for selling clothes so as to increase her profits.

Silva describes herself as hardworking and in the future she dreams of owning a company for clothes and shoes. This will enable her to give quality education to her children.

loans.use: To increase her stock of shoes for sale

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat M., 53 years old, sells shoes In Tala market. He is married to Felistar Waithira who is 36 years old and together they have three children, Mary is 18 years old and Samuel is 16 years old. Both are in high school. Elizabeth is 14 years old and in primary school. His customers come to buy shoes on market days and are happy with his choices. He has been in this business for a period of two years and his monthly income is Kshs 16,000.

He was introduced to Kadet by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office. With the loan of Kshs 40,000, he will increase his stock of shoes. If the loan boosts the business, Josphat will pay school fees for his children, as the fee is quite high.

Josphat describes himself as hardworking and trustworthy. In the future, he dreams of expanding his business to a wholesale business.

loans.use: To increase his stock of shoes to sell

loans.name: Asmat's Group

texts.en:
Asmat lives with her family in a small city called Vehari in Pakistan. She lives there in a small home of 3 rooms in the area named Jhedo. 
She has given birth to 2 daughters and 2 sons. All of them are attending school and getting their education. Asmat wants them to finish their education and that’s why she works very hard. She sews clothes for her local clients on order. She is good at her work and receives many orders every month. The money she earns helps her to pay her children’s school fees and the utilities expenses. 
She is married to M. Y. who is involved in an animal selling business. He buys young animals from the animal markets at cheap rates, raises them and sells them to customers. 
Asmat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy young animals (goats & cows) and sell them for good profits. He has been doing this business for the past 25 years and has good experience in his field. 
Asmat is hopeful that a loan investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and as a result her family will enjoy more financial benefits. 
She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy young goats and cows to raise and sell.

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en:
Annastacia M. is a 36-year-old widow. She has one adult daughter, Colleta, who is employed. Annastacia runs a grocery shop at Umoja 1 Estate, which is a well-populated, medium class estate. She sells potatoes, onions, maize, and beans, amongst other things. She has been running this business for 12 years, and her monthly income is 30,000 KES.
Annastacia was introduced to Kadet by other existing clients of Kadet. With a loan of 30,000 KES, she intends to increase her income and increase her stocks of potatoes, onions, maize, beans, and rice for sale. If the loan boosts the business, she will open another branch of her business.
Annastacia describes herself as hardworking and responsible, and she dreams that one day she will be able to buy a piece of land and develop it.

loans.use: To increase stocks of potatoes, onions, maize, beans, and rice for sale

loans.name: Amina Hassan

texts.en:
Amina Hassan B. is a 50-year-old hardworking woman. She is married to James Sheikh, and together they have three children, ages 6 years, 3 years, and 2 years. Amina has been operating a boutique shop for about seven years, and she earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES.
When she learned of KADET from a staff member, she joined, and she has now applied for her first loan of 30,000 KES, which she intends to use to buy a stock of bags, bangles, new clothes, caps, and jackets. She plans to use the profits to expand her business.
Amina hopes to grow her business and to become the leading local investor. She also hopes to see her children realize their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: To buy a stock of bags, bangles, new clothes, caps, and jackets

loans.name: Bashiran Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran Bibi lives in the mid-sized city of Vehari in Pakistan. She has lived there with her family in a three-room brick house for the last three years. Her husband is a driver by profession, and he drives a tractor in the fields. He works in the fields from day to night but earns very little, which does not allow him to fulfill the basic needs of his family. This is why he has decided to start a grocery store business. He thinks that if he spends his strength on his own business, then it will be returned with good profits. Through the grocery store he will sell daily use items, such as salt, sugar, tea, spice, cooking oil, and rice, to the customers.
This is why Bashiran has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah. She is hopeful that a loan investment will help her husband to start a new business in a positive way, and it will help her family enjoy a better standard of living.
Bashiran is a housewife. She stays at home and does her household work. She has a one-year-old daughter. She takes care of her very well.
Bashiran is a new client of Asasah, and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy groceries to start a grocery store business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel O. is 44 years old and married to Noleka. They live in the Ekwanda area in Kisumu, and they have five children: Nancy (18 years old), Faith (17 years old), Ruth (13 years old), Boniface (10 years old), and Sedrine (8 years old).
Samuel has a retail shop that he runs, and it is in dire need of more stock, including soaps, cooking oil, baking flour, and soft drinks. He has applied for his third loan from KADET to enable him to buy the stock. He hopes to use the profits to pay school fees for his children and also to provide for his family's upkeep.
His desire is to one day open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy soaps, cooking oil, baking flour, and soft drinks

loans.name: Firyal

texts.en:
Firyal has been selling clothing, door to door, for the past 11 years. She is married with 2 children and lives in Saida, in the south of Lebanon.

This is Firyal's 7th loan with Al Majmoua and the extra income generated from previous loans allowed Firyal to contribute to her son's wedding as well as to paint her home.

Firyal is now requesting a loan of $2500 to buy more clothing & Brazillian gold to sell. She sells to her friends, neighbours, and anybody she comes across.

Firyal feels that she is a very brave and courageous businesswoman and wishes to help her family by contributing to the household expenses, improving all of their lives.

One day, Firyal dreams of opening her own shop and not having to go door-to-door to sell her wares.

loans.use: To buy clothing & Brazillian gold to sell.

loans.name: Kilima

texts.en:
J. is a 40-year-old businesswoman who is married to a public service vehicle driver. J. and her husband support a family of three. J. runs a second hand shoe shop which she started 5 years ago. From this business, she earns a profit of 5000 Kenyan shillings a month.

She is borrowing her second loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings which she intends to use to buy more shoes to sell during the Christmas season. She anticipates profits from the business which she plans to save and use in the future to buy a land lot for building rental houses.

Her hope is to become an excellent businesswoman and also to expand her business to selling new shoes as well as second hand shoes.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El Sr. Pablo  tiene  48  y esta  de pareja desde hace tiempo con la  Sra. Mirian quien trabaja en en la confección de Canaleta de Chapas  Galbanizadas para las casas esta actividad lo viene realizando desde el año 1998 el forma Independiente ya que anteriormente trabajaba para un Patrón, pero luego  Independizo y le fue muy bien porque también vende las Chapas o otro hojalateros. 
Actualmente tiene un vehiculo en que quiere trabajar como taxista y debe pagar.
Este crédito va invertía en la compra de una Parada de Taxi para su Hijo quien es el que tiene el Automóvil especial de ellos. 
La ubicación de la Parada esta Hubicada frente al IPS de luque, es una parada nueva donde estam trabajando recien tres Autovil como Taxi
texts.en:
Pablo is 48 years old and has been in a relationship with Mirian for some time.  Pablo makes galvanized gutters for houses.  He has been in this business since 1998 and he works for himself.  He used to work for a boss but then he became self employed which went very well because he also sells sheets of metal to other tinsmiths.

Pablo currently has a vehicle in which he would like to work as a taxi driver but he must pay to do so.  This loan will be used to pay for the right to pick passengers up from a specific location in the town.  This will be for Pablo's son, as he is the one who owns the vehicle.  The taxi pick-up location is opposite the 'Institución de Previsión Social de Luque' (a Social Security Hospital in the town of Luque).  It is a new pick up spot where three taxis are working.

loans.use: To pay for the right to use a certain taxi pick-up location

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana lives in Vehari, a small city located in the province of Punjab, Pakistan, and famous for its agricultural industry. She lives there with her family in a two-room brick house.
 
Her husband’s name is M. A.. He operates a grocery store. He has a shop in the market from which he sells daily-use items, such as sugar, tea, spices, cooking oil, and rice, to his customers. He has been doing this business for over five years.
  
Rukhsana herself is a housewife and also a businesswoman. She has a set routine that involves getting up early, finishing the household chores, and getting milk from the buffalo which she keeps at her home.
