She has a good clientele base in her neighboring areas and sells them milk to supplement the income of her family. She has been doing this work for over three years.
  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more groceries to improve his grocery store. Rukhsana is hopeful that a loan investment will take her husband’s business to a more profitable position.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 24-year-old single man living with his parents. He has been working in construction for the past seven years. In 2007, he started taking on projects on his own. He is especially talented at completing woodworking projects. 

The borrower and his father are the only providers for their family. Over time, his business is getting bigger and he wants to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additionA. tools needed in order to reinforce his business and be able to take on more projects. 

In the future, he is looking to continue the expansion of his business and to further increase his productivity. He expects that his business will continue to be successful in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools

loans.name: Dickson Kuya

texts.en:
Dickson Kuya K. is 27-years-old, married to Koitoi K., and he is father of two school going children. Dickson is a businessman involved in buying and selling of cows and he has been doing this for the last ten years. 

Dickson learnt about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan. He is planning to buy more cows. He will fatten the cows for about five months, then he will take them to the market to sell. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire land for farming to increase his income.

His future dream is that he will be able to do well in business. His hope and dream is to become a large scale and commercial business man.

loans.use: To more cows and sell them after five months.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace O. is 24 years old and is from the Khisero area in Kakamega. She is married to Charles and they have a daughter who is 2 years old.

Grace is in the business of selling fabric that her clients buy to make nice outfits from. She normally stocks the African textiles known as “Kitenge”. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a client. She will use the money to add more textiles to her inventory to enable her to meet the demands of her clients.

Her desire is to be able to open up a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Emeua Adjoa Akyeniwa

texts.en: Emeua Adjoa Akyeniwa O. is married and has four children. She sells provisions and food items at Abura. Her husband is a carpenter. Emeua assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Emeua will use the loan to purchase other food items her customers have been requesting. With the new profits from her expanded business, Emeua wishes to buy land.

loans.use: To purchase other food items her customers have been requesting.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena A. is a palm oil extractor at Abura, which she has been doing for ten years. Abena is a widow taking care of two children. She sees to the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy additional palm fruits to process for oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further her children's education.

This picture shows Abena processing the oil.

loans.use: To buy additional palm fruits to process for oil.

loans.name: Biyogo

texts.en:
Biyogo, a 48-year-old married father of six children, five of whom are students, does mixed farming in his hometown of Kisii in Western Kenya. He produces tea, milk, beans and maize, all sold within the local market.

Biyogo has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow, hopeful that the loan will help uplift the family financially with its gains. He aspires to have three dairy cows in five years. Biyogo's major problem is limited finances for the purchase of farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides for animal sprays.

He remains grateful for Juhudi's loan services.

loans.use: The purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa A. is married and has six dependants. Adjoa sells banku (cassava dumpling) and serves it with hot pepper sauce and fried fish at Abura, which she has been doing for six years. Her husband is a farmer. Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband in feeding, clothing and educating her children. Adjoa will add the loan to her income to expand her banku business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to buy land.

loans.use: To expand her banku business.

loans.name: Issam

texts.en: Issam is a 47 years old married man who lives in Nabatieh with his wife and four kids. He has worked as a blacksmith for 27 years. Issam is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the fourth time, in order to buy extra iron for his industry. Issam’s clients believe in his good quality of work, and he hopes to expand his business in the future and open a big factory that can ensure a good living and education for his family members.

loans.use: To buy iron.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 39-year-old married man living with his wife and three children. He has earned his living as an experienced construction worker for the past sixteen years. He is especially talented at completing woodworking projects. He works hard to be able to raise his three children and meet their needs. 

Over the years, he has built up a good business reputation and gained a good number of construction entrepreneurs who regularly ask for his services. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase wood for his newest project. In the future, he is looking to continue the expansion of his business and to further increase his productivity. He expects that his business will continue to be successful in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a 30-year-old husband and father of 3 children. He was raised in a farm which has been owned by his family since 1980. He has a small cow-raising farm. He produces all kinds of dairy products. He is well known in his community and has an excellent reputation.

He applied for a $1800 loan to build a small barn and to buy a cow. He aims to grow bigger, expand his business, and widen the line of production

loans.use: Build a small barn and buy a cow

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old and a married man. His family has owned a farm since 1980 and he was raised to be a farmer. He owns a small cow-raising farm. He produces all kinds of dairy products. He is well known in his community and has an excellent reputation.

He applied for a $1800 loan to buy 2 cows. He is planning to extend the farm and expand his business so he will increase his production.

loans.use: Buy two cows

loans.name: Grace Adjoa Nkrumah

texts.en: Grace Adjoa Nkrumah O. is married and has six dependants. She produces locally made soap and palm kernel oil at Abura for sale. Her husband is a pastor. Grace assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more palm kernels to produce oil for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernels to produce oil for sale.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah M. is 30 years old and is married to a man who is an editor and publisher by profession. Together, they have one five-year-old daughter who is in primary school. Zipporah is a tailor and she also sells used clothes at the Githurai 44 market. She has been running this business for 6 years and she makes a monthly profit of 7,800 Kenyan shillings. Her husband supports her in providing for the daily needs of their family.

She was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Thika Road office. With the loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she plans to use half to buy fabrics for making clothes and uniforms since children will require new ones in the month of January after the Christmas holiday, while the other half will be used to buy more used clothes for resale. If this loan boosts her business then Zipporah will buy more fabrics to grow her business. She would like to open a bigger shop and employ some people to help her. In the future, Zipporah dreams of expanding her business and hiring employees to increase her profit which she will use to buy a piece of land and build her own home with her family.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for making clothes and to purchase used clothes.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice E. sells foodstuffs such as cassavas at Abura. She has not acquired any form of education. She is married to a fisherman and together they live with their three children. Beatrice has been selling cassavas for two years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy additional foodstuffs to meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further her children's education.

Beatrice is displaying some of the cassavas she sells.

loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Samson Kenana

texts.en:
Samson Kenana K. is 20 years-old. He is married to Longisa K. and he is a father of two children aged nine months and two years. Samson is a businessman and he has been buying and selling beans and potatoes for the past four years.
  
Samson learned about KADET from a member of a group within his locality that was registered with KADET. This will be his first loan and he is planning to spend Kshs 50,000 to buy more beans and potatoes to sell to his clients. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to buy young rams to raise and sell.

His dream is to become successful in his business and known countrywide

loans.use: buying more beans and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Araba Tamfo Mary

texts.en: Araba Tamfo Mary Y. is a widow. She fried fish for sale at Abura. She has been in this trade for three years. The income she generates from her sales is used to take care of herself. Araba will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to fry to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to buy land.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to fry to expand her business.

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a 36-year-old husband and father of four children. 

Houssein has been the owner of a turnery since 1995. Since he is very experienced in this field, he has an excellent reputation and he is well known in his community.

After benefiting from his prior loan, now he is applying for a $3,000 loan to buy a big generator. He aims to expand his business to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a big generator

loans.name: Wilfred Kimutai

texts.en:
Wilfred Kimutai K. has been selling new clothes in Eldoret for the past nine years. From this business he is able to earn a profit of Kshs 15,500 per month. Wilfred is 31 years old, married to Hellen Cheplagat Mutai and they have one child who is 4 years old. 

He is applying for his seventh loan from KADET LTD of KES 50,000 after successfully paying back his other loans. He plans to use the funds to buy supplies of various kinds of new clothes to sell, especially during this festive season. With the anticipated profits from the expanded business, he plans to open a business for the wife in Iten town. 

In the future Wilfred wishes to operate a large boutique and create job opportunities for other people.  His deeper desire is to live a good and blessed life.

loans.use: To buy various kinds of  new clothes

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka G. is a single lady from Mshomoroni. She has been in the eggs selling business for the last two years and her business has been a success.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD and she plans to add more inventory of eggs into her business. She hopes to get many orders which will increase her profits and enable her to grow as she reinvests back into the business.

Her dream is to live happily with her future family.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of eggs for her business

loans.name: Phelesia

texts.en:
Phelsia Ogoye is 33 years old, married to Charles and they have two children, aged 10 years and 5 years old. They live in Khiwesoro in Kakamega area.

Phelsia has a cereals business that she runs in the market. She has been doing this business for the past 2 years and has created some loyal clientele. She is applying for a loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy eight (8) bags of maize to add to her current stock. She makes a profit of Kshs 9,000 every month.

Her desire and hope is to be the major distributor of cereals to the colleges and schools around her neighborhood.

loans.use: Buy 8 sacks of maize

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a 55-year-old husband and supporter of five children.

In 2005, Abbas decided to open his own food market. He is well known where he lives and has a good reputation.

After benefiting from his prior loans, now he is applying for a $2,500 loan to carry out some innovations at his shop and buy more inventories. He plans to expand and enlarge his business and provide a wide variety of products.

loans.use: To carry out some innovations at the shop and buy more inventories

loans.name: Hezekiah

texts.en:
Hezekiah hails from Kisii Town in Western Kenya. He is 67 and is married with 9 children, the majority are now adults. He has been in mixed farming for 20 years with his produce of coffee, maize, tea, sugarcane, bananas and milk sold locally  and to established co-operative societies.

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and maintain a dairy cow. He believes this will provide enough milk for the family and pay the education fees to educate children. He is also focusing on buying a vehicle in the next five years to help transport his produce to the market.

Hezekiah sees insecurity, low market prices and diseases as the greatest threats to the business.

loans.use: Purchase and maintain a dairy cow

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en:
Sonya S. is 58 years old; she is a widow and lives in Yerevan with her son, daughter-in-law and 3 granddaughters. She has high school education and 26 years of experience as a mathematics teacher.
 
After retiring on a pension, Sonya refused to be out of work and 8 years ago she decided to organize her own business: women’s clothes and underwear trading. Owing to this fact, she shares their family’s expenses with her son. Sonya is renting a trading stall in the most popular trade market in Yerevan.

Sonya says she likes her present business very much and she is very happy that she has her occupation in her mature age. Sonya received loans from Nor Horizon 10 times without repayment delay.

Sonya is asking for a 750.000 Armenian drams loan to buy winter clothes assortment of sweaters, jackets and other outerwear for her business.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes assortment for her business.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El comité Fortaleza nace hace más de dos años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de Capiata, en estos más de dos años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras. 
Una de las integrantes de este comite es la señora Saida quien se dedica a la venta empanadas y bebidas.
Ella posee un puesto en un lugar muy concurrido y ahi mismo posee todas su herramientas de trabajo para la preparación y coccion de sus alimentos.
Tambien cuenta con una conservadora en el cual enfria sus bebidas. 
Comenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado pero que es la que mantiene a su familia y quiere continuar con el mismo.
Actualmente el precio de la carne, insumo princual de sus comestibles esta muy cara y solicita el prestamo para la compra del mismo y tambie para la compra de bebidas especialmente gaseosa de diferentes gustos.
texts.en:
The Fortaleza [Fortitude] Committee, located in Capiata, was born two years ago with the guidance and support of another committee that was operating in the same place.  In those more than two years of intense work they have grown socially as well as financially.  They are well-known in their area as very hard working women.

One member, Saida, is a vendor of empanadas and drinks.  She has a stand in a high-traffic location and she's got all the tools of the trade for preparing and cooking her meals, along with a cooler for chilling the drinks.  

Saida says that the work requires self-sacrifice but it supports the family and she wants to keep with it.  Currently, the price of meat, her main ingredient, is very high, and she's seeking a loan to purchase some and to buy drinks, particularly different flavored sodas.

loans.use: To buy drinks and meats.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: El señor Rafael T. es un alegre y saludable señor de 81 años que se dedica al comercio de mercancías como ropa, calzado y  electrodomésticos menores. Esta actividad la realiza desde 1996, año en que se vinculó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y de la cual ha recibido 10 préstamos. La clientela del microempresario está formada principalmente por amigos pensionados. El señor Rafael manifiesta que le encanta su trabajo porque esto le permite estar activo y sobretodo visitar muchos almacenes y centros comerciales en busca de promociones. Su volumen mensual de ventas es en promedio de $2.000.000 y su margen de utilidad es del 30% al 35%. Generalmente concede un plazo de 30 a 45 días para que le paguen en dos o tres partidas. El crediKiva que está tramitando planea invertirlo en la compra de ropa exterior y calzado para hombres. El microempresario planea en un futuro no lejano abrir un local para ofrecer sus productos y hacer tertulias con sus clientes que también son sus amigos. La intensa temporada invernal que azota a la ciudad le ha ocasionado disminución en las ventas y dificultad para movilizarse, pero se muestra optimista por la cercanía del verano y la temporada navideña que es la mejor del año. El señor Rafael tiene tres hijos que le apoyan totalmente en su negocio porque genera ingresos para su hogar y sobretodo porque la actividad física lo mantiene en un perfecto estado de salud.
texts.en:
Rafael T. is a happy and healthy 81 year-old man who sells clothes, footwear and small electrical appliances.  He has been in this business since 1996, the year he first joined Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, from whom he has now received 10 loans.

This small businessman's customers are mainly his pensioner friends.  Rafael says that he loves his work because it allows him to remain active and above all it allows him to visit many stores and shopping centers in search of sales promotions.  His monthly sales volume is on average $2,00,000 and his profit margin is between 30% and 35%.  He generally gives his customers 30 – 45 days to pay for their goods in 2 or 3 instalments.

Rafael plans to invest this Kiva loan in buying men's clothes and footwear.  His plans for the not-so-distant future are to open his own premises where he can sell his products and chat with his customers who are also his friends.  The cold winter season which has been hitting the city has caused his sales to fall and also made it difficult to get around but he is optimistic about the approaching summer and the Christmas period which is the best season of the year.  Rafael has three children who support him completely in his business because it makes income for his household and, above all, because the physical activity keeps him in a perfect state of health.

loans.use: To buy men's clothes and footwear

loans.name: Faustinah Syombua

texts.en:
Faustinah is a 35 years old married woman and a mother of two children, aged 5 years and 10 years. She lives in Makueni which is a rural- urban centre. She has a stall where she sells new clothes and especially men's wear. This is her primary business which she has been doing for a number of years now.

Her clients are mainly the residents of Wote, which is near Makueni town. She got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member. She has never borrowed from other financial institutions. 

With this loan that she has applied for, she plans to add more stock by buying items like; shirts, trousers, and t-shits to be able to meet the demand for her clothes in the month of December which is normally a peak season.

loans.use: To restock her shop with more clothes like shirts, trousers etc

loans.name: Sabathwa Group

texts.en:
Ntombiyesipho Nester is 55 years old and single with 4 children, between 18 and 30 years old, and 1 dependent. She runs a live stock chicken shop in Empangeni in South Africa. In the photo above, she is standing on the left wearing a gold sweater.

She's been in this business for two years and sells chickens at a general store. She also earns income from an old age pension. She says that the main challenges to her business are the deaths of chickens.

She requested this loan through Women's Development Businesses to buy live stock chickens to sell in her store. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay her previous loan, add more stock, earn profit and save more of her money. In the future, she would like to see the growth of her business and have more employees.

loans.use: To buy chickens to sell in her store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rosemary M. is 41 years old from Ngiya area in Siaya. She is married to Bethwel and they have four children; two girls above 18 years of age and two boys who are below the age of 18 years. 

Rosemary has a timber business that she operates and she has been doing this for the past 6 years. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully completing her first loan. She will use the money to buy more timber stock for resale. The profits made from this business will be used to pay school fees for her children and also cater for the family’s need. 

Her desire is to be able to open up a furniture workshop in the future.

loans.use: Buy more timber and add to her stock

loans.name: Wellingtone

texts.en:
Wellingtone O. is 56 years old from Khwisero area in Kakamega. He is married to Lona and they have two children who are in college; aged 24 and 20 years old.

Wellingtone is a tailor in the market of Khwisero and has been in this business for the past 12 years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who is also a client here. He wants to use the money to buy another sewing machine as the one he has is old and is not functioning well. He is also getting ready for the festive season where orders for making new clothes are many.

His desire is to be able to open up a tailoring school in the future.

loans.use: Buy another sewing machine.

loans.name: Marasua Ole

texts.en:
Marasua Ole K. is 37-years-old. He is married to Naisuaku Ene Kasoe and he is a father of four school going children. Marasua is a businessman involved in buying and selling of sheep which he has been doing this for the last 10 years. 

Marasua learnt about KADET from a colleague who is already a registered client. This will be his first loan which he is planning to spend the Kshs 50,000 to buy young bulls for fattening and later sell at a profit. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to use to meet for the basic needs of his family. 

His future dream is that he will be able to do well in business whereby he can become a commercial businessman. He is a hardworking man who is focused to his set goals.

loans.use: to buy young bulls to fattening and sell

loans.name: Tumalel Ole

texts.en:
Tumalel Ole P. is 30 years old, married to Margaret Setek and a father of five children aged between two to ten years old. Tumalel is a wheat farmer in Narok area and this has been his livelihood for the last five years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan which he is planning to use to prepare his thirteen acres of land for wheat planting in the next planting season. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land. He is a hardworking man and with the right resources he can do great things.

loans.use: to prepare his thirteen acres of land for wheat farming

loans.name: Elimelda

texts.en:
Elimelda is a mother six and has been doing mixed farming in her hometown of Kisii in Western Kenya. She has employed one farmhand and sells her produce of maize, vegetables and milk locally.

She has requested this loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and maintain a dairy cow. She plans to use the income to pay school fees. She gets her additional income from her employment as a market attendant at the local market. She is focusing on having three dairy cows in five years.

Price fluctuations and heavy rains and hailstorms are the greatest disappointments.

loans.use: Purchase and maintain a dairy cow

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth A. aged 34 years is a business lady who sells dry fish in Dandora estate. She is married to John Waga and together they have three children, Willis aged 15 years who is in high school, Billy aged 13 and Cynthia aged 10 years who are both is lower primary school. She has been running this business for a period of 4 years and her monthly income is Kshs 10,000.

She was introduced to KADET by other existing clients and she has applied for a loan of Kshs 15000. She plans to use Kshs 13,500 to buy more stocks of fish and Kshs  and Kshs 1,500 for transport it to her business premise. If the loan boosts the business Ruth will add more stocks to expand her business.

Ruth dreams of being a big supplier of different types of fish to many towns.

loans.use: To increase stocks of fish for sale.

loans.name: Margenis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Margenis del Carmen es una mujer de Pueblo Nuevo, un municipio ubicado en el departamento de Córdoba, donde pasó la mayor parte de su vida para luego llegar a Barranquilla,  donde se casó y nacieron  sus dos hijos, que ahora están en las   edades de 8 y 12 años.
 Margenis se dedica  a la fabricación de prendas de vestir, que inició una vez quedó sin su empleo en la zona Franca de Barranquilla, donde inició como auxiliar de servicios generales y logró ser jefe de calidad  y diseño,  mientras  se  capacitaba  en todo lo relacionado con las operaciones de la confección y se perfeccionaba mediante el trabajo formal.  Con su experiencia de 12 años fue como nació su gran empresa,  que hoy  cuenta con dos operarias y sus líneas principales son la  femenina  y masculina; Margenis  tiene una clientela fija ubicada en su natal Pueblo Viejo  y también en Barranquilla en estas dos partes, vende sus diseños mediante crédito, de acuerdo a sus posibilidades y a las de sus clientes; tiene además un contrato con una importante empresa a quien le confecciona y recupera su inversión a los 45 días.   Cuando Margenis comenzó su negocio compró su maquinaria a crédito y gradualmente fue respondiendo a su obligación, hasta cumplir con ella en su totalidad. Aunque su negocio inició en firme hace 4 años, hace dos lo legalizó, para acceder a  mercados mas formales. Con su Credikiva, primer financiamiento de Margenis con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  comprará materias primas e insumos como telas, hilos, pellón, correderas, para poder cumplir con los pedidos  ella a través de su proceso que consiste en : Diseñar, cortar, preparara, ensamblar, filetear y controlar la calidad, elaborará vestidos femeninos, para venderlos, con ello  planea  obtener una utilidad aproximada del 25%, para continuar  creciendo y reinvirtiendo en esta época decembrina, que es de mucho repunte en las ventas para cualquier tipo de negocio. 
Su gran sueño es convertir su negocio en un taller de alta costura reconocido,   con muchos empleados y con un local propio. Sus principales desafíos son la falta de capital cuando hay muchos pedidos pero siempre se las ingenia para recuperar su cartera y poder cumplir con lo que recupera, y es que del capital que reúna y apalanque depende el cumplimiento de su sueño.
texts.en:
Margenis del Carmen is a woman from Pueblo Nuevo, a town in Córdoba department, which is where she spent most of her life.  She then moved to Barranquilla where she married and had two children who are now 8 and 12 years old.

Margenis makes clothes.  She started her business when she lost her job in the free-trade zone in Barranquilla.  She started work as a general services assistant and rose to become head of quality and design, while she trained in everything related to clothes making and perfected her skills through her formal job.

With 12 years of experience, she started her business which today employs two workers.  Her main lines are women's and men's clothing.  Margenis has regular customers in her home town of Pueblo Nuevo and also in Barranquilla.  She sells her designs in these two places.  She sells on credit according to her own situation and that of her customers.  She also has a contract with an important company for which she makes clothing and recovers her investment in 45 days.

When Margenis started her business she bought her machinery on credit and paid back bit by bit until it was completely paid for.  Although she started her business 4 years ago, she made it fully legal 2 years ago so that she could access more formal markets.

This Kiva loan is Margenis' first one with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy raw materials and supplies such as fabric, threads, sheepskin and zippers so that she can fill the orders which she has.  Her production process is: designing, cutting, preparing, assembling, filleting and quality control.  She will make women's outfits to sell and hopes to make profits of approximately 25% on that activity so that she can continue to grow and reinvest in this December period which sees sales increase for all businesses.

Margenis' greatest dream is to turn her business into a well-known, haute couture workshop with many employees and her own premises.  Her main challenge is the lack of capital when there are many orders to fill.  However, she always devises some way of recovering her wallet and being able to manage with what she recovers.  Fulfilling her dream depends on the money that she manages to get hold of and leverage.

loans.use: To buy fabric, threads, sheepskin and zippers so that she can fill her orders

loans.name: Takussan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TAKUSSAN est créé le 19 décembre 2001. Il est composé de 09 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elles se sont organisées par proximité et par affinité. Le groupe de solidarité fait partie du Banc Villageois de SOURWACOUNDA.

Madame Fatou B., à droite de la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle âgée 60 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 06 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés.

Elle s'active dans la vente de sucre. Elle s'approvisionne à Ziguinchor, environs à une trentaine de kilomètres pour revendre dans son village.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'accroitre ses bénéfices. 

Son objectif est de participer au payement de la scolarité de ses enfants et soutenir son époux dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The Takussan solidarity group was created December 19, 2001. It consists of nine women from the same village who came together as neighbors and through bonds of affinity. The group is part of the Banc Villageois SOURWACOUNDA.

Mrs. Fatou B., seen at the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the head of the group. She is 60 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She is also responsible for six other children who were entrusted to her.

She sells sugar for a living. She buys her stocks in Ziguinchor, about thirty miles away, for resale in her village.

With her new loan, she will increase her stocks in order to bolster her profits.

Her goal is to help pay for her children’s tuition, and to help her husband support the family.

loans.use: To buy sugar

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter N. aged 37 years operates two retail shops at Soweto slums and Utawala Estate. Soweto is a well populated slum area and so Peter’s business does well.  He is married to Justina Mumbua and together they have three children, Nicholas aged 11 years, Catherine aged 8 years who are both in primary school in class four and Mary aged 4 years in pre-kindergarten.  He has been in business for 12 years and earns a monthly profit of Kshs 30 000.

Peter was introduced to Kadet by the credit officer in charge of Eastlands office. Since his Utawala business was opened recently, Peter intends to use the loan of Kshs 60,000 to increase its stocks of sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking fat, hair braids, mobile phone airtime cards and sodas for resale. If the loan boosts the business, he will add more stocks until he can grow the retail shops to a wholesale business.

In the future Peter wants to open a big wholesale shop and raise his children up without struggles, giving them a quality education. He also dreams of buying a piece of land to build rental houses. He describes himself as hardworking and responsible.

loans.use: To increase stocks of sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking fat, hair braids, Airtime cards and sodas.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 42 year old married man living in Nabatieh with his wife and child. Ali works selling fruits and vegetables in his van, travelling from one town to another. His clients wait for him every day; they know his time to pass by so they expect him every day. His clients say that the quality he sells is perfect and that’s why they wait for him from every day. Ali has 18 years of experience in this field; he’s requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to renew his van, because it’s his essential source for living. He hopes to open a big market for selling fruits and vegetables in the future.

loans.use: To renew his van.

loans.name: Robert Ntinai

texts.en:
Robert Ntinai S. is 25 years old. He married to Leitato Sopia and a father of two children aged four and three years. Robert is a wheat farmer and he has been doing this for the last eight years.

Robert learned about KADET from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to use to prepare land for wheat planting. Wheat does well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Robert’s dream is do large scale farming and start dairy farming. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare land for wheat planting

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace M., aged 37 years operates a salon business at Pipeline Estate. She is married to Justus Muthiani and together they have one daughter Wayua aged 11 years and in primary school. She has been running this Salon for a period of 1 years and her monthly income is Kshs 15000.

Grace was introduced to Kadet by other Kadet existing clients. Since we are approaching the Christmas holiday, Grace expects business to go up so she intends to use the loan of Kshs 30,000 to increase her stocks of weaves, hair pieces, and hair chemicals so that she is prepared in this season when business booms.  If the loan boosts the business, Grace will open another Salon and a beauty shop.

Grace dreams of being a millionaire one day with a boutique and salon in Nairobi town. She describes herself as hardworking and jovial.

loans.use: To increase stocks of weaves, hair pieces, and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Ana Guillermina

texts.es:
Ana de 53 años, confecciona y cose ropa en su casa. Vive en una zona periurbana ubicada a las afuera de Guayaquil llamada Duran y caracterizada por su ecología de disolución. 

Desde pequeña ella aprendió a coser para tener una oportunidad de trabajar independientemente. Inicio cosiendo y confecciona ropa a sus vecinos y amigos poco a poco pudo comprar su propia máquina de coser y ahora ya tiene un número definido de clientes. En la actualidad tienen su taller de costura y confección en su casa, trabaja sola de lunes a viernes haciendo ropa por pedido y enmendándola.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una máquina de coser  para ser más productiva. En el futuro quiere tener distintas maquinas de coser y contratar personal para tener más pedidos.
texts.en:
Ana is 53 years old.  She makes and sews clothes in her home.  She lives in a peri-urban area on the outskirts of Guayaquil which is called Duran.  The area is noted for its deteriorating ecosysetm.

Ana learned to sew from an early age so that she would be able to work independently.  She began sewing and making clothes for her neighbors and friends.  She was eventually able to buy her own sewing machine and now she has a fixed number of customers.  She currently has her sewing and dressmaking workshop in her home.  She works alone from Monday through Friday, making clothes to order and also mending clothes.

She will use her loan to buy a new sewing machine so that she can be more productive.  In the future she would like to have a number of different sewing machines and to hire staff so that she can fill more orders.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and insurance of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Allah Jawai's Group

texts.en:
Allah jawai lives in a city called Jaranwala which is located in Punjab province and is known for its agriculture industry in Pakistan. She lives there in the area named Mughalpura in a 2 roomed brick house with her family. She came here 3 years ago. She doesn’t have any children yet. So to spend her time she does her household responsibilities and also weaves carpets. She is an expert in her work and makes very good quality carpets on order. She receives orders from carpet sellers and earns well by fulfilling the orders on time. Her husband is a loader by profession. He uses his donkey cart to load different items such as construction supplies and fruits & vegetables. He offers good loading services to his clients by delivering their items to the designated places safely.  

Allah jawai has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband in purchasing of a new donkey cart, because his old cart has become rough and rotten. His work is being affected and he is losing his customer base. She is hopeful that a new cart will help her husband's business and to retain his clients as well. 

Allah jawai is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that an investment in her husband’s business will take his business to a more profitable position and she will be able to repay the loan easily. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Allah jawai.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana Q., una mujer  casada de 68 años que  goza de un gran dinamismo  en cuestiones de negocios, ella es   madre de 6 hijos en las edades  de 24 a 46 años y tiene el negocio de vender mercancías variadas, como o ropa, calzado, cosméticos, fantasías y  en general todo lo que le encargan sus clientes,  porque  ella solo se mueve entre vecinos, familiares y empleados conocidos y que le recomiendan,   estrategia  que aplica para mantener sus cuentas por cobrar  saludables. 
Juana inició su negocio desde el año 1970 y con él ha obtenido muchos logros graduales especialmente desde que está vinculada a esta organización, porque  sus ingresos han mejorado, en tanto que su  margen de utilidad es del 28% y proyecta un margen con su nuevo crédito de 32%, por razones del incremento en sus ventas debido a la temporada de fin de año, epoca en la que repuntan sus ventas  y a la inyección de capital de trabajo para comprar de contado; su credikiva es el séptimo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará prendas de fantasía, cosméticos y ropa que tiene encargada para este fin de año. Su sueño y gran desafío  es tener una casa propia y continuar prosperando en los negocios, imprimiéndole dinámica a sus actividades comerciales y por el apoyo recibido con los créditos para poder aumentar su capital de trabajo que en la actualidad es de $2.280.000 COP.
texts.en:
Juana Q. is 68 years old, married and a very enterprising woman when it comes to business matters.  She is the mother of 6 children ranging in age from 24 to 46 years old.  She also has a business selling a variety of merchandise such as clothing, footwear, cosmetics, fancy clothing and in general,  anything that her customers order.  She travels to take orders from her neighbors, family and working people that she knows and those that are recommended to her, a strategy that she uses to keep her accounts receivable healthy.   

Juana started her business in 1970 and has gradually achieved a great deal, especially since she started working with this organization.  She has increased her income, her profit margin is 28%, and she projects that her profit margin will increase to  32% with this new loan.  This is due to an increase in sales for the holiday season, a time when sales pick up and consequently,   there is an injection of working capital because of cash purchases.  This Kiva loan is her seventh credit with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo with which she will buy fancy clothing, cosmetics, and clothing that she ordered for the end of the year.  Her dreams and greatest challenges are to have her own house, to continue prospering in her business, bringing energy to her commercial activities and with the financial support that she receives with the loans, to be able to increase her working capital that is currently $2,280,000 COP.

loans.use: To purchase fancy clothing, cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Mujeres Luchando Por El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Luchando por el Progreso nace hace un buen tiempo mediante el deseo de unas señoras de formar un grupo para trabajar en forma conjunta y de esa manera ayudadar a sus familia. 
Asi se formó el grupo y sigue trabajando hasta la actualidas atravesando todos los inconveniento que se presentan.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas como cerveza, vinos, sidras y otros, ya que ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas.
La venta lo realiza desde su casa y comenta que las mayores venta los tiene lo fines de semana.
Comenta que se siente muy realizada con el comité ya comparte muchas experiencias que muchas veces las ayuda en sus vidas, y desea continuar con el grupo.
texts.en: The "Women Fighting for Progress" Committee was born out of the desire of many women to form a group and work together while helping their families. So, the group was formed and continues working overcoming all the challenges that arise. One member is asking for a loan to buy drinks such as beer, wine, ciders and so on, to support her liquor store. The business is run out of her home, and the majority of her sales are during the weekends. She adds that she feels very fulfilled with the Committee, in sharing their many experiences they help her in her life, and she wants to continue with the group.

loans.use: To purchase drinks such as beer, sodas, wines, ciders and more.

loans.name: Enriqueta Indelira

texts.es:
Enriqueta de 48 años, vende frutas en un vehículo. Vive con su esposo y tres hijos en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas.

Empezó vendiendo frutas en un triciclo para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Como la demanda era mayor y si le generaba buenos ingresos decidió comprar un carro con los ahorros que tenia. Por esa buena decisión en la actualidad se estaciona con su camioneta y comienza a vender las frutas ubicándolas en el balde de la camioneta. Trabaja junto a su esposo desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00pm todos los días.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar frutas y verduras para tener más variedad en las ventas. En el futuro quiere mejorar de construir su casa y comprar otro vehículo para vender a un mayor volumen.
texts.en:
Enriqueta is 48 years old and sells fruit from a vehicle. She lives with her husband and three children in a periurban area called Paraíso de la Flor, characterized for its unpaved roads and mountains.

She began selling fruit from a tricycle to help her husband with the family expenses. Since the demand was large and she was earning good income, she decided to purchase a car with the savings that she had. Because of this good decision, she currently parks her truck and begins to sells fruit from the back of the truck. She works with her husband every day from 8am to 5pm.

With the loan, she wants to buy fruits and vegetables to have more variety in her sales. In the future she wants to improve the construction of her house and purchase another vehicle to sell more.

loans.use: Fruits, vegetables

loans.name: Kansala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité KANSALA est créé le 19 décembre 2001. Il est composé de 08 femmes issue du même village. Elles ont organisé leur groupe par proximité et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de SOURWACOUNDA

Madame Aïssatou C. à droite de la photo en boubou bleu claire et levant la main, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge des enfants de sa coépouse.

Elle fait la vente de savon. Son lieu d'approvisionnement est sa capitale régionale Ziguinchor située environs à une trentaine de kilomètre. Elle revend son produit dans le village est les environs.

Son crédit lui permettra de renforcer sa marchandise afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans le payement de la scolarité des enfants et la dépense quotidienne
texts.en:
The Kansala solidarity group has been created on December 19, 2001. It is composed of eight women all from the same village. They are neighbors and friends who decided to form a group together. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Sourwacounda.

Mrs. Aissatou C., on the righ tin the photo, wearing a light blue outfit and raising her hand, is the group’s leader. She is 43 years old. She is married and the mother of three. She also has the children of her husband’s other wife under her care.

She sells soap. She stocks up in the regional capital, Ziguinchor, located about 30 km away. She resells in and around the village. 

Her loan will allow her to increase her merchandise stock in order to boost her earnings.
Her goal is to help her husband pay the children’s school fees and provide for everyday family expenses.

loans.use: Purchasing soap for resale

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat has applied for a loan for the 2nd time from Kiva partner Asasah. She wants to financially assist her husband in his crockery business. With the loan, her husband will buy more crockery to sell in his shop. His shop is located in the market and Nusrat is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits for her husband. 

Nusrat lives in a small city in Pakistan called Jaranwala. It is known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a 2 roomed brick house in the area named Mughalpura. She moved here 3 years ago. She is the mother of 2 children. Her daughter is studying in kindergarten and her son is too young to attend to school. 

Nusrat has a buffalo at her home. She takes care of it and sells its milk to her neighboring clients. She also does sewing works to supplement the income of her family. She learned this art from her mother before marriage and it is now becomes a good source of making extra income. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nusrat.

loans.use: To buy crockery for crockery selling business.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a resident of Kisii Town in Western Kenya where he does mixed farming. He has 9 children with 7 still attending school. He has employed 8 farmhands. He produces bananas, tea and maize.

He has requested for a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He plans to use the income for school fees. He believes it will also supplement his family's diet. He is also focusing on buying three motorcycles to help in the transportation of bananas to the market and double as another business. He currently runs a retail shop as additional source of income.

Low prices for bananas in the market and insufficient funds are his greatest challenges. He adds Juhudi Kilimo has provided "the light to uplift living standards"

loans.use: Purchase and insurance of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This member is taking out a loan to buy whole-sale fruit.

loans.name: Bakhaan's Group

texts.en:
Bakhaan lives in a small city called Jaranwala, which is located in Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a 2 roomed brick house with her family, in the area named Mughalpura, since her marriage many years ago. Her husband has a construction supplies sales business. He provides cement, bricks and other construction related materials to his customers on order. He has been doing this business for many years and he is well-known for his quality items and good services. 

Bakhaan is the mother of two children, both are sons. Her elder son has a fruit-selling business and the younger one weaves carpets. Bakhaan, herself, is a housewife. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her elder son in his fruit-selling business. With the loan, he will buy more fresh, seasonal fruits and increase his sales. She is hopeful that an investment will successfully improve his business condition and increase his income. 

Bakhaan is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she built a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bakhaan.

loans.use: To buy fresh, seasonal fruits for fruit-sellling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy natural products.

loans.name: Maria Piedad

texts.es:
María de 48 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. vive en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Donde ella vivía no había una tienda o lugar donde comprar víveres fue por ello que sus amigas le insistieron para que la tenga y así mantendría a su hijo. En la actualidad tiene su tienda de víveres y trabaja sola desde las 07h45am hasta las 18h00pm vendiendo arroz, enlatados, bebidas, granos etc. 

Su casa aun no está bien construida por eso ella quiere comprar cemento y bloques para mejorarla y también mejorar su tienda ya que queda en la parte delantera de su casa. 
Sus aspiraciones para el futuro es tener una papelería y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
María, 48 years of age, has a grocery store in the back portion of her house.  She lives in a peri-urban area that has all of the basic services.  The area is located on the perimeter of Guayaquil, in a zone surrounded by an estuary.

Where she lived there were no stores or places to buy groceries, which is why her friends insisted that she open one that would also help her support her son.  Currently, she runs the store and works alone from 7:45 am to 6 pm, selling rice, canned goods, beverages, grains, etc.

Her house is still not well constructed, which is why she would like to buy cement and cinderblocks to improve it and her store, which is in the rear portion of the house.  Her goals for the future are to have a bookstore and to finish building her house.

loans.use: To purchase cement, cinderblocks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cookies and candies.

loans.name: Nolberto

texts.es: Nolberto tiene 55 años, es un padre de familia responsable, vive en su casa que es propia en  compañía de su esposa y sus 3 hijas. Hace muchos años atrás Nolberto, se dedicaba al tejido de chompas; sin embargo lo tuvo que  dejar APRA buscar un trabajo que le de mayor rentabilidad, puesto que tiene como propósito  construir su casa, al final lo logró. Hoy conserva sus maquinas de tejer, por lo que piensa retomar su actividad anterior, ya que sus antiguos clientes, provenientes de la sierra peruana, le han solicitado varios modelos de prendas típicas, él es el único que sabe como confeccionar este tipo de prendas. Desde entonces Nolberto, esta muy motivado y dice que las condiciones de su hogar si le permiten trabajar de manera más cómoda en esta labor. En adelante, anhela instalar su taller de tejidos en su casa y buscar nuevos mercados en provincias para captar más clientes y poder vender la mercadería que confeccionará. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte que recibirá, le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. Con el crédito solicitado, piensa darle mantenimiento y cambiar repuestos a sus maquinas de coser.
texts.en:
Nolberto is 55 years old, a responsible head of household, who lives in a house he owns with his wife and 3 children.  For many years, Nolberto had dedicated himself to knitting sweaters.  He had to stop in order to find work that was more profitable since he was determined to build his own home, which he finally managed to do.  

He still has his knitting machines to this day, and is thinking about returning to his original business since some old customers in the Peruvian mountainside have asked him to make them various types of traditional garments.  He is the only one who knows how to make these types of garments.  

Nolberto has since been very motivated, and says that the conditions in his home permit him to work more comfortably in this type of labor.  In the future, he would like to install a knitting workshop in his house, and seek out new markets in order to capture more customers to sell his items to.  

This is his first loan with MFP, and he knows that the support he will receive will be very beneficial in developing his business.  He is thinking about using the requested loan to maintain and change parts on his knitting machines.

loans.use: To maintain and buy replacement parts for his knitting machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beauty and natural products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of horticultural products.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Las señora mencionada es D. la comunidad D. Parra Rancho D. la Provincia D. Tiraque del Departamento D. Cochabamba.

La señora Margarita nació 18 D. octubre D. 1961 en Parra Rancho actualmente vecina D. dicha comunidad, mismo que es representante D. la Organización D. Mujeres Bartolina Sisa D. la Provincia D. Tiraque.
La señora es emprendedora que actualmente están en proceso D. organización D. una asociación D. productores D. leche, con el apoyo D. la  Alcaldia D. Tiraque bajo un convenio interinstitucional D. P.D.A.-Tiraque, para vender sus productos D. leche para el desayuno escolar del Municipio. El crédito que está solicitando es prácticamente es para comprar una vaca lechera e insumos para la alimentación del ganado, el objetivo D. la compañera es incrementar su ingreso económico en la familia.

La actividad actual D. la compañera es la agricultura que producen papa, arveja verD. y cereales, la mayor parte se dedican a la producción agrícola en la temporadas D. siembra, labores culturales y la cosecha pero sin dejar a un lado la actividad secundaria que producción D. leche.

Su vivienda son D. techo D. teja con paredes y pisos D. barro, viven con sus familias en sus comunidades son D. origen D. lugar que tienen mucha experiencia en sus actividades que realizan y son responsable con sus obligaciones en la comunidad. Por otro lado su marido le ayudan en la producción D. leche.
texts.en:
This lady is from Parra Rancho community, in Tiraque province, in Cochabamba department.

Margarita was born on October 18th 1961 in Parra Rancho where she currently lives.  She is a representative of the “Organización D. Mujeres Bartolina Sisa” (Bartolina Sisa Women's Organization) for Tiraque province.

Margarita is an enterprising woman who is currently setting up a milk producers' organization with the help of Tiraque Council under a PDA-Tiraque inter-institutional agreement to sell her milk products to the City's school breakfast scheme.  She is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow and supplies for feeding her cattle.  Her goal is to increase her family's income.

Margarita's current business activity is farming.  She grows potatoes, green peas and cereals.  She spends most of her time farming during the sowing season, the harvest season and the period in between these two seasons.  However, she still works in her secondary business activity which is producing milk.

Margarita's home has a slate roof and mud walls.  The people in Margarita's community live with their family members within the community.  They are all from a place where people have a lot of experience in their activities and are responsible as regards their duties within the community.  Margarita's husband helps her with her milk production business.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts and have his car serviced

loans.name: Buena Fé Group

texts.es:
El comité Buena Fé nace en diciembre de 2008 mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Hasta la actualidad siguen trabajando con algunas integrantes nuevas dentro del grupo.
Una  de las integrantes es la señora Maria, una mujer muy trabajadora, quien se dedica a la venta de frutas en mercado municipal, desde un puesto que alquila.
Ella compra las frutas de los proveedores que llegan de interior del pais y venden a menor precio que los proveedores locales.
Se dedica a esta activida hace un buen tiempo y cuenta con clientes que la visitan por la calidad de sus productos.
Actualmente las frutas mas consumidas por los clientes son las bananas, nanaranjas, piñas, sandias y para la compra de los mismos ella solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
The Buena Fé ("Good Faith") committee was born in December 2008 with the guidance and support of another committee that was working in the same location.  They continue to bring some new members into the group.  

One of the members is Señora Maria, a hardworking woman who sells fruit in the municipal market from a rented booth.  She buys fruit from suppliers who travel in from the countryside and sell their fruit at lower prices than local suppliers.  She has been doing this work for a while and has customers who visit for the quality of her products.

Currently the fruit that customers buy most are bananas, oranges, pineapple and watermelon. It is to buy these that she has requested the loan.

loans.use: Buying fruit: bananas, oranges, pineapples, watermelons and others.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es: Mellisa tiene 27 años, es una joven madre soltera, vive en casa de sus parientes junto a su pequeña hija Gabriela. El negocio de Melissa, es la venta de artículos del hogar y todo tipo de pedidos que le hicieran sus clientes. La modalidad de sus ventas, es a crédito, desde 3  a 6 semanas deja para que empiecen a pagar por el producto comprado, para ella es más práctico que pueda visitar a sus clientes los fines de semana ha realizar las cobranzas, además aprovecha para que incentive a su clientes en hacerle un nuevo pedido. Los otros días de semana, acude a las tiendas comerciales para  proveerse de más mercaderías y tener en stock. De esta manera Melissa, viene trabajando cerca de 2 años en este negocio, que tanto lo apasiona, pues sabe que le resulta muy rentable. En adelante, piensa ampliar su negocio y posteriormente comprarse un terreno para construir su casa y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su hija. Este su 16avo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su grupo comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de las socias. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará zapatos, vasijas, cubetas y demás accesorios de cocina, para atender los pedidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en:
Melissa is 27 and is a young single mother.  She lives in a relative's house with her daughter Gabriela.  Melissa's business is the sale of household items and all types of other items that her clients order.  Her sales are on credit, with 3 to 6 weeks to start paying for the product purchased.

It is more practical for Melissa to visit her clients at the weekend to collect payment; an additional advantage is that it encourages her customers to place a new order. The other days of the week, she goes to the shops to pick up more goods and build her stock.   Melissa has been working in this manner for about 2 years.  She is very passionate about her business, and knows that it is very profitable. Looking forward, she is thinking to expand her business, and later buy land to build a home and provide a better quality of life for her daughter. 

This is her 16th loan with MFP, and she knows that if she pays on time, she will be able to get another with greater ease and without complications for her community group, where she is well-liked by the rest of the members. With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy shoes, pots, pans and other kitchen accessories, to meet her outstanding orders.

loans.use: Buy shoes and kitchen items to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
Ana Z. V. es una mujer que sabe de todo un poco en el tema de negocios, ella vende calzados en todas las tallas y en las alturas desde 5, 1/2 centímetros en adelante, porque su tendencia está asociada en el vestir a la mujer elegante y suministrarle accesorios, perfumes, cosméticos  y hasta ropa interior, también prepara alimentos derivados de la harina de trigo especialmente los deditos rellenos de queso, pollo, embutidos y mermeladas y almuerzos para la venta. Desde hace 25 años emprendió su sueño de tener un negocio, que ha mantenido hasta la presente porque es lo que a ella le gusta y le ha ido muy bien,  con ello sostuvo a sus dos hijos menores en ese tiempo, desde que quedó ella sola a cargo de ellos, que hoy cuentan con  26 y 32 años de edad.  Así fue como inicialmente empezó a trabajar en una tienda y como su propietario tenia graneros y talleres de confecciones, le daba la oportunidad de adquirir ropa en remate para que  ella ganara dinero y ella así consiguió su primera clientela y su primera experiencia de negocio. 
Ana  vende toda clase de mercancías, que saca provecho de la temporada, de lo que esté de moda, y de todo lo que se llame ganar dinero, un ejemplo es que consiguió llevar los almuerzos diariamente y venderlos a una empresa importante  donde trabaja su sobrino y esto le representa una utilidad adicional.   Así su venta de mercancía variada le representa una utilidad del 25% a un 50% dependiendo del costo de la oportunidad, la moda, los descuentos por pronto pago, las ofertas y remates que es lo que mas le gusta, porque gana mas dinero. Ana con su dinamismo generado por su inteligencia comunicacional tiene muy buenos clientes de bancos importantes, empresas de gran tamaño vecinos, amigos y familiares, todos ellos le pagan a crédito en dos o máximo tres partidas.  De esta manera  ha conseguido tener su casa propia en la que vive con sus hijos, su nieto y un hermano.
Este es el quinto crédito de Ana Cristina con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con este su credikiva se preparará para la temporada de fin de años que se viene con nuevas ofertas y muchos nuevos clientes como es la costumbre de su mercado, por eso va a comprar ropa, calzado, y accesorios para que sus clientes luzcan elegantes y asesorados por ella misma. Ella dice que cuando llegó a la Fundación estaba con los brazos cruzados, porque no tenía capital suficiente para responder a pedidos y ganar buen dinero, diversificar su oferta y responder siempre,  a lo que sus clientes quieren y necesitan; su venta promedio mensual es de $3.000.000 COP. Y su utilidad promedia es de $1.000.000 COP después de los gastos. Su sueño es remodelar su vivienda para mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales  actuales. 
La historia de Ana cristina es de mucho impacto por su gran fortaleza y espíritu de colaboración con su familia, porque con su sacrificio empeño y disciplina, ha logrado que sus dos hijos sean personas de bien,  profesionales y con muchos sueños.
texts.en:
Ana Z. V. is a woman who knows a little about everything in the area of business.  She sells shoes in all sizes and heel-heights from 5 1 / 2 centimeters and up, because she tends to be associated with dressing stylish women and supplying them with accessories, perfumes, cosmetics and even underwear.  Ana Cristina also prepares food derived from wheat flour for sale, especially breads stuffed with cheese, chicken, sausages and jams and lunches. 

It's been 25 years since Ana Cristina started her dream of owning a business.  She has stayed with it because that is what she likes and she has done very well.  She was left alone in charge of her two children who were young at the time, they are now 26 and 32 years old.   She initially started working in a shop.  As the owner had barns and apparel factories, this gave her the opportunity to buy clothes at auction.  With these she earned money and so got her first customers and first experience of business.

Ana Cristina sell all kinds of goods, taking advantage of the season, what is fashionable, and all opportunities to make money.   An example is that she brings lunches every day to sell at a large company where her nephew works, which provides additional income.  Her varied merchandise sales provide a profit of 25% to 50% depending on the cost of the opportunity.  She enjoys fashion, cash discounts, deals and auctions, because she can earn more money.  With the dynamism generated by her communication skills, Ana Cristina has very good customers at major banks, large local companies and friends and family.  They all pay by credit in two or maximum three installments. In this way, she has succeeded in having her own home where she lives with her children, her grandchild and a brother.

This is Ana Cristina's fifth loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with this Kiva loan she will be prepared for the coming year-end season that, as is usual in her business, brings new deals and many new customers.  The loan will buy clothes, shoes, and accessories for her customers who want to look stylish and be advised by her. She says that when she came to the Foundation it was with crossed fingers, because she did not have sufficient capital to meet orders and earn good money, diversify her stock and always be able to respond to what her customers want and need.  Her average monthly sales are  $3,000,000 COP, and her average income is $ 1,000,000 COP after expenses. Her dream is to remodel her home to improve her current living conditions.

Ana Cristina's story has a lot of impact due to her great strength and spirit of collaboration with her family.  Because of her sacrifice, commitment and discipline, she has helped her two children be good people, professionals with many dreams

loans.use: Buy clothes, shoes, and accessories for her customers who want to look stylish and be advised by her.

loans.name: En Dios Confiamos 3 Group

texts.es:
Soneida es una de los miembros del Grupo En Dios confiamos 3, localizado en La ciudad de San Pedro de Macoris, cuya economia depende del comercio en general, zona franca y de plantas industriales de cemento y productos para el uso del hogar y cosmeticos. Esta ciudad como muchas otras en Republica Dominicana hay escasez de agua potable y de energía electrica y con una poblacion de dominicanos y emigrantes haitianos. En su negocio vende productos miscelaneas, como: ropas, zapatos, cosmeticos, accesorios, etc; y con su nuevo prestamo esta planificando invertir para adquirir estos productos y tener una mayor cantidad de los mismos, ya que en esta temporada hay mucha demanda de todas las ventas. Soneida está muy emocionada de recibir su sexto préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente todos sus préstamos anteriores y asi haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. 

Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil ha sido siempre tener estabilidad economica y poder suplir sus necesidades, y que disfruta del mismo modo trabajar duro, como descansar en su tiempo libre. Planea utilizar sus ganancias para reinvertir ya que habra muchas demandas de ventas. Su sueño es poder tener su negocio establecido y marchando bien.
texts.en:
Soneida is one of the members of the En Dios Confiamos (In God We Trust) 3 Group, located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, where the primary economic activities are commerce, a tax-free area, industrial cement plants, and household and cosmetic products. This city, like many others in the Dominican Republic, has a shortage of drinking water and electricity and is populated by Dominicans and Haitian immigrants. Soneida sells miscellaneous products in her business, such as: clothing, shoes, cosmetics, accessories, etc. With this new loan, she is planning to invest in more of these products, since during this time of the year there is a lot of demand for the items she sells. Soneida is very excited to receive her sixth loan from Esperanza International, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and thus having taken a step towards expanding her business. 

She tells us that her greatest challenge has always been to have economic stability and fulfill all of her needs. She enjoys working hard, just as she enjoys relaxing in her free time. She is planning to reinvest her profits in her business, since there will be a lot of demand for her products. Her dream is to have a well-established, smooth-running business.

loans.use: Productos Miscelaneos

loans.name: Sop Sa Diekeur Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SA DIEKEUR est créé o l'ouverture du Banc Villageois qui l'abrite (FOGNY2) Il est composé de 13 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par proximité et par affinité.

Madame Absa T., à debout à l'extrême gauche de la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de sa petite sœur. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de bijoux, de tissus et parfums. Elle fait cette activité depuis bientôt 4 ans

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va augmenter sa marchandise afin accroitre son chiffre d'affaire

Elle participe à la prise en charge de la dépense quotidienne. Et prend en charge également ses besoins personnels
texts.en:
The Sop Sa Diekeur solidarity group has been created at the opening of the Bank Villageois (Fogny2) to which it belongs. The group is composed of 13 women all living in the same neighborhood. They are neighbors and friends who decided to form a group together. 

Mrs. Absa T., standing on the far left in the photo raising her hand, is the group’s leader. She is 31 years old. She is married and the mother of three. She also has her younger sister in her care.

She sells jewelry, fabrics, and perfums. She has been in this business for almost four years already. With her new loan, she is going to increase her merchandise stock in order to boost her revenues. She contributes to the everyday family expenses and also provides for her own personal needs.

loans.use: Purchasing jewelry, fabrics and perfumes

loans.name: Encarna

texts.es:
La señora mencionada es D. la comunidad D. Thogo Rancho D. la Provincia D. Tiraque del Departamento D. Cochabamba.
La señora Margarita nació 25 D. marzo D. 1963 en Parra Rancho Tiraque actualmente vecina D. dicha comunidad.
La señora es emprendedora que actualmente están en proceso D. organización D. una asociación D. productores D. leche, con el apoyo D. la  Alcaldia D. Tiraque bajo un convenio interinstitucional D. P.D.A.-Tiraque, para vender sus productos D. leche para el desayuno escolar del Municipio. El crédito que está solicitando es prácticamente es para comprar una vaca lechera e insumos para la alimentación del ganado, el objetivo D. la compañera es incrementar su ingreso económico en la familia.

La actividad actual D. la compañera es la agricultura que producen papa, arveja verD. y cereales, la mayor parte se dedican a la producción agrícola en la temporadas D. siembra, labores culturales y la cosecha pero sin dejar a un lado la actividad secundaria que producción D. leche.

Sus condiciones D. vida son precarias ya que su vivienda es D. techo D. teja con paredes y pisos D. barro, viven con sus familias tiene cinco hijos que estudian en el colegio y en la Universidad, son D. origen D. lugar que tiene mucha experiencia en sus actividades que realizan y son responsable con sus obligaciones en la comunidad es viuda que trabaja sola con ayuda D. sus hijos en algunos casos con ayuda D. sus vecinos D. la comunidad.
texts.en:
The woman described is from Thogo Rancho in the Tiraque province, department of Cochabamba. Margarita was born March 25 1963 in Parra Rancho, Tiraque where she currently lives. She is a hardworking woman who is organizing an association of dairy producers with the support of the Tiraque Mayor's office through a joint agreement between PDA and Tiraque. The goal is to sell the municipality dairy products for school breakfasts. 

The loan she is requesting is to purchase a dairy cow and goods to feed it. Her goal is to increase her family's income. She currently makes a living farming potatoes, peas and grains. She spends most of her time farming during planting, cultural and harvesting periods but doesn't ignore her secondary source of income which is dairy production.

Her current conditions are difficult as she has a clay tile roof on her home with mud brick walls and a dirt floor. She lives with her 5 children, who are in high-school and college. She has a lot of experience doing what she does and is responsible  with her community obligations. She is a widow who works alone, with her children's help, or sometimes with help from the neighbors.

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Nueva Asunción Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal de “Nueva Asunción” está iniciando su tercer ciclo en el centro focal de Panamericana.   Esta banca comunal cuenta con la participación de ocho integrantes, . Han renovado la mesa directiva y para este ciclo tiene como presidenta a la señora  Nelly, como tesorera silverio y como secretaria de actas a la señora Nelly los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: macramé de mantas, comercio de aretes, abrir un comedor, artesanía en mantas, artesanía de tejidos y tienda de barrio.
La señora secretaria de actas comenta que está un año trabajando en Pro Mujer, conoció los servicios de Pro Mujer a través de las promotoras.  El negocio de la señora secretaria es la venta de aretes,  desde hace doce años ella aprendió a llevar adelante este negocio con su esposo.   Actualmente, recibe ayuda de su hermano y un ayudante para realizar la venta, pues su estrategia es llevar sus productos al interior del país, a los departamentos de Oruro y Cochabamba.
Lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer es que “les enseña  a ser más responsables.”
texts.en:
The Nueva Asuncion community bank is starting their third loan cycle in the Panamericana center. This community bank has eight members. They have changed the board of directors for this loan cycle and have Nelly as president, Silverio as treasurer, and [another] Nelly as secretary. The women have different businesses which include: macrame blankets, an earing business, a food business, artisan blanket sales, artisan knitting and a neighborhood store. 

The secretary tells us that she has worked with Pro Mujer for a year and learned of Pro Mujer's services through advertising. The secretary's current business is selling earings which she learned twelve years ago from her husband. Currently she gets help from her brother and an assistant as salespeople. Her goal is to sell the goods in the interior of the country in the Oruro and Cochabamba departments. What she likes most about Pro Mujer is that "it teaches us to be more responsible."

loans.use: Purchase earings

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel, de 66 años, es un hombre trabajador, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos de los 6 que tiene. El trabajo cotidiano de Samuel, es el de recomponer  chaquetas, faldas y pantalones, como: cambio de cremalleras, levantar la basta de las faldas o pantalones. Es así que trabaja todos los días en un puesto del mercado que posee, ahí es donde sus clientes lo ubican, como “el Costurero” que así lo llaman por realizar buenos trabajos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es complacer a sus clientes, es  por eso, que cada trabajo las ejecuta con mucha responsabilidad, aunque siempre le resulta difícil complacer a sus clientas nuevas. En adelante,  planea comprarse una máquina para remallar tela, de esa manera alcanzar la prosperidad de su negocio. Es su 15avo crédito con MFP, y seguirá siendo puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, puesto que desea tener nuevos créditos. En su  banco comunal, es un socio muy respetado por su responsabilidad demostrada. Con el crédito solicitado, va comprar una gama de variedades en hilos para la confección de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
66 year-old Samuel is a hard-working man who lives in his own home with his wife and 2 of his 6 children.  Samuel's daily work is mending jackets, skirts and pants.  For example, he changes zippers and raises the hems of skirts or pants.  He does this work every day in a market stall which he owns.  This is where his customers find him.  He is known as 'el Costurero' (The Tailor) because he does good work.

What Samuel most likes about his work is pleasing his customers.  This is why he does every job with great care.  However, it is always difficult to please his new customers.  In the future, Samuel plans to buy a machine to mend fabric and thereby make his business a greater success.

This is Samuel's 15th loan from MFP and he will continue being punctual in making his repayments since he would like to take new loans in the future.
