Samuel is a very well respected member of his community bank because of the responsibility he demonstrates.  He will use this loan to buy a range of different threads for making clothes

loans.use: To buy a range of threads and fabrics for making clothes

loans.name: Carlos Alciviades

texts.es:
Carlos de 35 años, es operador de una maquina en una compañía de café. Vive con su esposa y un hijo en una casa de cemento una zona periurbana caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas.

Para poder mantener a su familia él comenzó a trabajar como operador de una maquina en una compañía que elabora café instantáneo. Trabaja desde las 08h00am operando todo el día una maquina con la que carga el cacao (con esta fruta se elabora el café). Todavía su casa no está bien construida y quiere darle una buena vida a su esposa que trabaja en una fuente de soda y su hijo por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento y bloques. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Carlos is 35 years old.  He is a machine operator in a coffee company.  He lives with his wife and son in a cement house in a peri-urban area which is noted for its dirt roads and mountains.

In order to support his family, Carlos works as a machine operator in a company that makes instant coffee.  He works from 8.00am, all day, on a machine which he loads with cacao (from which the coffee is made).

Carlos' house is still not well built and he would like to give his wife, who works in a luncheonette, and his son a better quality of life.  For this reason he will use his loan to buy cement and blocks.  In the future, he would like to finish building his house.

loans.use: To buy cement and blocks

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 33 year old single man, and the owner of a wood factory for the past 10 years, with 21 years of experience in the business. Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time, in order to expand his business through buying more wood to work on. As usual, his previous loan had a positive effect on his business. Ali hopes to open a larger factory in the future to improve his living and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy wood.

loans.name: Sop Moustapha Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité SOP MOUSTAPHA est créé le 24 avril 2010. Il est composé de 12 femmes qui sont issues de la même concession pour la plus part. Elles ont des liens de parenté et d'affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de FOGNY2

Madame AIDA G., située à gauche de la photo et levant la main, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle a la charge des ces 3 petites sœurs et de son petit frère. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus, de téléphones portables, de parfums, de draps de lit et d'habits. 

Son crédit lui permettra de renforcer sa marchandise et de réaliser plus de bénéfices. 

Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins de la famille : payement de la scolarité des enfants, de prendre en charge leur santé, la dépense quotidienne etc.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOP MOUSTAPHA was created April 24, 2010. It consists of twelve women, mostly from the same neighborhood. They have ties of kinship and affinity. The group is part of the Banc Villageois FOGNY2.

Mrs. Aida G., seen at the left of the photo with her hand raised, is the head of the group. She is 35 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She is also responsible for her three younger sisters and her little brother.

She makes a living selling fabrics, mobile phones, perfume, bed sheets and clothes.

Her loan will allow her to boost her stocks and increase her profits.

Her goal is to support her family by paying for the children’s tuition, looking after their health, taking care of daily expenses, etc.

loans.use: To develop and promote her business

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
La señora mencionada es D. la comunidad D. Thogo Rancho D. la Provincia D. Tiraque del Departamento D. Cochabamba.
La señora Modesta nació 13 D. febrero D. 1971 en Murtuntani Tiraque actualmente vecina D. dicha comunidad.
La señora es emprendedora que actualmente están en proceso D. organización D. una asociación D. productores D. leche, con el apoyo D. la  Alcaldia D. Tiraque bajo un convenio interinstitucional D. P.D.A.-Tiraque, para vender sus productos D. leche para el desayuno escolar del Municipio. El crédito que están solicitando es prácticamente es para comprar una vaca lechera e insumos para la alimentación del ganado, el objetivo D. la compañera es incrementar su ingreso económico en la familia.

La actividad actual D. la compañera es la agricultura que producen papa, arveja verD. y cereales, la mayor parte se dedican a la producción agrícola en la temporadas D. siembra, labores culturales y la cosecha pero sin dejar a un lado la actividad secundaria que producción D. leche.

Su vivienda son D. techo D. teja con paredes y pisos D. barro, viven con sus familias es casada con  ocho hijos que están en la escuela, son D. origen D. lugar que tienen mucha experiencia en sus actividades que realizan y son responsable con sus obligaciones en la comunidad. Por otro lado su marido le ayudan en la producción D. leche.
texts.en:
This lady is from Thogo Rancho community, in Tiraque province, in Cochabamba department.

Modesta was born on February 13th 1971 in Murtuntani Tiraque.  She currently lives in this community.

Modesta is an enterprising woman who is currently in the process of setting up a milk producers' organization with the help of Tiraque Council under a PDA-Tiraque inter-institutional agreement to sell her milk products to the City's school breakfast scheme.  She is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow and supplies for feeding her cattle.  Her goal is to increase her family's income.

Modesta's current business activity is farming.  She grows potatoes, green peas and cereals.  She spends most of her time farming during the sowing season, the harvest season and the period in between these two seasons.  However, she still works in her secondary business activity which is producing milk.

Modesta's home has a slate roof and mud walls and floors.  Modesta is married and has 8 children who are in school.  The people in Modesta's community are all from a place where people have a lot of experience in their activities and are responsible as regards their duties within the community.  Modesta's husband helps her with her milk production business.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle

loans.name: Maria Alexi

texts.es:
María de 26 años, vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes). Vive con sus tres hijos en  Guasmo  caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes.  

Para cubrir con los gastos de la casa y de sus tres hijos de 19, 11 y 8 años ella empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos Yambal y ropa. Poco a poco ha trabajado  desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes desde $ 15.00 hasta $ 60.00 c/u, cremas, desodorantes. También vende en su casa los productos con una vitrina que ha comprado. Una de las preocupaciones que tiene es la delincuencia que hay en el sector cuando camina para vender los productos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, crema. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener un negocio de ferretería.
texts.en:
María is 26 years old.  She sells Yambal products.  Yambal is a company that offers enterprising women the chance to begin selling their products independently.  She lives with her three children in Guasmo, an area that is noted for the fact that most of its residents are salespeople.

To cover the household expenses and those of her three children aged 19, 11 and 8, María started work selling Yambal products and clothes.  She works from very early in the morning offering her products to neighbors and friends.  She sells perfume, for between $15.00 and $60.00 each, creams and deodorants.  María also sells her products in her home from a display case which she bought.  One of María's worries is the crime in her area when she is walking around selling her products.

María would like to use her loan to buy Yambal products such as perfumes and creams.  In the future, she would like to finish building her house and own a hardware store.

loans.use: To buy perfume and creams

loans.name: Rosas De Villa Ingenio Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Rosas de Villa Ingenio” inicia su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch es un grupo que ha trabajado sin dificultades,  sus pagos son realizados en la zona donde viven a las siete de la mañana.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes.  Los negocios son diversos: tienda de barrio, venta de fruta y de papa, producción de artesanías, carpintería de muebles, venta de tostados (pipocas, palomitas de maíz), inicio de negocio venta de dulces y golosinas, producción de tejido y artesanía.

 La presidenta de la banca comunal, señora Ceferina es una mujer joven de 22 años, madre de 2 niños,  su negocio es la elaboración de mesas, trabaja con su marido.   Su esposo le enseñó el armado de las mesas, habitualmente la elaboración de las mesas es compartida, trabajan por encargo de sus clientes. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por Bs.4000.- y será invertido en la compra de madera de las barracas de zona Germán Busch.
texts.en:
The 'Rosas de Villa Ingenio' community bank is beginning its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch regional office.  This is a group that has worked together without any difficulties.  Their instalments are paid in the district where they live at 7 o'clock in the morning.  The group has eight members.  Their businesses are varied: neighborhood store, selling fruit and potatoes, making handicrafts, making furniture (carpentry), selling 'tostados' (popcorn), a new business selling sweets and candies, knitting and making handicrafts.

Ceferina is the community bank's president.  She is a young woman of 22.  She has 2 children and her business is making tables.  She works with her husband.  Her husband taught her how to assemble tables.  Usually they share their work making tables.  They work from customers' orders.  The loan which Ceferina has requested for 4,000 bolivianos will be used to buy wood from the builders yards' in Germán Busch district.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Sop Dabakh1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP DABAKH est créé le 24 avril 2010. Il est composé de 10 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par affinité et par proximité. Leur principale activité est le petit commerce. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de FOGNY2

Madame Seyni N. à gauche de la photo levant la main, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. 

Son activité consiste la vente de tissus; de parfums; d'encens et de bijoux

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'accroitre ses bénéfices.

Son objectif est d'assurer la prise en charge de la scolarité de ses enfants et de participer également à la prise en charge de la dépense quotidienne de la maison
texts.en:
The Sop Dabakh solidarity group has been created on April 24, 2010.  The group is composed of 13 women all living in the same neighborhood. They are neighbors and friends who decided to form a group together. The main activity is retailing. The group belongs to Banc Villageois of Fogny2.

Mrs. Seyni N., standing on the left in the photo raising her hand, is the group’s leader. She is 53 years old. She is married and the mother of five.
Her business is selling fabrics, perfumes, incense and jewelry. With her new loan, she is going to increase her merchandise stock in order to boost her revenues. Her goal is to provide for the school fees for her children and also help with everyday family expenses.

loans.use: To grow and promote her business

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La señora mencionada es de la comunidad de Thogo Rancho de la Provincia de Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba.

La señora Zoraida nació 20 de agosto de 1971 en Thogo Rancho Tiraque actualmente vecina de dicha comunidad.
La señora es emprendedora que actualmente están en proceso de organización de una asociación de productores de leche, con el apoyo de la  Alcaldia de Tiraque bajo un convenio interinstitucional de P.D.A.-Tiraque, para vender sus productos de leche para el desayuno escolar del Municipio. El crédito que están solicitando es prácticamente es para comprar una vaca lechera e insumos para la alimentación del ganado, el objetivo de la compañera es incrementar su ingreso económico en la familia.

La actividad actual de la compañera es la agricultura que producen papa, arveja verde y cereales, la mayor parte se dedican a la producción agrícola en la temporadas de siembra, labores culturales y la cosecha pero sin dejar a un lado la actividad secundaria que producción de leche.

Su vivienda son de techo de teja con paredes y pisos de barro, viven con sus familias es casada con cinco hijos, son de origen de lugar que tienen mucha experiencia en sus actividades que realizan y son responsable con sus obligaciones en la comunidad. Por otro lado su marido le ayudan en la producción de leche.
texts.en:
The borrower is from the community of Thogo Rancho in Tiraque Province of the Department of Cochabama.

Señora Zoraida was born on 20 August 1971 in Thogo Rancho, Tiraque and currently lives near that community. She is a hardworking woman who is currently in the process of organizing an association of milk producers with the support of the Tiraque mayor’s office, under an inter-institutional agreement with P.D.A.-Tiraque, to sell their dairy products for the municipality’s school breakfast program. The loan that she is applying for is to purchase a dairy cow and cattle feed. Her goal is to increase her family income.

The borrower’s current business is farming. She produces potatoes, peas, and grain. Most of the time her work involves crop production during the planting and harvest seasons and the period in between these seasons, but she doesn’t neglect her secondary business of milk production.

Her home has a slate roof with mud walls and floors. She is married with five children. They come from a place people have a lot of experience with the activities they carry out and are responsible about meeting their obligations to the community. Her husband helps her with milk production.

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow and cattle feed.

loans.name: Betty Del Carmen

texts.es: Betty M. es una mujer que vive en Galapa, municipio a 15 minutos de Barranquilla,  tiene 37 años y un hijo menor , con el que sueña verlo crecer en bienestar y con un futuro exitoso. Ella  tiene en su casa una miscelánea y se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada,  es decir: todo lo relacionado con vestidos, calzado, variedades en lencería  y  ropa intima, negocio que inició hace 5 años  vendiendo camisetas y jeans,  pero gradualmente fue agregando muchos artículos de acuerdo a las necesidades de sus clientes,  y hoy lo ha convertido en una pequeña miscelánea,  pues  tiene una vitrina donde exhibe su mercancía,  especialmente en lo relacionado con la lencería.  Como en  el mes de Diciembre se aumentan  las solicitudes de mercancías por parte de sus clientes,  especialmente con lo que tiene que ver con detalles  y lencería navideña, está solicitando su segundo financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  ese es justamente el motivo de su Credikiva, porque quiere surtir su negocio con detalles para regalos,  que ella misma empaca para impactar a sus clientes, como  cosméticos, lencería, adornos y también  comprará papelería, especialmente navideña. Con el financiamiento anterior logró aumentar su capital de trabajo ligeramente y surtir mas apropiadamente su negocio; como Betty planea un crecimiento gradual,  reinvertirá  sus utilidades e inyectara  cada crédito que consiga con la Fundación  a su capital de trabajo,  ella sabe que así sus utilidades se incrementarán , y  en un futuro logrará  su  sueño de tener un gran almacén,  con nuevas vitrinas,  donde sus clientes encuentren lo que necesiten y ella pueda rotar su mercancia rápidamente, para conseguir mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Betty M. lives in Galapa, a town 15 minutes away from Barranquilla.  She is 37 years old and has a young son who she hopes will grow up in a healthy environment and have a successful future.  

She has a gift shop in her house and sells a variety of goods including dresses, footwear, lingerie and underwear.  She began her business five years ago selling t-shirts and jeans, but gradually added more articles depending on her customers' needs. She now has a small gift shop and a showcase where she exhibits her goods, especially everything related to lingerie. 

Since December is the month when there is more customer demand for her goods, especially those related to Christmas items and lingerie, she is requesting her second loan from the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  She wants to use her Credikiva to supply her business with gifts that she wraps to attract customers, such as cosmetics, lingerie, ornaments.  And she plans to purchase gift wrap, especially Christmas paper.

With her previous loan she was able to increase her working capital slightly and stock her business somewhat better.  Betty plans to grow gradually, reinvesting her profits and injecting each loan from the Fundacion into her working capital.  She knows this is the way to increase profits and be able to achieve her dream of owning in the future a large department store, with new showcases where her customers can find all they need and she can rotate inventory to increase sales and profits.

loans.use: To supply her business with gift items that she wraps to attract customers, i.e. cosmetics, lingerie, ornaments; and also purchase wrapping paper, especially for Christmas.

loans.name: Tula

texts.es: Tula, de 46 años, es una madre de familia muy carismática, separada y vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia. La actividad cotidiana a la que Tula se dedica, es la costura, siendo diestra en remendar las prendas de vestir, como: pantalones, faldas y blusas. Es así que todos los días está  recargada de trabajo, puesto que sus clientes siempre la buscan para que les haga el servicio. Ante esto Tula, se empeña en realizar costuras impecables para que no le falte clientes, y sobre todo  prioriza la entrega oportuna de sus trabajos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que lo realiza dentro de su casa, de esa manera no descuida de sus hijas que ya están entrando en la adolescencia. Trabajando en este oficio lleva más de 20 años, en esta actividad que le apasiona mucho. Para el futuro, anhela instalar una tienda en su casa, para mejorar la calidad de vida y la de sus hijas. Es su 16avo crédito con MFP y se compromete a seguir siendo puntual en su cuota. En su banco comunal, es un cliente muy respetado por su entrega al trabajo y al grupo. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará hilos, cierres, telas, ya que tiene planeado confeccionar cubre camas.
texts.en:
Tula is a charismatic 46-year-old woman. She is separated and lives with her three children in her own home. Tula is a seamstress who is very skilled in mending clothes such as pants, skirts, and blouses. Everyday she is overloaded with work since her clients always seek her services, but even in these circumstances Tula always strives to make her sewing work impeccable so that she never has to face a shortage of clients. Above all, she gives priority to the timely completion of her orders.  

What Tula likes best about her work is that she is able to do it from home which allows her to care for her daughters who are already growing up. She has been in this line of work for over 20 years, and she is very passionate about it. 

In the future, Tula would really like to set up a store in her home in order to improve the quality of life for herself and her daughters. This is her 16th loan with MFP, and she is very committed to be prompt with repayment. In her communal bank, she is someone who is very respected for her commitment to her work and to the group. She will use the loan in order to purchase thread, zippers, and fabric since she already has plans to manufacture bedspreads.

loans.use: Purchase of thread, fabric, and zippers for manufacturing bedspreads

loans.name: Norma Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Norma; ella tiene 51 años de edad, soltera  y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de flores las cuales ella hace pedido a la ciudad de Lima y luego ella lo distribuye a quienes lo solicitan como arreglos florales  entre otros, a la vez la socia trabaja en un colegio de la provincia de Ollantaytambo en el cargo de auxiliar de educación. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio con mas variedad de flores y así poder ofrecer a sus clientes distintas variedades.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Llankachinapac communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, which is in the Urubamba province and the department of Cusco. 

Norma is 51 year old. She is single and has one child. She has a business selling flowers that she has ordered from Lima and which she then distributes as floral arrangements. She alternates this activity with a job as a teacher’s aide at a school in Ollantaytambo.

Norma is seeking this loan to provide a greater variety of flowers for her business, offering her customers a better selection. She is grateful to all those who have made this dream possible, and promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: Buy flowers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Victoria Carolina

texts.es: Victoria Carolina V. R. de 32 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo quien es una persona muy responsable con su hogar, y así mismo vive junto a sus tres hijos de: 11, 6 y 3 años de edad quienes se dedican a estudiar y junto a quienes reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Victoria trabaja muy duro de lunes a domingo elaborando tortillas, así mismo elabora tamales para vender, de forma que pueda contar con otra fuente de ingresos la cual es muy necesaria para su familia. Ella solicita un préstamo a integral por medio del cual pueda comprar: Maíz por mayor, pollo, verduras, y toda la materia prima para elaborar mayor cantidad de tamales y tortillas. Victoria es una persona muy laboriosa la cual desea contar con una vida mejor para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Victoria Carolina V. R. is a responsible 32 year-old who lives in the department of La Libertad with her husband and three school-aged children, ages 11, 6 and 3.

She works hard from Monday to Sunday preparing tortillas and tamales which she sells in order to supplement her family's income.  She is requesting a loan to buy bulk corn, chicken, vegetables and all the necessary ingredients for tamales and tortillas.  

Victoria is a hard-working woman who wants to provide a better life for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy corn, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Sop Naby Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité SOP NABY est créé le 24 avril 2010. Il est composé de 09 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elle nouent des liens de familiarité et d'amitié assez solides. Leur activité principale est le commerce. Le groupe fait partie du Banc villageois de FOGNY2

Madame Maty N., à gauche de la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge.

son activité consiste la coiffure. Elle achète des mèches et des produits pour la coiffure et s'installe chez elle dans une pièce qui fait office de salon pour pratiquer son activité.

Son crédit lui permettra d'acheter plus de mèches et de produits pour mener à bien son activité.

Son objectif est de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et de participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
The solidarity group, Sop Naby, was created on 24th April 2010. It is made up of nine women who live in the same neighborhood. They have established quite a strong friendship. Their principal activity is trading. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois in Fogny2.

Mrs. Maty N., on the left hand side of the photo with her hand raised, is in charge of the group. She is 31 years old, married and mother to two children, who are in her care.

She has a hairdressing business. She buys hair extensions and hair products, and has a room in her house which serves as a salon for her business.

Her loan will allow her to buy more hair extensions and products to carry out her activity.

Her aim is to cover her personal needs and contribute to taking care of her family.

loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions and hairdressing products

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Pedro Antonio M. de 51 años de edad, es una persona la cual debe trabajar muy duro para sostener a su extensa familia la cual esta conformada por su esposa y seis hijos, todos menores de edad. Pedro posee una panadería en la cual se encarga de elaborar el pan y así mismo repartirlo con los diferentes clientes. Este negocio es muy importante para Pedro como para su familia, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuentan. Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual obtenga el dinero necesario para invertir en la panadería, comprando harina, azúcar, sal, levadura y otros productos más, todo esto con el deseo de aumentar su producción y así mismo de mejorar sus ventas, el mayor deseo de Pedro es de poder solventar todas las necesidades de sus hijos, por lo cual lucha día con día por salir adelante y darles todo lo mejor a ellos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Pedro Antonio Marroquin is 51 years old and works hard to support his large family which is comprised of a wife and six minor children.

He owns a bakery and makes bread which he delivers to his customers.  This business is very important for Pedro and his family since it is the only source of income they have.  

He is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, salt, yeast and other products for the bakery.  He wants to increase production and improve sales so he can meet his childrens' needs.  He works hard every day to develop his business and provide the best he can for his wife and children.

loans.use: To buy bakery ingredients.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 33 años, es una madre de familia muy emprendedora, separada de su esposo hace varios años, vive en casa de su madre, en compañía de su hijo Fabricio de 4 años. Tras haber trabajo por muchos años, en fábricas de zapatos como ayudante, con mucho esfuerzo, Elizabeth logró instalar su taller de zapatos, en el interior de su casa, en la que trabaja en sociedad con su hermano. Desde entonces ya llevan 4 años en esta actividad, en la que ella con mucho esmero y dedicación, realiza las costuras respectivas de los zapatos, mientras que su hermano arma y le da los retoques respetivos a los calzados que fabrican, por lo que les va muy bien en esta labor. Su mayor goce, es cuando sus calzados tienen mucha aceptación en el mercado y le hacen más pedidos. En adelante, anhela fabricar zapatos para eventos elegantes, pero ahora solo fabrica zapatos casuales. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, en la que se compromete en pagar todas las cuotas oportunamente, ya que desea más adelante acceder a nuevos préstamos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará cueros, forros, badana, materiales que necesita para la confección de zapatos de verano, ya que desea abastecer los nuevos pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 33, is a very entrepreneurial woman. Separated from her husband since several years ago, she lives in her mother's house together with her 4-year-old son Fabricio. For many years, Elizabeth had worked at shoe factories as an assistant, and with a lot of effort, she was able to set up her own shoe-manufacturing workshop at home, where she now works with her brother. 

They've been working together in this business for four years now. With great care and dedication, Elizabeth does all the sewing work while her brother assembles the shoes and puts the finishing touches. They work together well in this venture, and Elizabeth's greatest joy is when their shoes find success in the marketplace and customers come to them with more orders.  

In the future, Elizabeth would really like to make formal footwear, but for now she is making casual shoes. This is her second loan with MFP, and she is committed to make all the repayments in a timely manner since she wishes to have access to credit in the future. Elizabeth will use the current loan to buy leather, flannel, lining, and other materials for manufacturing summer shoes; she already has new orders and wants to fulfill them.

loans.use: Purchase of leather, flannel, and lining for manufacturing shoes

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 38 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes la cual se encuentra ubicado en el terminal terrestre de Urubamba, siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento y de esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio con mas variedad de productos para su tienda como flores dulces,galletas,tortas,chocolates entre otros.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa is a member of the LLANKACHINAPEC communal bank.  The bank is located in the Urubamba district in Urubamba province, Cusco department.  She is 38 years old, in a common law marriage with 2 children.  She splits her time between her daily activities and her grocery store, located in the Urubamba bus terminal.  This is the only work she does for the moment, and it is thus that she supports her family.

Mrs. Rosa is asking for the loan to stock her store with a greater variety of products such as flores dulces, cookies, cakes, and chocolates among other things.

She thanks those who are a part of this dream and she promises to make her payments at the rate set out.

loans.use: Stock her store with a greater variety of products, including flores dulces, cookies, cakes, and chocolates among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy staple grains, sweets and softdrinks for his business.

loans.name: Luchando Con Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Yesenia es una de los miembros del Grupo Luchando con esperanza 1 & 2, localizado en La ciudad de Puerto Plata, cuya economía depende de la industria del ron, del sector turístico e inmobiliaria, fue el primer destino turistico del República Dominicana y unas de las ciudades mas productora de azúcar, en donde como muchas hay escasez de agua potable y de energía eléctrica y con una población de dominicanos y emigrantes haitianos. Su negocio actual es una cafeteria, donde tambien vende alimentos para preparar la comida diaria. Yesenia es casada, y su familia esta compuesta por ella y su esposo, y sus 3 hijos. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil ha sido la crisis economica mundial. Disfruta mucho ver un juego de pelota (baseball).

Yesenia está muy emocionada de recibir este segundo préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber recibido la invitacion para formar un Banco de Esperanza en su comunidad. Está planificando invertir este préstamo en la compra 2 sacos de arroz, aceite y productos enlatados, etc. Planea utilizar sus ganancias para reinvertir en el negocio y ahorrar. Su sueño es tener un almacen para ventas de alimentos.
texts.en:
Yesenia is a member of the group Luchando con Esperanza 1&2 (Fighting with Hope 1&2), located in the town of Puerto Plata, whose economy depends on the rum industry, on tourism and on the real estate sector. This has been the first touristic destination of the Dominican Republic, and one of the towns with the best sugar production; as it is in many other towns, it suffers from a shortage of drinkable water and electricity, and its population is composed of Dominicans and of Haitian immigrants. Yesenia currently runs a cafeteria, where she also sells ingredients to prepare daily meals. Yesenia is married, and her family is composed of her husband, their 3 children and herself. She told us that her most difficult task or has been the facing the global economic crisis. She enjoys watching a ball game (baseball) very much.
Yesenia is very thrilled to receive this second loan by Esperanza Internacional, after having been invited to form a Bank of Hope in her community. She is planning to invest this loan in the purchase of two bags of rice, oil, canned products, etcetera. She plans to use her earnings to reinvest in her activity and in savings. She dreams of owning a food store.

loans.use: To buy 2 bags of rice, oil and canned products

loans.name: Taku Liguey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TAKU LIGUEY est créé le 24 avril 2010. Il est composé de 07 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elles ont organisé leur groupe par affinité et par proximité. Le groupe fait partie du banc villageois de FOGNY2

Madame Marie M. à gauche de la photo et levant la main, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de divers produits. Tels des jus de fruits naturels, de la crème glacée etc.

Avec son crédit elle va augmenter sa production en achetant plus d'intrants pour la fabrique de ses jus et crèmes glacées

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge familiale et de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels
texts.en:
The solidarity group TAKU LIGUEY was created on April 24, 2010.  It is composed of seven women living in the same district.  The women organized their group by affinity and proximity.  It is part of the Banc Villageois of FOGNY2.

Ms. Marie M. is the group's leader (appearing in the photo at the left with her hand raised).   She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She has a small business involving a variety of products, such as natural fruit juices, ice cream, etc.  

With her loan, Marie is going to increase her production by buying more ingredients for making  juices and ice creams.  Her goal is to help cover family expenses and to support herself.

loans.use: Advancing her business activity

loans.name: Sheyla Alexandra

texts.es:
Sheyla de 47 años, vende pollos listos para cocinar en su casa. Vive con su esposo y tres hijos en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Compra los pollos vivos para prepararlos y los prepara para que esten listo a cocinar, los vende a los conocidos del sector. Su esposo es mensajero y ayuda con los gastos de sus tres hijos que aun estudian. Por la falta de oportunidades de chequeo medio su esposo no ha podido operarse de las vistas ya que se le hace muy dificultoso trabajar con ese problema. Ella quiere dedicar una parte del préstamo a las medicinas que necesita su esposo para seguir con su vista y una pequeña parte para los pollos. 

Sus aspiraciones para el futuro es que su esposo este bien con su salud. También hacer el curso de conducción para comprar un carro y convertirlo en expreso.
texts.en:
Sheyla, age 47, sells chickens ready to cook in her house.  She lives with her husband and three children in a periurban zone, which has all of the basic services.  It is located along the Perimetral Highway in Guayaquil that is surrounded by a marsh.

She buys the chickens live in order to prepare them so that they are ready to cook.  She sells them to acquaintances in the sector.  Her husband is a messenger, and he helps with the educational expenses of their three children.  Due to the lack of the opportunity to be medically checked, her husband has not been able to have an operation for his eyesight.  It is very difficult for him to work with this problem.

She wants to use part of the money for medicines that her husband needs in order to continue to have his sight.  She will use a small part of the loan for chickens.

Her future aspirations are for her husband to be in good health.  She also wants to take a driving course in order to buy a car and convert it into an express taxi.

loans.use: Medicine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy boxes of panettone to meet the demands of her customers

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida lives in Jaranwala,  a small city in Punjab, Pakistan. The area is known for its agriculture industry. Khalida lives there in a 2 roomed brick house with her family. She moved here after her marriage. 

Khalida has given birth to 2 sons. Her elder son operates a cosmetics sales business. He has a cosmetic shop in the market. He sells makeup accessories such as mascara, eye liners, lipsticks and beauty-related products (such as face creams and masks) to his customers. Her younger son works in a factory for a small income. Her husband is also a worker in a factory with a low income. Khalida herself is a housewife. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities. 

Khalida has applied for a loan for the 2nd time from Kiva partner Asasah for her elder son’s business. With the loan, he will buy more cosmetics and beauty products for his shop to increase the profit from his sales. Khalida is hopeful that an investment will bring good profits to her son and improve his business condition. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Khalida.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and beauty products for cosmetics sales business.

loans.name: Margaritas Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Margaritas” inicia su onceavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch, es un grupo entusiasta, comenta que lleva el nombre de Margarita, en honor a la Jefe de Centro Focal, quién es una señora respetable a quién apreciaron mucho desde la formación del grupo. Tambien, ellas comentan que es un espacio en el que pueden compartir y aprovechar de la compañía de sus compañeras. Está compuesta por once integrantes.  Los negocios son diversos: servicio de limpieza en un baño público, macramé en mantas, artesanía en bolsitas, venta de biberones, venta de frazadas, venta de linaza, venta de comida y desayuno y refrescos, artesanía, venta de batidos.

La presidenta de la banca comunal, señora Claudia es madre de 2 niños,  ingresó a formar parte de la banca comunal porque necesitaba capitalizarse para llevar adelante su negocio de venta de desayuno – almuerzo – te, en la parada de los buses del parque Ecológico de la ciudad de La Paz.  El préstamo que ha solicitado es por Bs.2000.- y será invertido en la compra de azúcar, fideo, aceite, papa por mayor.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Margaritas" (Daisies)  is in its eleventh cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Germán Busch Community Center.  They are an enthusiastic group who chose the name Margarita in honor of the woman who is head of the Community Center, a respected woman whom they have appreciated a great deal since they formed their group.  They also say that the center is a place where they can share and enjoy the company of their companions. 

There are 11 members in the group.  Their businesses are diverse: a cleaning service in a public restroom, bed spread macramé, handicrafts on bags, baby bottle sales, costume sales, flaxseed sales, sale of food, breakfast, and refreshments, handicrafts sales, and shake sales.

The president of the communal bank, Claudia, is a mother of two children.  She joined the communal bank because she needed to raise money to advance her business selling breakfast, lunch, and tea at the bus stop in the Parque Ecológico (Ecological Park) in La Paz.  The loan that she has requested is for Bs. 2000, which will be used to purchase sugar, fideo noodles, cooking oil, and potatoes wholesale.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, fideo noodles, oil, and potatoes wholesale

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Mariza; ella tiene 32 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de internet el cual lleva por nombre DIEGOS  y se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa la socia es una mujer emprendedora y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.   

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más computadoras y para el mantenimiento de algunas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mariza is a member of the “Llankachinapac” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Mariza is 32 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business which is an Internet café called Diegos which is located in her home.  She is an enterprising woman who is getting her family ahead in life.

Mariza is requesting this loan to buy more computers and to service others.

She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy computers and to have some others serviced

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To be supplied with cheese to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Nabeela's Group

texts.en:
Nabeela is the resident of Jaranwala, a small city in Pakistan known for its agricultural industry. She has been living in this city, since her marriage, in a 2 roomed brick house with her family. She is a very active and caring lady. She prefers to stay at home and manage the household responsibilities. She has given birth to 3 daughters. Her elder daughter is studying in kindergarten while the other two are too young to attend school. 

Nabeela's husband is a carpenter by profession and operates a furniture making and sales business. He has a shop in the market from where he displays his hand-made furniture to his clients for selling. He is an expert in his work and each piece of furniture sells for a good price. 

Nabeela has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy wood, nails and furniture polisher in larger quantities to make more furniture to display from his shop. This will help him offering more variety of furniture to his clients for selling and to make more income.  

Nabeela is hopeful that an investment will take her husband’s business to a more profitable position and will also expand his business on a larger scale. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she has proven herself as a very responsible client who has paid her installments on time and she never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nabeela.

loans.use: To buy wood, nails and furniture polish for furniture making & sales business.

loans.name: Maame Abina

texts.en:
Maame Abina A. smokes and as well fries fish for sale at Elmina. Maame is married and has six dependants. Her husband is a cleaner. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale. She hopes to provide a meaningful education to her children from her additional profit.

At the time of visit, she was yet to go to the seashore to purchase the fish. She is displaying the things she will be using for the fish when she is ready.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua A. sells palm oil at Elmina. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a security man. She assists her husband to promote the welfare of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruits to prepare oil for sale. She hopes to reinvest her new profit.

Ekua is showing a sample of the gallon containers she uses to store the produced oil. At the time of visit, she was yet to produce oil for sale.

loans.use: To buy more palm fruits to prepare oil for sale.

loans.name: Juan Felipe

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Juan; el tiene 53 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; el socio tiene un negocio de taller de motos el cual se encuentra ubicado en su casa y lleva por nombre El Chacalon , el socio trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa siendo este el medio por el cual sacan a su familia adelante.  

El socio solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su negocio asi como repuestos para motos , acite entre otros. 

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group member is part of the LLANKACHINAPAC communal bank. The bank is located in Cusco district, which is part of Cusco province and the department of Cusco. 

Juan is the group member. He is 53 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 3 children. He owns a vehicle repair business in which the workshop is located in his house. The business is called El Chacalon. He works together with his wife, and by these means they support their family. 

He is asking for a loan to build his business to sell replacement vehicle parts and oil, among other things. 

He thanks those who allow for the realization of his dreams through this loan, and promises to repay the loan in installment payments in the established increments.

loans.use: He is asking for a loan to build his business to sell replacement vehicle parts and oil, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Gulnaz's Group

texts.en:
Gulnaz is a citizen of a city named Jaranwala, in Pakistan. She is a caring lady, prefers to spend her time at home. She carried out her responsibilities of a housewife effectively and takes care of her children. Her husband's name is M. A.. He is a private entrepreneur and is involved in a clothes selling business. He buys clothes from the markets of Jaranwala and sells to the local area clients. He has been in this business for over five years. In these years experience, he has successfully built a good image with his customers due to his quality of fabrics and well designed clothes.  

Gulnaz is a mother of 3 children. All three boys, unfortunately, have not managed to be able to attend school due to the poor financial condition of the family. 

Gulnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy a greater variety of clothes in bulk quantities that will help him fulfilling orders on time and make more income.

Gulnaz has full confidence in her husband that, through a loan investment, he will take his business to a more profitable position. This will make her able to provide good quality education for her children. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she built a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Gulnaz.

loans.use: To buy clothes for clothing sales business.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana S. is a widow and has three children. She has no educational background. Nana produces and sells Fante kenkey (dumpling) at Elmina, which she has been doing for twelve years. Nana uses her income in seeing to the well-being of her family. Nana will use the loan to purchase more maize to prepare kenkey for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to prepare kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba S. sells baby clothing and provisions in Elmina. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a trader. Araba has been in this business for four years now. She assists her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. She hopes to educate her children with the new profit.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Del Nueva Renacer Group

texts.es:
Miguelina es una de los miembros del Grupo Mujeres del Nuevo renacer 2, localizado en La ciudad de Puerto Plata, cuya economía depende de la industria del ron, del sector turístico e inmobiliaria, fue el primer destino turistico del República Dominicana y unas de las ciudades mas productora de azúcar, en donde como muchas hay escasez de agua potable y de energía eléctrica y con una población de dominicanos y emigrantes haitianos. Su negocio es la venta de productos y medicina naturales, y otros articulos miscelaneos de limpieza y uso personal. Miguelina es casada, y su familia esta compuesta por ella y su esposo, y un 1 hijos. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil es salir adelante, con la ayuda de Dios y estos prestamos podra lograrlo. Disfruta mucho asistir a la iglesia y alabar al Señor.

Miguelina está muy emocionada de recibir su tercer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber recibido la invitación de algunas vecinas para formar parte de un prestamo que la iba a ayudar a mejorar su negocio. Está planificando invertir este préstamo en la compra varios productos y medicinas para la salud, pero naturales. Planea utilizar sus ganancias para reinvertir en su negocio y ayudar con los gastos de su casa. Su sueño es tener una farmacia de productos naturales.
texts.en:
Miguelina is one of the members of the “Mujeres del Nuevo Renacer 2” (Women of the New Rebirth 2) communal bank located in the city of Puerto Plata whose economy is based on rum, tourism and real estate.  It was the Dominican Republic’s first tourist destination and one of the cities with the highest sugar production.  Like many other places it has shortages of drinking water and electricity and its population is a combination of Dominicans and Haitian immigrants.

Her business is the sale of natural products and medicines as well as other miscellaneous cleaning and personal use products.  Miguelina is married and her family includes her husband and a son.  She tells us that her most difficult challenge is to succeed but, with help from God and these loans, she will be able to do so.  She very much enjoys attending church and praising the Lord.

Miguelina is very excited to be getting her third loan from Esperanza Internacional after having been invited by several neighbors to be part of a loan that would help improve her business.  She is planning to use the fund to buy several health products and medicines, but all natural ones.  She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to help meet household expenses.  Her dream is to own a natural products pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy natural products.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. is a widow taking care of four children. She makes corn dough for sale in Elmina. Ama uses her income to provide for the basic needs of her family. She is asking to use the loan to purchase more maize to prepare corn dough to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to build a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to prepare corn dough

loans.name: Mina Esi

texts.en: Mina Esi A. operates a grocery store in Elmina. Mina is married. Her spouse works as a secretary. She assists her husband in taking care of their home. Her loan will be added to her initial income to buy more products to sell. She hopes to use the profits from her business to save towards the acquisition of land.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila, de 44 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, madruga para preparar maca, soya, quinua, asimismo aperitivos como pan con queso, siendo estos productos alimenticios vendidos de manera ambulante a los muchos transeúntes que pasa por ahí y por lo que tiene mucha acogida por parte de ellos. Su punto de venta es el paradero de buses interurbanos, lugar muy estratégico y del cual ha logrado percibir muchas ganancias. Se siente muy feliz, ya que su negocio le es muy rentable, aunque a veces se la hace pesado tener que madrugar, para tener los  desayunos a la hora. Ella, se esmera en atender con toda la amabilidad del caso, ya que depende de lo que termine de vender serán sus ganancias. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es que conoce mucha gente, con los que se mantiene en continua comunicación. Para el futuro piensa poner otro negocio adicional de comida, y así mejorar sus ingresos y su estilo de vida. Este es su 18avo crédito con MFP y seguirá trabajando siendo puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que desea tener nuevos créditos. En su banco comunal, es una socia muy responsable en las reuniones que organizan. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mercadería por sacos, para que no le falte nada al momento de preparar estos alimentos.
texts.en:
Lucila, 44, is a hard working mother living in her own home, with her husband and their children. Every day, she gets up very early in the morning to prepare maca (a root vegetable), soy, and quinoa, together with snacks like bread with cheese. She sells these food products as a street vendor to the many passersby, and she has been well received by them.  Lucila's selling location is the intercity bus stop, it's a very strategic location where she has been able to make good profits. She feels very happy because her business is very profitable, though it is sometimes hard to have to be up very early to have the breakfasts ready on time. She strives to do her business with kindness, and she depends on this to complete the sales that lead to her profits. What she likes most about her business is that she knows many people, with whom she keeps in constant communication.  In the future, Lucila intends to set up an additional food business, and so improve their income and lifestyle. 

This is her 18th credit with MFP and she will continue working to repay punctually, because she wants to be able to take out new loans. She is a very responsible member in the meetings her community bank organizes. With the requested loan, she will buy sacks of goods so that she's not lacking anything when preparing these foods

loans.use: To buy sacks of goods so that she's not lacking anything when preparing foods.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. sells fish and Fante kenkey (a type of sourdough dumpling) in Elmina. Aba is married to a carpenter, and together they live with their three children. She helps her husband to provide for the basic needs of their family. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare kenkey for distribution to her demanding customers. She hopes to use the profits from her business to buy land.

loans.use: To buy more maize to prepare kenkey (a type of sourdough dumpling) for distribution to her demanding customers

loans.name: 20 De Noviembre Group

texts.es: Este grupo  se llama 20 de Noviembre, en alusión al día de la Revolución Mexicana, que se llevó a cabo hace 100 años, por hombres y mujeres que buscaban justicia y equidad social, por eso las integrantes se sienten identíficadas al ser mujeres emprendedoras y valientes. Está ubicado en el Estado de Hidalgo en México. El grupo está conformando por 11 integrantes.Rodríguez Díaz Guadalupe es una integrante del grupo. Tiene cincuenta y cinco años  estudio hasta sexto año de primaria. Es viuda  y tienen en total  seis hijas mujeres ya ninguna depende  de ella económicamente. Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas de comal. Que inicio desde hace dos años. La Sra. Guadalupe solicito su préstamo para la compra  de maíz, una  máquina de tortillas manual. Sus clientes  se sienten satisfechos por su trato amable y la calidad de sus  tortillas frescas. Espera que con sus ganancias pueda adquirir material de construcción para la remodelación  de su local  y vivienda. Para tener un mejor nivel  de vida.
texts.en: This group is named November 20th, a reference to the day of the Mexican Revolution, which was begun 100 years ago by men and women seeking justice and social equity.  The group's members therefore identify with hard-working and valiant women.  They are located in the state of Hidalgo in Mexico.  The group is made up of 11 members, R. D. Guadalupe among them.  She is fifty-five years old, and has a sixth-grade education.  She is a widow and has 6 grown daughters, none of whom are dependent on her economically.  She works making tortillas on a griddle, which she began doing two years ago.  Mrs. Guadalupe is asking for this loan to buy corn and a manual tortilla maker.  Her customers enjoy her pleasant treatment of them and the quality of her fresh tortillas.  She hopes that with her earnings she can acquire construction materials to remodel her shop and her home, in order to have a higher quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase corn and a manual tortilla maker.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem has applied for a loan for the first time from Kiva partner Asasah for her grocery store business. She opened her grocery store few years ago, adjacent to her home, which is now earning her good money and allows her to manage the financial circle of her home without any difficulty. With the loan, she will buy more grocery items such as cooking oil, sugar and spices, etc. She will sell the items through her shop to earn more income. 

Naseem lives in a small city called Jaranwala, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan and is famous for its agriculture industry. She has been living there for  many years in a 3 roomed brick house with her family. She is the mother of a son and 4 daughters. All of her children are getting their education by attending school. She  is married to L. A.. He sells wheat and rice. He has a small shop from where he operates his business. Naseem is hopeful that her business will grow more by investing loan money into it.   

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba A. is a widow taking care of five dependants. She sells maize and bags of charcoal in Elmina. Araba uses her income to see to the welfare of her home. Araba will use the loan to purchase additional bags of charcoal to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to further her dependants’ education.

Araba is standing beside a bag of charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase additional bags of charcoal to expand her business

loans.name: Amaria Araba

texts.en: Amaria Araba Z. goes to the nearby villages to buy foodstuff to sell in Elmina. Amaria has eight children. Her husband is a security man. She contributes to the payment of school fees and utility bills. Amaria wants to expand her business. She is requesting to use the loan to purchase more foodstuff to meet the demands of her customers. Amaria plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff to meet the demands of her customers

loans.name: Gerem Yalla Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité GEREM YALLA est créé le 24 avril 2010. Lors de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 12 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elles ont organisé leur par affinité et par liens d'amitié. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de Maison Familiale Rurale

Madame Khady N., en deuxième position à partir de la droite sur la photo levant la main droite, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de ses 8 petits fils. 

Elle fait un commerce d'huile palme, de tissus et de pagnes tissé à la main. 

son crédit lui permettra d'élargir son activité afin d'accroitre ses bénéfices.

Elle participe à la prise en charge familiale par la nourriture et la santé de ses petits fils
texts.en:
The Gerem Yalla solidarity group was created April 24, 2010, when Banc Villageois was launched. The group is made up of 12 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their group was coordinated based on their kinship ties and friendships. The Gerem Yalla group is part of the Banc Villageois de Maison Familiale Rurale.

Madame Khady N., second from the right in the photo, raising her right hand, is the group leader. She is 54 years old. She is is married and the mother of 2 children, as well as being responsible for her 8 grandsons.

Madame N. sells palm oil, fabrics and hand-woven pagnes [traditional, sarong-like wraparounds]. This loan will allow her to expand her business in order to increase her profits.

Madame N. helps to provide for her family by contributing food and assuring the health of her grandsons.

loans.use: Buying palm oil, fabric and pagnes.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy C. prepares locally made drinks for sale in Elmina. This drink is made from corn, with sugar and milk added to give it taste. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Lucy assists her husband to educate, clothe and feed their children. Lucy will use the loan to purchase more corn, sugar and milk to make drinks to sell. Lucy plans to buy land with the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: To purchase more corn, sugar and milk to make drinks to sell

loans.name: Grisel

texts.es:
Grisel es de la ciudad de San Ignacio Misiones, tiene 22 años, es madre soltera, actualmente se encuentra trabajando en un estudio contable como auxiliar, vive con su hija de 3 años en una casa alquilada, con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue luchando por salir adelante y está estudiando en el Instituto Privado Jesús de Nazaret la carrera de Administración Bancaria, a pesar de todos los obstáculos que debió superar es alumna regular, dedicada y muy estudiosa.
Ella solicita el préstamo para el pago de los gastos de la facultad.
Grisel agradece este préstamo ya que le ayudará en su estudio y al mismo tiempo podrá contar con referencias crediticias que en el futuro será  de mucha importancia para concretar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Grisel is from the city of San Ignacio Misiones, she is 22 years old and a single mother.  She is currently working at an accounting firm as an assistant, and she lives with her 3 year old daughter in a rented house.  With effort and dedication she is struggling to get ahead and is studying at the Private Institute of Jesus of Nazareth for a career in Banking Administration.  In spite of all the obstacles she has overcome, she is a regular student, dedicated and very studious.

She is requesting a loan to pay her school costs.  Grisel is grateful for this loan because it will help in her studies and at the same time will build her credit record which will be very important in the future for achieving her projects.

loans.use: Payment of monthly tuition fees and other study materials.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz, de 23 años, vive en su casa que es propia, al lado de sus padres y sus hermanos menores. Esta trabajadora joven se dedica a su negocio por completo y así  ayuda a sus progenitores. Cada mañana Beatriz se despierta con los primeros rayos de luz para ir a su negocio de venta de comida que esta instalado en un mercado de su zona. Ella es la administradora y atiende con la ayuda de tres jóvenes, además dice que esta muy satisfecha con el negocio pues le genera buenas ganancias ya que esta muy bien ubicado. Atiende desde las 8 de la mañana con la venta de desayunos, a partir del mediodía comercializa  diversidad de comidas y en las tardes se prepara para atender el lonche. Aunque muchas veces no se abastece en la atención, por la cantidad de comensales que visitan su negocio en busca de la deliciosa comida y los bajos precios que ofrece, tiene planeado ampliar su negocio e instalar otro cerca de la zona. Es el sexto  crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Beatriz tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mesas y sillas que necesita para implementar mejor el negocio que esta por abrir, y así  espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Beatriz is 23 years old and lives in her own home with her parents and  her younger sisters. The hardworking young woman works full time at her business and this is how she helps her parents. Every morning Beatriz wakes up at the first ray of sun to go to her food selling business that is set up in a market in her area. She is the manager and she serves with the help of three young people. She is very satisfied with the business because it generates good earnings for her since it is well located. She serves from 8 in the morning selling breakfasts. Starting at midday she sells different meals and in the afternoons she prepares to serve lunch.  Although she often doesn't have enough to serve due to the number of guests who seek her delicious food and the low prices that she offers, she is planning on growing her business and opening another one in the area. This is the sixth loan she has had with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time since she doesn't want to look bad to the people who made this contribution possible that will keep her working in search of progress.  Beatriz is planning on investing the loan she is asking for in the purchase of tables and chairs she needs to better outfit the business she is going to open. She hopes to improve her earnings in this way.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs to outfit her locale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua F. takes care of seven dependents. Efua makes donuts in Elmina, which she has been doing for eight years now. She is married to a cleaner. Efua uses her income to assist her husband with providing for the welfare of the family. The loan she hopes to get will be used to purchase more ingredients to prepare donuts to sell. Efua plans to reinvest her profits.

Donut mixture is in the green bowl pictured above. The donut mixture was used to fry the donuts being displayed.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to prepare donuts

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana K. makes Fante kenkey (a type of sourdough dumpling) for sale in Elmina. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is an electrician. Nana has been in kenkey production for seven years. She assists her husband with feeding, clothing and educating her dependents. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare kenkey to distribute to her growing number of customers. She hopes to educate her dependents with her profits.

loans.use: To buy more maize to prepare kenkey (a type of sourdough dumpling) to distribute to her customers

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio, de 48 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de sus 2 hijos, y el menor estudia en el colegio; y juntos se esfuerzan por salir adelante. Este trabajador hombre se despierta cada día para dirigirse a la ladrillera en la cual trabaja como operario y recibe un considerable sueldo que le permite ofrecer una buena calidad de vida a su familia. Además paralelamente se dedica, durante sus ratos libres, a la atención en sus cabinas de alquiler de Internet que tiene en su casa, y cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo mayor quien es el administrador principal. Dice que el negocio de alquiler de cabinas de Internet le genera buenas ganancias, es por esta razón que en el futuro tiene planeado mejorar las instalaciones de su local y además quiere comprar más computadoras pues por su zona  no tiene competencia. Para el futuro también tiene planeado instalar un pequeño locutorio para implementar mejor su negocio. Es el sexto  crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron  posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Julio tiene planeado invertir el crédito en el mejoramiento de las instalaciones de su negocio de cabinas pues quiere mandar pintar el lugar e implementarlo mejor para comodidad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Julio, age 48, lives in his own home with his two children. The younger child is a high school student. Together they strive to get ahead. This hardworking gentleman wakes up each day so that he can go to his job as an operator at a brick factory. He receives a considerable salary that allows him to provide a good quality of life for his family. In addition, he rents out Internet booths in his house during his spare time and operates the business with the help of his oldest child who is the primary manager. Julio says his Internet business generates good profits. For this reason, he plans to improve his facilities in the future and purchase more computers since there is no competition in the area. He also plans to start a small call center so that he can expand his business even more.

This is his sixth loan with MFP. Julio promises to submit his payments on time because he does not want to look bad in the eyes of those who made this loan possible so that he could continue working and making progress. He plans to invest this loan in improvements to his Internet business. Julio will paint his establishment and furnish it in order to make his customers more comfortable.

loans.use: Paint his establishment & acquire furniture so that his customers will be more comfortable

loans.name: Mehmoodan's Group

texts.en:
Mehmoodan lives in a 2 roomed brick house with her family in Jaranwala, which is located in Punjab province of Pakistan and is known for its agriculture industry. She settled here after her marriage more than 20 years ago. She is a widow who lost her husband as a result of a sudden death. It was a very difficult time for her as, after the death of her husband, all the responsibilities came down on her shoulders. She recovered her senses for her children and raised them very well. Now both sons have their own business. Both of her sons operate a Punjabi food resturant. They offer a variety of food such as Nan chanay (made with chickpeas and served with bread) and Biryani (made with rice, chicken and served with yogurt and salad) and tea to their clients. They are very good people and have good business knowledge. They have an ability to attract customers with their good customer dealings and the quality of their food. 

Mehmoodan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sons business. With the loan, they will buy required items such as chickpeas, spices, cooking oil, rice & chicken in bulk quantities that will help them providing better quality services and food to their customers. 

Mehmoodan is hopeful that an investment will make her sons business more profitable and will also expand their business on larger scale. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she built a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Mehmoodan.

loans.use: To buy required items for restaurant business.

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.es:
La Sra. Evangelista es propietaria de una despensa en el barrio San José obrero, cuenta con clientela formada, está casada, tiene una hermosa familia conformada por la pareja y sus 4 hijos todos menores de edad.
Ella opto por el crédito con la Fundación para adquirir más mercaderías para su negocio a fin de proporcionar a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos.
El Cliente manifiesta su satisfacción por trabajar con la Fundación por el apoyo al desarrollo y crecimiento para su actividad.
texts.en:
Sra. Evangelista is the owner of a general store in the neighborhood of San José Obrero. She has an established customer base. Evangelista is married and has a beautiful family that consists of her husband and four children, all of whom are dependents.

She opted to receive a loan from Fundación Paraguaya to acquire more merchandise for her business so that she can provide her customers with a wider variety of products. Evangelista indicates she is satisfied with her working relationship with Fundación Paraguaya because of the support she has received to help develop and grow her business.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Gladys; ella tiene 24 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de celulares como claro,movistar y nextel , la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja , el negocio se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa esto les facilita el estar conjuntamente con su hijo.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más equipos de celulares y así poder tener mas variedad de modelos para ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the Communal Bank “Llankachinapac”, which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 24 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Gladys divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling mobile phones for Claro, Movistar, and Nextel. She and her husband work together. Their business is located in their home, which allows her to look after her child. Gladys is requesting a loan to buy more mobile phones so that she can offer a wider variety of models to her customers.

She is grateful to those have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Acquire different models of mobile phones

loans.name: Ama Hawa

texts.en:
Ama Hawa M. is a fishmonger at Elmina. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a fisherman. She and her husband take care of the children.

Ama’s loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for resale. She anticipates buying land from her increased capital.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to smoke

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 47 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Zenón de 47 años, que es verdulero, y de sus dos hijos los cuales son mayores de edad y ya trabajan; juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de salchipapas (papas fritas con salchichas acompañadas de cremas). Desde las 6 de la tarde todos los días saca su carrito salchipapero afuera de su casa y empieza con la venta que puede extenderse hasta las 11 de la noche, esto depende de que se terminen todos sus platillos. Le gusta mucho su labor porque la puede realizar en la comodidad de su hogar tiene muchos clientes que gustan de sus salchipapas; y a  veces cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos. Sin embargo le disgusta  que muchas veces no pueda salir pues su negocio tiene mayor acogida durante los fines de semana. También comercializa algunos regalos y adornos en una vitrina que tiene en su casa durante las tardes; y en ambos negocios le va bien porque las ganancias son considerables. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado construir de material noble su casa para convertir una de las piezas en un restaurante. Es el séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Carmen tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de material como cemento, arena y ladrillos pues empezará con la refacción de su casa para concretar sus planes.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 47, lives in her own home with her husband Zenón, age 47, who is a vegetable merchant. They have two grown children who are already working. Together they strive each day to get ahead. This hardworking woman sells “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes served with cream). Every day starting at 6pm, Carmen pulls her food cart in front of her house and begins selling. She can continue selling until 11pm depending on the number of dishes she prepares. Carmen enjoys what she does because she can work from the comfort of her home. She has many customers who enjoy her food and occasionally she receives help from her children. However, there are times when she dislikes not being able to leave her business unattended because her food is very popular on the weekends. In addition, Carmen sells gifts and decorations in the afternoons from a display cabinet that she has in her house. Both businesses have done well because they are profitable. Like any enterprising woman, she has plans for the future to build a house made of solid material so that she can convert one of the rooms into a restaurant.

This is her seventh loan with MFP and she promises to complete her payments on time. Carmen does not want to look back to those who made this loan possible so that she could continue working and making progress. She plans to invest the loan in materials such as cement, sand, and bricks so that she can begin remodeling her house and follow through with her plans.

loans.use: Purchase cement, sand, bricks, and other construction materials so that she can convert part of her house into a restaurant

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Juan; el tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1hijo; el socio tiene un negocio de venta de celulares de diferentes marcas como claro,movistar,nextel entre otros , el socio trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa en su casa ya que el   

El  socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de nuevos equipos de celulares.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is a member of the Communal Bank “Llankachinapac”, which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

He is 24 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Juan has a business selling mobile phones of different brands such as Claro, Movistar, Nextel, and others. He and his wife work together from their home. Juan is requesting a loan to buy new mobile phone equipment.
