He is grateful to those who have helped fulfill his dream and promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase new mobile phone equipment

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 36 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo Rogelio de 38 años y sus 2 hijos menores que aún estudian en el colegio; juntos se esfuerzan a diario en busca del  progreso. Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica desde hace 1 año a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca. Enseña su mercadería  a sus clientes a través del catálogo; y le gusta mucho su labor pues la realiza durante sus ratos libres lo que le permite seguir con las labores de su hogar. Todos los días sale a ofrecer sus productos a sus conocidos y nuevos clientes, camina durante largas horas bajo las constantes inclemencias del tiempo, pero esto no la desanima pues obtiene regulares ganancias con las que puede ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces existen clientes que se atrasan en el pago de los productos lo que no le permite cancelar a tiempo sus boletas y le atrasa su capital de trabajo. Además como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de comestibles en su casa. Aunque es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy comprometida con pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Carmen tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería de productos de belleza pues quiere obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Carmen is 36 years old and lives in her in-laws house, along with her husband, 38 year old Rogelio, and her two young children who attend school.  They work daily to get ahead.  This hard working woman has been selling a well known brand of beauty products for the past year.  She shows her merchandise via catalog and she enjoys her work because she can do it in her spare time and spend the rest of the time doing her household chores.

She goes out every day to offer her products to her friends and new customers.  She walks constantly for hours in all kinds of weather, but this does not discourage her because she makes a good income with which she can help her husband with the household expenses.  The one thing she doesn’t like is that she has some customers who fall behind in their payments, causing her to reduce her working capital.

Since she is an entrepreneurial woman, she plans to open a grocery store within her home.  Even though this will be her first loan through MFP, she is very committed to making her payments on time because she doesn’t want to develop a bad relationship with those who have made this support possible.

Carmen plans to invest the money from this loan in large quantities of beauty products so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Beug Lissa Samb Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BEUG LISSA S. est né le 24 avril 2010. Il regroupe 14 femmes qui habitent un même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de Maison Familiale Rurale

Madame Khady K., à droite de la photo, levant la main, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants en charge.

Elle fait un petit commerce de chaussures. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 2 ans. 

Avec son crédit elle va acheter de la marchandise pour revendre dans son quartier. Elle vend soit au comptant, soit à crédit

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Beug Lissa S. was created on April 24, 2010. It brings together 14 women who live in the same neighborhood, whose principal occupation is a small business. The group is part of the Banc Villageois de Maison Familiale Rurale.

Madame Khady K., at right in the photo, raising her hand, is the group leader. She is 45 years old. She is married and is the mother of and responsible for 8 children.

Madame K. runs a small business selling shoes, which she has done for the past two years.

With her loan, Madame K. will buy merchandise to re-sell in her neighborhood. She sells either for cash or credit.

Madame K.'s objective is to support her husband in taking care of their famiL..

loans.use: Buying shoes to re-sell.

loans.name: Villa Primavera Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Villa Primavera, con mucho esfuerzo y esmero ya están en el 7º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos, que es la de trabajar para apoyar económicamente  a sus familias en especial.
La Señora Wilma I., trabaja como limpiadora en una casa de familia de la ciudad, además de esta actividad, con su espíritu emprendedor realiza la venta de comidas en los eventos que se realizan en los distintos puntos de la ciudad, y en ferias organizadas por las mismas Señoras en la plaza, o mismo, frente a la oficina de Fundación Paraguaya. 
Manifiestan que gracias a esta oportunidad y forma de trabajo, más las capacitaciones recibidas, han logrado que sus ingresos y el nivel de vida de sus familias mejoren considerablemente.
Ella solicita el préstamo para el pago de unos gastos personales como de alimentación y vestimenta.
texts.en:
This group of women is known as “Villa Primavera” (Spring Village).  The women work together and are united in the program.  They are in their 7th cycle, thanks to their hard work.

Besides running their own businesses, they also work as a group, so that they can raise some funds to have some working capital within the group to mutually support one another in their overall goals, especially that of helping their families financially.

Wilma I. works as a cleaning woman in a private home in town.  Because of her entrepreneurial spirit, she also sells prepared food at the special events in different parts of the city, and at fairs organized by the ladies in the plaza or across from the Fundación Paraguaya office.

They tell us that they have increased their incomes and improved their quality of life for their families substantially; thanks to the new opportunities and training that they have received.  She is asking for this loan for personal expenses, such as food and clothing.

loans.use: Personal expesnses

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC ”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Francisco; el tiene 64 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; el socio es agricultor de profesión él se dedica al cultivo de flores,siendo esta su principal actividad, para luego distribuirlos a sus clientes que se encuentran en Cusco y también en Urubamba.
 
El socio solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su negocio y también para su uso personal.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the “Llankachiapac” communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Francisco is 64 years old, married, and has two children.  He is a farmer who raises flowers and delivers them to his customers in Cusco and Urbamba.  He is asking for this loan in order to invest into his business and also for personal expenses.

He appreciates those who have helped make this dream possible through this means and he is committed to making his payments on schedule.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 43 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo José de 44 años, que es electricista,  y sus 2 hijos menores que estudian en el colegio, juntos cada día se esfuerzan por salir adelante. Cada día esta emprendedora mujer se las ingenia para ayudar a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar, y por esta razón se dedica a varios oficios a la vez como por ejemplo: a  la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo a clientes ya conocidos; otro de los negocios que tiene, es el servicio de cosmetología, cuyos clientes siempre piden de su trabajo, por la habilidad que tiene en las manos para cortar el cabello y hacer peinados. Hace algunos años estudio cosmetología, pero no se dedicó por completo a esta labor pues sus hijos estaban pequeños, hoy quiere trabajar con mayor intensidad en este oficio. Le gusta mucho su labor como peluquera pues se entretiene y le genera regulares ganancias, también brinda el servicio de cosmetología a domicilio, lo que marca la diferencia. Aunque no tiene aún su propio salón de belleza tiene planeado para el futuro instalar uno en sociedad con una amiga. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Ana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de algunos materiales que necesita para continuar peinando, además de tintes y líquidos para desarrollar mejor su labor.
texts.en:
Ana is 43 years old and lives in a home of her own, alongside her husband, 44 year old Jose, who works as an electrician, and her two young children who attend school.  They work each day to get ahead.  Each day, this entrepreneurial woman uses her ingenuity to help her husband out with the constant household expenses.  For this reason she runs several businesses, such as: beauty product sales via catalog to current customers.  She also has a cosmetology business, where her customers request her service because of her ability to cut and style hair.  She began studying cosmetology a few years ago, but she did not complete the course because her children were very young.   Now she would like to work in this trade.

She enjoys working as a hair stylist because she understands this business and it brings her a good income.  She also provides in home service, which sets her apart.  She doesn’t have her own salon, but plans to set one up in partnership with a friend.

This will be her first loan through MFP and she promises to make all of her payment on time because she doesn’t want to be in bad standing with those who have made this support possible so that she can continue to work and move ahead.

Ana plans to invest the money from this loan in some supplies that she needs, such as hair coloring and other liquids that she needs for her business.

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, D. 45 años, vive en casa D. su madre, al lado D. sus 3 hermanas, y cada día se esfuerza por salir adelante en busca D. un futuro mejor. Esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza D. una reconocida marca y los años D. experiencia en el negocio le han enseñado a captar buenos clientes. Antes ofrecía sus productos D. casa en casa, sin embargo, en la actualidad sus compradoras la buscan para hacerle pedidos, pues es muy reconocida por la zona donD. vive, también en su vivienda ofrece variada mercadería en stock por lo que saca D. apuros a muchas D. sus clientes, quienes la buscan desesperadas por algún producto. Dice que obtiene considerables ganancias en su negocio, además recibe incentivos (regalos) D. la compañía para la que trabaja. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio e instalar un pequeño bazar en su casa, pues le gusta mucho el negocio. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado, en la compra D. mercadería en productos D. belleza pues quiere tenerlos en stock para ofrecerles en mayor cantidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and lives in her mother’s house, along with her three sisters.  Every day she works hard to move ahead in search of a better future.  This enterprising woman sells a well known brand of beauty products and her years of experience have shown her how to find new customers.  She used to sell door to door but now her customers seek her out to place orders with her.  She is well known within her zone and also sells a variety of items from her home, where she can quickly win over new customers who are looking for certain products.

She tells us that she earns considerable earnings in her business and also receives gifts from the company she works for.  Since she is such an entrepreneurial woman, she plans to expand her business and open a small paper goods store within her home because she likes business very much.

This will be her second loan through MFP and she promises to make all of her payments on time, since she does not want to be in bad light with those who have maD. this support possible, which will allow her to keep working and moving ahead.  Maria plans to invest the money into more beauty products that she needs to have in stock in order to meet her customers’ demands.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: Fortunata, de 31 años, está casada con Nilo, de 44 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Noralei, de 16 y Jair de 10 años. Los tres viven como una gran familia en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Puente Paucartambo. Desde que era joven, se dedicó a la agricultura, sus principales sembríos son café y cítricos. Y durante 10 años, Fortunata pudo adquirir muchas cosas, como la construcción de su vivienda con materiales de buena calidad y esto gracias a la labor ardua que realiza. Ya con el tiempo, juntó  capital necesario para abrir un negocio de venta de comestibles, dulces y bebidas. De eso hace tan solo 4 años, tiempo suficiente para poder brindar a los pobladores de la localidad una buena atención y sobre todo un buen precio. Esto la llevo a adquirir cada día más ganancias. Ahora Fortunata, vende su producción de frutas a la capital, pero sin descuidar su negocio; en donde tiene pensado invertir más dinero, en la mejora de su infraestructura. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP y cuenta orgullosa todos los inconvenientes que tubo que pasar en estos años. Los que gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal, pudo afrontar sin mayores problemas. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar varias cajas de gaseosa y cerveza, como también dulces, y demás productos para surtir su negocio.
texts.en: Fortunata, of 31 years old, is married to Nilo, of 44 years old.  The both of them have two children: Noralei of 16 and Jair of 10 years old.  The three of them live together as one big family in their own home, located in the locality of Puente Paucartambo.  Since she was young, she worked in agriculture.  Her main cultivations are coffee and citric plants.  For 10 years, Fortunata was able to acquire many things, such as the construction of her residence with good quality materials, all thanks to her hard labour.  With time, she gathered together the necessary capital to open a business, selling groceries, sweets, and beverages.  In only 4 years, it was enough time to offer the inhabitants of her locality excellent service and above all great prices.  This has led her to increase her earnings on a daily basis.  Nowadays, Fortunata sells her fruits to the capital but without disregarding her other business, in which she has planned on investing more money in the improvement of its infrastructure.  This is her eighth credit with MFP and proudly retells all of the inconveniences that has happened to her this past year.  Thanks to the support of her communal bank, she has been able to confront them without any large problems.  From this credit, she plans on purchasing various crates of soft drinks and beer, in addition to sweets and other products with which to stock her business.

loans.use: Purchase crates of beer, soft drinks, and other products, such as gummy candy.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda, de 47 años, está casada con Luis, de 46 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijas, pero solo vive con uno de ellas: Jhellica, de 15 años. A la educan y crían en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Hace algún tiempo, que Olinda dio un gran paso en la agricultura. En tan solo 2 años se convirtió en una comerciante mayorista, exitosa. No solo de frutas. Las que por cierto, vende muy bien y con buenas ganancias. Si no también en la compra de carne de pescado y de pollo, los cuales vende los días jueves y viernes al por mayor, en las diferentes ciudades del país. Donde el pescado de río, “de la selva peruana”, son muy cotizados. Por todos los logros obtenidos hasta el momento, Olinda está planeando, abrir una tienda de mercadería “grande y muy abastecida”, con la que pueda abastecer la demanda de capital y de las principales ciudades del país. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP y, como integrante antigua de su banco comunal, se siente agradecida con el apoyo recibido durante estos años. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar más cantidad de mercadería, que consta de carne de pescado y pollo.
texts.en:
47-year old Olinda is married to Luis who is 46 years old. They have two daughters, but only 15-year old Jhellica lives with them. They are raising her in their own home located in Puente Paucartambo in the central region of the Peruvian rainforest. 

Some time ago Olinda took up farming. In two short years she became a successful wholesale merchant, not only selling fruit (which sells very well and generates good profits), but also fish and chicken. The latter she sells on Thursdays and Fridays in different towns where fish from the rivers of the rainforest are much sought after. 

Because of all her successes to date, Olinda is now planning to open a large, well-stocked store from which to fill orders from the capital and the other main cities. This is her eighth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and as a long-established member of her community bank, she feels grateful for the support received over the years. Once she has received the loan she is seeking, she is thinking of buying more merchandise, specifically fish and chicken.

loans.use: to buy fish and chicken

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela de 51 años, está casada con Marcos, de 60 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo viven con uno de ellos: Omar de 25 años. Los tres como una gran familia, viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Como mujer trabajadora, apoya a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Pues la agricultura, actividad de Marco, les proporcionan lo necesario para poder sobrevivir: “techo y comida”. Pero con una mirada emprendedora; Marcela, hace 7 años abrió una pequeña tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Desde las primeras horas del día, los habitantes de la localidad visitan su tienda, pues ellos saben lo surtida que se mantiene, “siempre encuentran lo necesario”. Ya en sus tiempos libres, de dedica a la costura, todos la conocen y, constantemente la buscan para ofrecerle trabajo. Los clientes que ganó, le hizo aumentar sus ventas; es por ello que para más adelante desea comprarse una máquina industrial, con la que está segura podrá cocer con mayor facilidad y rapidez. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y como autoridad de su banco comunal, se siente satisfecha del apoyo que puede realizar. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar paneton, chocolate y todo lo necesario para surtir su tienda en está navidad. Y si el dinero le alcanza, podrá comprar la máquina industrial de coser que tanto sueña.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 51, is married to Marcos, 60.  They have three children but only one of them, Omar, 25, lives with them.  The three of them form a great family.  They live in their own house located in Puente Paucartambo (Peruvian central jungle).  As a hard working woman she helps her husband meet household expenses.  Marco’s work, which is farming, produces the basics for them to survive: “a roof over their heads and food on the table.” But, with her eye toward enterprise, Marcela opened a small grocery store 7 years ago to sell basic need items.

From first daylight residents in the area visit her store because they know how well stocked she has it, “they always find everything necessary.” In her spare time she likes to sew and everyone knows her and seeks her out to offer her sewing jobs.  Customers she has gained have increased her sales so she’d like to buy an industrial sewing machine so that she can sew more easily and quickly.

This is her 5th loan with MFP and as an authority in her communal bank she feels satisfied with the support this can bring.  If she gets the requested loan, she plans to buy panettones (a cake typically consumed during the Christmas season), chocolate and everything else to stock her store for Christmas.  If the money goes far enough, she will buy the industrial sewing machine that she so dreams about having.

loans.use: To buy panettones to stock her store and also to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Kipkelwon

texts.en:
J. Kipkelwon is a 54 year old dairy farmer married to Truphena Chepchieng. J. has been blessed with six  children age between 12 years and 29 years. J. supports a family of seven and his spouse adds to his income by an average of KES2000 a month from her grocery business.
  
J. has been in the dairy farming business for almost two years. From this business, J. gets a profit of KES3,000 a month. He has borrowed a second loan of KES15,000 after successfully paying the first loan. He intends to use the whole amount to buy a dairy cow to raise for milk production.

J. anticipates to use the profits from this business to start an horticulture farming business to subsidize his income. J. dreams and hopes to be a large scale dairy farmer and to be able to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Albert Keror

texts.en:
Albert Keror L. is a 28-year-old farmer who grows vegetables and sells them to his customers at a profit. He is married to Sally Kipsoi, a housewife, and they have two children aged 2 and 1. Albert operates his farm in Kibigos Kapsowar in the town of Eldoret and he has been in this business for about six years.

Albert was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and he has no other history with any MFI. He is applying for his second loan of KES 20,000 with KADET LTD which he plans to use to lease a farm and buy seedlings.

Albert hopes to operate a large vegetable farm, whereby he would be able to supply vegetables to secondary schools, to the local market and, in the future, to the town of Eldoret.

loans.use: to lease a farm and buy seedlings

loans.name: El Rincon De Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El comité El Rincón de las Amigas se dio mediante la formación del comité La Familia del barrio San Salvador el cual se encontraba en su segunda reunión de formación y la cantidad de integrantes superó el máximo permitido por lo que se formo dos comités.
 Actualmente el comité está conformado por 15 integrantes y se encuentran en el noveno ciclo del programa. 
La señora Rossana es una de las integrantes, ella cuenta con un negocio en su casa, donde ofrece artículos  generales. 
Gran parte de su tiempo lo dedica a la atención de su negocio, pero la ayuda constantemente su familia en todas las tareas que tiene.
Actualmente cuenta con la opción de elaborar comestibles para vender a sus clientes ya que acuden en su negocio en todo momento y quiere aprovechar esto para aumentar sus ingresos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumo que estará utilizando en la venta de  comestibles, especialmente carnes, aceites, verduras y otros.
texts.en:
The El Rincón de las Amigas (The Girlfriends’ Nook) committee came about through the formation of the La Familia (The Family) committee in the San Salvador neighborhood which was in its second organizational meeting.  The number of members surpassed the maximum allowed so two committees were formed.  It currently has 15 members who are in their ninth cycle in the program.

Rossana is one of the members.  She has a store in her home selling general merchandise.  Much of her time is spent tending to the business but her family helps constantly with all the chores she has.

She now has the option of preparing food to sell to her customers since they come by the store at all hours and she wants to take advantage of this to increase income.

She is asking for a loan to buy the ingredients she will use in meal preparation, especially meats, oils, vegetables and others.

loans.use: To buy meat, cooking oil and others.

loans.name: Daniel Patita Ole

texts.en:
Daniel Patita Ole K.  is 32 years old. He is married to Naisuaku Ene Kasoe and is the father of four school-going children. Daniel has been farming on his own piece of land for the last nine years.

He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a Kadet registered client. This will be his first loan, and he is planning to spend the KES 40,000 to buy young bulls for fattening, selling them later. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to expand his kiosk. His future dream is  to do well in business, becoming a commercial businessman. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his set goals.

loans.use: to buy young bulls for fattening and selling

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
El señor Luciano A. está casado con la señora Casilda Duarte, tienen tres hijos.
Don Luciano anteriormente se dedicaba a la cría de ganado y venta de leche.
 Hace aproximadamente 15 años decidió abrir una pequeña despensita para así tener un ingreso más para de esa forma poder sustentar los estudios de sus hijos.
 Fue así que recurrió a la Fundación Paraguaya para solicitar un crédito y el mismo invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías como fideos, harina, panificados, bebidas, todos  de primera necesidad.
Luciano A. en un futuro piensa montar su propia panadería.
texts.en:
Mr. Luciano A. is married to Mrs. Casilda Duarte; they have three children.

Luciano used to raise cattle and sell milk.

About fifteen years ago he decided to open a small grocery store to have extra income a be able to pay for his children’s schooling.

This was how he called upon Fundación Paraguaya to solicit a loan to buy merchandise like: noodles, flour, baked goods, beverages; all basic need items.

Luciano A. hopes to set up his own bakery in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, flour, baked goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David K. is 26 years old and married to Jane Koech, a housewife. They have two children aged 4 and 6. David resides in Kampi ya Moto in the town of Koibatek where he runs a Coca-Cola soft drink depot, selling sodas at wholesale prices and distributing them to nearby retailers. David has been in this business for the last three years. He earns an average profit of KES 10,000 per month. He has previously borrowed KES 60,000 and successfuly repaid it. 

David plans to use KES 40,000 of this loan to purchase more soft drinks and KES 20,000 to start horticultural farming. He anticipates using his profits to expand his farming and save for his children's education. His dreams and hopes are to become a leading Coca-Cola distributor in the South Rift Valley Region and to be a large scale horticultural farmer.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of soft drinks and to start farming

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat lives in Jaranwala, a small city in the Punjab region of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She lives with her family in the area of Anwerabad in a 2-room brick house. Mussarat has 3 children: 2 sons and a daughter. All of them are getting their education from a nearby school. Mussarat is a housewife. She is a very active lady and always shows full support to her husband in difficult times.

Mussarat has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her husband’s fruit selling business. With the loan, he will buy more seasonal fruits to sell to his customers. Mussarat is hopeful that through the loan investment her husband will be able to increase his sales and earn more income. Mussarat is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan years, she has paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.

Note: In the photo, Mussarat is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad, de 39 años, está casada con Fernando, de 40 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos todos ellos menores de edad. En unión familiar, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Pampamichi (selva central peruana). En la exótica selva peruana, encontramos el lugar turístico de “Pampamichi”, donde veremos varios recreos turísticos, lagunas y miradores. Es ahí donde Soledad, hace 18 años viene ofreciendo artesanía propia del lugar; su tienda está ubicada en el recreo “Kitari”, donde los fines de semana tiene gran afluencia; ya que los collares a base de semillas de monte, pulseras, flechas y flautas; cautivan a sus visitantes. Lo que más le gusta a Soledad es la creatividad que desarrolla en la elaboración de la artesanía, según cuenta proviene de una familia de artesanos y música, por ello le es fácil concentrarse y crear nuevos diseños. Pero no solo a eso se dedica ella, también vende bebidas y productos comestibles en su tienda, con esto le da un valor agregado a su negocio; donde cada día tiene mayores ganancias, por ello para más delante desea invertir más en la mejora del servicio. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y, espera surgir como otras personas lo hicieron; con la constancia y perseverancia que la caracteriza está segura que lo logrará. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar, varias telas y artesanías. Ya que en está época es donde los turistas visitan con mayor frecuencia.
texts.en:
Soledad, 39, is married to Fernando, 40.  They have four minor children.  They live together as a family in their own house located in the community of Pampamichi (Peruvian central jungle). Pampamichi, a tourist destination, is found in the exotic Peruvian jungle.  It has various tourist recreational areas, lagoons and scenic overlooks.  This is where Soledad has been selling crafts typical of the area for 18 years.  Her store, which is quite crowded on weekends because the necklaces made from seeds, bracelets, arrows and flutes capture the attention of visitors, is located in the “Kitari” recreational area. 

What Soledad most enjoys is the creativity she can unleash making her crafts.  According to what she told us, she comes from a family of artisans and musicians.  This is why it’s easy for her to concentrate and create new designs.

However, this isn’t her only activity.  She also sells beverages and food items in her store providing added value to her business.  Every day profits are better and this is why she wants to invest more to improve service.

This is her first loan with MFP and she hopes to surge forward like others have done.  She is sure that with her characteristic constancy and perseverance she will accomplish this.

If she should get the loan, she will buy various fabrics and crafts because this is the season when tourists visit more frequently.

loans.use: To buy fabric and handicrafts.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José Carlos, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive en su propia casa con su familia, él tiene 61 años de edad.
Él se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura desde que era niño, actualmente el cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos para hacer el trabajo y además paga mozos para que también ayuden,  Don José está solicitando un préstamo para comprar terneros de repasto, con esta ayuda el estará atendiendo a más ganado e ira progresando con su negocio.
Su proyección es seguir trabajando los terrenos, aumentar poco a poco el número de ganado, cultivar maíz y recibir buenas cosechas para continuar ayudando a sus hijos a tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
José Carlos farms and raises cattle.  He lives in the El Transito department of San Miguel, and lives in his own house with his family.  He is 61 years old.

He has been raising cattle and farming since he was a child.  Now his children help him with the work.  He also pays young men to help him.  Don José is asking for a loan to buy feeder calves.  With the help of this loan, he will have more cattle and will make progress with his business.  

His goal is to continue working the land, gradually increasing the number of cattle, growing corn and having good harvests in order to continue helping his children earn more.

loans.use: Purchase of feeder calves

loans.name: Aidee

texts.es: Aidee, de 45 años; está casada con Pablo, de 56 años, ambos tuvieron 4 hijos, pero solo viven con una de ellos: Marco, de 17 años. A quien educan y crían en su casa propia ubicada en el barrio “Santa Rosa”, de la comunidad Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). El Trabajo que realiza Aidee, es muy diverso: Desde, costura, hasta un pequeño negocio de comestibles, que implementó en un de los ambientes de su casa. Hace apenas dos años que sus ganancias están incrementando considerablemente y esto debido a los diferentes ingresos que tiene. El negocio de compra y venta de pollos, la venta de hamburguesas en su localidad y la tienda de productos de primera necesidad; la hacen sentirse una mujer desarrollada. Por ello para más adelante desea expandir su negocio, no solo con comestibles, también una fuente de soda. Dando a su población; según sus propias palabras “un lugar donde puedan conseguir todo”. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y, como todas las integrantes de su banco comunal se siente satisfecha con el trabajo realizado, ya que les ayuda a salir adelante. Con el crédito solicitado, está pensando implementar su tienda de comestibles, con productos de primera necesidad y carne de pollo.
texts.en: Aidee, 45, is married to Pablo, 56, and they have 4 children.  But only Marco, who is 17, still lives with them.  They raised their children in their own home, located in the Santa Rosa neighborhood in the community of Puente Paucartambo (in the central Peruvian forest).  Aidee does a variety of types of work; she does sewing and also has a small food store that she set up in her house.  In just the last 2 years her earnings have increased considerably, owing to the different sources of income that she has. The business of buying and selling chickens, the sale of hamburgers in her area, and the store selling basic consumer goods make her feel like a very accomplished woman.  Because of this, in the future she wants to expand her business, not only with food but also to include sales of soda, giving the people in her area, according to her own words "a place where one can find anything." This is her 4th loan with MFP, and like all the members of her communal bank she feels satisfied with the work she does, which is helping her to get ahead.  With the loan she requests, she plans to stock her food store with basic consumer goods and chicken meat.

loans.use: to buy perishable food products and basic consumer goods for her store

loans.name: Unidos Por Un Futuro Group

texts.es:
CLEONIS D. M., tiene 42 años, es separado, tiene un hijo menor D. edad y vive en el distrito D. Comas. Pertenece al grupo “UNIDOS POR UN FUTURO”.
Hace 10 años se dedica a dar servicio D. taxi durante el día, ya que al separarse D. su esposa se le juntaron los problemas D. falta D. trabajo y un amigo le propuso alquilarle su carro. Cleonis acepto porque tenía la necesidad D. trabajar para atender a su menor hijo  y con el paso D. los años logro juntar su capital y adquirió su carro propio. 
Actualmente pueD. cubrir los gastos básicos para la alimentación y educación D. su hijo ya que, considera primordial deseando convertirlo en profesional. 
El préstamo solicitado en ésta oportunidad es para invertir en el mantenimiento D. su carro, siendo una D. sus metas adquirir otro para complementar el negocio. 
Cleonis manifiesta que gracias a EDAPROSPO ha conseguido progresar en su negocio y en su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Cleonis D. M. is 42 years old, divorced with a young son, and lives in the district of Comas. He belongs to the group "UNIDOS POR UN FUTURO".
For 10 years he has maD. a living by providing a taxi service during the day. After separating with his wife, problems were adding up due to a lack of employment, and a friend of his proposed to rent him his car. Cleonis accepted because he needed to work in order to take care of his son, and after a few years he managed to earn enough capital to acquire his own car.
Currently, he can cover basic costs for food and his son's education, which he considers essential, since he would like his son to become a professional.
The loan requested at this time will be invested in the maintenance of his car, and one of his goals is to eventually acquire another one to complement his business.
Cleonis says that thanks to EDAPROSPO, he has managed to progress in his business and in his family life.

loans.use: To invest in the maintenance of their car

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen K. is 37 years old and married to Hellen Mwithia. His children are John Kiprop, 13, Carren Jepchirchir, 9, Kiptoo, 6, and Martin Kipkoech, 4. Stephen has been operating a beauty salon for nine years as his primary business. He also practices dairy farming. His monthly income from the business is KES 24,000 with additional income from milk sales.

Stephen is borrowing KES 50,000 for a period of 12 months. He plans to use KES 25,000 to purchase stock for the salon in order to meet the demands of Christmas holiday customers and KES 25,000 to buy another dairy cow to increase milk production. Stephen will use the profit from the business to expand it by buying more machines, such as dryers, for the salon. His hopes and dreams are to expand the business and even open a big wholesale cosmetics shop to supply other beauty operators.

loans.use: to purchase stock for the salon and to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Ana Elsa

texts.es:
Ana Elsa, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, ella vive donde una cuñada y tiene una hija que está estudiando en la universidad, su negocio es una tienda donde ofrece productos necesarios para el hogar,  el negocio lo administra desde hace 10 años y además de ofrecer productos de la canasta básica, como jabón, arroz, frijoles, también ofrece a los estudiantes útiles escolares. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para la tienda y útiles escolares, con esta inversión ella quiere ofrecer a los clientes todo lo relacionado al hogar, además contar con un buen inventario capaz para atender la demanda, al mismo tiempo aprovecha que ya viene la época donde los padres de familia compran útiles para el siguiente año escolar.  
El sueño de Ana Elsa es tener un negocio fuerte, con buen número de clientes y mejorar los ingresos del hogar.
texts.en:
Ana Elsa lives in San Rafael Oriente in the department of San Miguel. She lives with her sister-in-law and has a daughter who is is a university student. Ana Elsa has run a store for the last ten years selling products for the home and basic supplies such as soap, rice, and beans. She also sells school supplies.

Ana Elsa is seeking a loan to buy more merchandise for the store and school supplies. She wishes to be able to offer her customers everything related to the home. With a well-stocked store she can fill any request. As well she wishes to take advantage of the upcoming school year when parents are buying supplies for their children.

Ana Elsa’s dream is to have a healthy business with lots of customers, and to earn more money.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, beans, soap) and school supplies

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Ramzan's Group

texts.en:
Ramzan is a resident of a city named Jaranwala in Pakistan. She owns a small house consisting of two rooms and lives in it with her family of seven children and a husband.  

Her eldest son is a salesman and runs a shop where he sells car batteries. Her next son works in a factory and the other two sons work in general stores. Her three daughters stay at home and manage the household responsibilities with their mother.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her son’s car battery selling business. With the loan, he will buy more car batteries from different companies to sell through his shop. The variety of car batteries will enable him to fulfill the timely needs of his customers.  

Ramzan is hopeful that by investing the loan money in her son’s business, he will be able to become more successful and increase his income. Her husband also operates the same type of business selling car batteries. He has always guided his son for the improvement of his business and gives him useful tips as well.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she has proved herself to be a responsible client who has paid her installments on time and attended every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ramzan.

loans.use: To buy car batteries for selling

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita, de 49 años, está casada, con Julio, de 51 años. Ambos tienen 9 hijos, pero solo vive con 3 de ellos: Gerson, de 14, Ursula, de 12 y Jordan, de 10 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica Rita, es la agricultura, ahí todas las mañanas junto a su esposo Julio, se dirigen a cuidar sus plantaciones de café, plátanos y yuca. Los que constantemente aplican abono y cuidan, ya que, lo que más le gusta a Rita, es verlos crecer y desarrollarse satisfactoriamente; recompensa que después de cada cosecha, recibe agradecidamente en sus ganancias. Sus principales compradores son de la misma zona, ya que en los 20 años de experiencia obtuvo buenos intermediarios, que conocen de la calidad de granos que produce Rita. Razón por la cual está pensando, mejorar su producción para obtener más ganancias. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y agradece la oportunidad que le ofreció su banco comunal, donde está segura que saldrá adelante. Es por ello que ya ha pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de varios sacos de abono que esparcirá sobre sus sembríos de café.
texts.en:
49-year old Rita is married to Julio who is 51 years old. They have nine children, but only three still live with them: Gerson aged 14, Ursula aged 12, and Jordan aged 10. The family lives in their own house located in the community of Sanchirio in the rainforest of central Peru.

Rita earns her living through farming. Every morning she and her husband Julio set off to work in their coffee, banana, and yucca fields. 
They apply fertilizer on a regular basis as well as care for the crops. Rita’s greatest pleasure is seeing the crops grow and develop satisfactorily, then being rewarded by a good harvest, and finally gratefully receiving the income from the produce.

Her main customers are from the same area where she lives, as in her 20 years of experience she has developed good contacts who know the quality of her products. For this reason she is thinking of improving production to obtain more income. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is grateful for the opportunity offered by her community bank to better her prospects. Rita is planning to use the money to buy several bags of fertilizer to spread on the coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María, tiene 28 años D. edad, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera, administra una tienda donD. ofrece artículos D. primera necesidad, ella vive junto a su esposo, y su hijo Cesar D. 4 años D. edad, su esposo trabaja en una agencia D. viajes juntos velan por el bienestar del hogar.
Este negocio fue iniciativa propia como una alternativa para tener ingresos y crecer económicamente, lo tienen en su propia casa y el horario para vender no es fijo; actualmente solicitan un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería para el negocio como arroz, azúcar, maíz, frijoles y aceite, con el dinero D. este préstamo ellos estarán adquiriendo todo lo que necesitan para ofrecer a los clientes y tener la oportunidad D. mejorar sus ingresos.
Su principal proyecto es que su negocio cuente con la mercadería que demandan los clientes, que sea prospero y que le ayuD. a cubrir las necesidades del hogar, que su hijo crezca sano con todo lo necesario para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
María is 28 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera. She looks after a shop where she offers daily items. María lives together with her husband and her son, Cesar, 4 years old. Her husband works in a travel agency and together they watch over the wellbeing of their home.

This business was María's own initiative, begun as an alternative way of earning income and growing economically. She has the business in her own home and the hours that she sells aren't fixed. She is seeking a loan to purchase stock for the business such as rice,  sugar, maize, beans and oil. With the money from this loan María and her husband will be acquiring what they need to offer customers and have better opportunities to improve their earnings.

María's principal goal is that her business has the stock that her customers demand, that it is prosperous and that it helps her cover the household costs, that her son grows up to be healthy with everything he needs for his development.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise, namely domestic items (oil, sugar, soap)

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. María R. tiene 45 años y está casada con el Sr. Porfirio Amarilla de 47 años, cuentan con 3 hijos todos varones de 28, 22  y 9 años, estudiando actualmente.
La señora siempre fue comerciante contando con varios negocios, su marido es mecánico automotriz, actualmente cuenta con una despensa en su domicilio abasteciendo a los vecinos del lugar, cuenta con varios clientes formados.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderias para su despensa como:galletas, arroz, fideo, azúcar, leche, huevo, aceite, bebidas.
 
Le gustaría abrir un local de  ventas de lubricantes ya que su marido es mecánico ya que sus clientes son potenciales compradores.Aseguran que seguirar trabajando por su objetivo.
texts.en:
María R. is 45 years old and is married to Porfirio Amarilla, 47. They have 3 children, all boys, 28, 22 and 9, who are studying. María was always business-minded, and has had various businesses. Her husband is an auto mechanic. María has a grocery store in their house, supplying the neighbours in their area, and she has various regular customers. She is seeking a loan to purchase merchandise for her store such as biscuits, rice, pasta, sugar, milk, eggs, oil and softdrinks.

María would like to open a store selling oil and lubricants, as her husband is a mechanic and his customers are potential purchasers. They assure us that they will continue working towards their objective.

loans.use: Purchase biscuits, rice, pasta, milk, eggs, oil and softdrinks.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in Jaranwala which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, which is known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a two room brick house with her family in the area named Anwerabad. She came here many years ago with her family. 

To financially assist her husband, she weaves carpets. She is very good in her art and her carpets sell for a very good price. Besides doing her business, she manages her household work very well. She completes a carpet in a three month time period and earns a very good price which allows her to manage the financial expenses without any difficulty.  

She has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son operates a tandoor (a kind of wood burning oven which is made with mud and used to make breads). The other son works in a motor cycle repair shop for a low income. Her daughter is very young and she is studying in a 5th level class. 

Her husband is also involved in the bread making business like his son. His tandoor is located in the market and his business makes him a good income every month. 

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy flour and firewood in bulk quantities that will enable him to make more bread to sell. She is hopeful that by investing loan money in his business, her husband will be able to improve his business condition and make more income. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. She is a responsible client and has maintained a good credit record in each of her loan years.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy flour and firewood for a bread making business

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonio, tiene una panadería, reside en la ciudad de San Miguel con su esposa y sus dos hijos quienes dependen económicamente de él, tiene 30 años de edad,  el proceso de su trabajo es el siguiente, todas las mañanas elabora el pan y por las tardes lo vende, la panadería la tiene en su casa; por el momento solicita un préstamo para la construcción de su propia casa y mudarse ahí junto con la panadería, con esta ayuda el tendrá local propio, no pasara preocupaciones, tendrá a su familia más cómodamente.
Sueña con crecer mucho y montar una gran panadería que abastezca la zona y cuente con muchos clientes, ver a su familia en mejores condiciones.
texts.en: José Antonio is 30 years old and has a bakery. He lives in San Miguel city with his wife and 2 children who depend on him economically. The process of his job is continual, every morning he makes the bread and sells it in the afternoons. The bakery is located in his current house and he is seeking a loan to construct his own home and move together with the bakery - with this nhelp he will have his own space, won't be as worried and his family will be more comfortable. José Antonio dreams of growing his business a lot and establishing a large bakery which supplies the zone and that has many customers, and to see his family live in better conditions.

loans.use: Construct his home

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana, D. 28 años, convive con Edgardo, D. 29 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Luis, D. 11 y Darwin D. 1 año D. edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en L. comunidad D. Sanchirio (selva central peruana). Está valerosa mujer, trabaja constantemente en el cuidado D. sus 3 hectáreas D. terreno agrícolas, ya tiene 12 años dedicándose a ello; siendo sus principales cultivos el café y plátanos. Los que después D. cada cosecha comercializa en L. cooperativa D. su comunidad y cada 15 días lleva su fruto D. plátanos en el mercado central D. su ciudad. Pero en los tiempos D. ocio, Diana trabaja en otros terrenos agrícolas, como peón, ya que según afirma, “le gusta estar activa”. Por esa razón más adelante desea juntar capital para comprar más terrenos agrícolas y D. esa manera extender su siembra. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y según afirma está contenta D. pertenecer al banco comunal más respetado D. su localidad. Es por ello que ya ha pensado invertir el crédito en L. compra D. 5 sacos D. abono orgánico para sus cultivos D. café.
texts.en: Diana who is 28 years old lives with her partner Edgar, 29 years old, and their two sons, Luis, 11, and Darwin, 1, in their own house in the community of Sanchirio (central Peruvian jungle).  She is a courageous woman, constantly working to care for their 3 hectares of agricultural land and has been doing so for 12 years.  Their main crops are coffee and bananas.  After each harvest they are sold in the community cooperative and every 15 days, the bananas are sold in the central city market.  In her free time, Diana works in other farmland as a laborer because as she says, “she likes to be active".  For that reason, she wants to raise capital to buy more agricultural land and extend her sowing.   It is the first credit with MFP, and she is happy to belong to the most respected communal bank in her area.  This is why she has already thought about investing the loan in the purchase of 5 bags of compost for her coffee crops.

loans.use: To buy 5 bags of compost

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar  S. G.   es conocido por ser un excelente socio de la Empresa de Crédito  en la Comunidad de Florida Guanacaste.
El toda su vida se ha dedicado a la ganadería, pero Don Edgar quiere un préstamo de ₡600 000  (seiscientos mil colones) para la compra de  4 novillos de engorde. El quiere meterse de lleno nuevamente en el negocio de la Ganadería, para mejorar sus ingresos y asegurar el estudio de su hijo.
Don Edgar es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal  Florida S.A, una de las más de 100 organizaciones  socias de EDESA.
texts.en: Edgar S. G. is known for being an excellent credit partner with the Credit Business in the Florida Guanacaste Community. His life has been dedicated to livestock, but Don Edgar wants a loan of ₡600 000 (six hundred thousand colons) for the purchase of 4 fattening steers. He wants to get into the business of the livestock again to improve his income and ensure his child’s studies.  Don Edgar is a partner of the credit business in the community of Florida S.A., one of the more than 100 EDESA partner organizations.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Gerrado

texts.es: Gerrado, de 42 años, es un responsable padre soltero, junto a su hija Jessica, de 14 años edad vive en unión familiar, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica Gerrado es la agricultura, hace 8 años que viene sembrando café y diversos productos oriundos de la selva peruana. Es el más trabajador de su comunidad, pues la frase que siempre repite Gerrado es “de sol a sol se hace un millón”. En tiempos de campaña agrícola vende su café a la cooperativa de su comunidad, pero en temporadas bajas, vende sus frutos por unidad en el mercado central de su ciudad. Lo que más le gusta a él, es el trabajo del campo; por ello más adelante está pensando comprar más terrenos agrícolas, donde pueda sembrar en mayor cantidad. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y asegura que se siente satisfecho por todo el apoyo y confianza que recibió en está etapa de crecimiento y desarrollo. Es por ello que ya ha pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico, y si el dinero le alcanza invertirá en terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en: Gerrado, 42, is a responsible single father to his daughter Jessica, 14, who lives with him in his own house located in the native community of Sanchirio (central Peruvian jungle).  His work is agriculture and for 8 years now he has been planting coffee and various native products from the Peruvian jungle.  He is the best worker in his community and the phrase he always repeats is "from sunrise to sunset to make a million”.  During the agricultural season, he sells his coffee at the community cooperative and in the off season, he sells his fruits per unit in the central city market. What he likes most is the work in the field which is why he is thinking of buying more farmland where he can plant a greater amount.  It is the first credit with MFP, and he feels satisfied with the full support and confidence he received in the growth and development stage. This is why he has already planned to invest the loan in the purchase of several bags of compost, and if he has enough money, to invest in finishing the construction his house.

loans.use: To buy bags of compost and to finish building his house

loans.name: Casimiro

texts.es:
Casimiro A. G., quiere empezar el nuevo año  con la posibilidad de tener  unos más novillos  para venderlos a muy buen precio.
El tiene mucha experiencia en la ganadería, y en este momento necesita un préstamo de ₡500 000  (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de  3 novillos para engorde, con el fin de venderlos a u mejor precios el próximo año. De esta manera y aprovechando su experiencia  se va asegurar una fuente de ingresos para  mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 
Don Casimiro es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal  Florida S.A, una de las más de 100 organizaciones  socias de EDESA.
texts.en: Casimiro A. G. wants to begin the New Year with the possibility of having more cattle to sell at a good price.  He has a lot of experience with livestock and now needs a loan of ₡500 000 (500 hundred thousand  colones) to purchase 3 steers to sell next year at a good price.  In this way he will ensure a source of income to improve the quality of life of his family.  Don Casimiro is a partner of the credit business in the community of Florida S.A., one of the more than 100 EDESA partner organizations.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 22 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador, él vive en una pequeña casa que acondicionó en su terreno agrícola, donde según afirma puede cuidar de sus sembríos en la comunidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). Desde que era niño sus padres le enseñaron todo lo que tenía que aprender para sembrar, desde entonces disfruto del tiempo que pasaba en el campo ayudando a sus padres. Hasta hace 4 años, adquirió un terreno agrícola donde pudo por fin comenzar su propia producción. Sus cultivos constan de café, plátano y piña, los que después de cada cosecha y buen cuidado, los comercializa a buen precio en la cooperativa de su localidad. Pero las frutas, lo vende a los intermediarios que constantemente visitan el mercado central de su ciudad. Como tiene poco tiempo en la agricultura, desea seguir creciendo y mejorando la calidad de los cultivos. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y según menciona, la invitación que recibió del banco comunal de su localidad fue muy buena, pues necesitaba de apoyo para lograr sus objetivos. Es por ello que ya ha pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de 4 mil plantas de café, para comenzar con la renovación de sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en: Luis, 22, is a single worker who lives in a small house he fixed on his agricultural land in the community of Sanchirio (central Peruvian jungle) where he can care for his crops. Since he was a child his parents taught him all he had to learn to sow and since then he enjoyed the time he spent in the field helping his parents. Four years ago he acquired agricultural land where he could finally start his own production of crops.  He cultivates coffee, banana and pineapple, and with every harvest, sells them at a good price in your local cooperative.  He sells the fruits to intermediaries who constantly visit the central market of their city. As he has little time in agriculture, he wants to continue growing and improving the quality of crops.  This is the first loan with MFP, and the invitation he received from the local communal bank was very good as he needed support to achieve his objectives. This is why he has already thought about investing the loan in the purchase of 4 thousand coffee plants to begin the renovation of his agricultural land.

loans.use: To purchase 4,000 coffee plants

loans.name: Jovita Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jovita de 62 años, tiene una pequeña tienda, vive en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Inicio su negocio comprando pocos productos para poder mantener a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera. Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo invertir más dinero en frutas y enlatados para tener más variedad en sus ventas. En la actualidad trabaja sola desde muy temprano hasta las 06h30am hasta las 19h00pm. Vende enlatados, verduras, vegetales granos etc. Aunque no tiene a su cónyuge ella quiere seguir trabajando para darles una mejor vida a sus hijos, comprando con el préstamo enlatados, arroz, bebidas para su tienda. 

En el futuro quiere tener un minimarket para así que sus hijos tengan una mejor situación económica.
texts.en:
Jovita, 62, has a small store.  She lives on the outskirts of the city in an area that has basic services.  Her store is located on the ring road of Guayaquil in an area surrounded by a marsh.

She started her business buying a few products to support her children, since she is a single mother.  Gradually, with effort and dedication she was able to invest more money in fruits and canned goods so that she could have more variety in the goods she sells.  Now she works alone from the early morning (6:30am) until 7pm.  She sells canned goods, vegetables, grains, etc.  Although she does not have a husband, she wants to continue working to provide a better life for her children.  With this loan she will buy canned goods, rice and drinks for her store.

In the future she would like to have a mini-market, so that in this way her children could have a better financial situation.

loans.use: to buy rice and drinks

loans.name: Por Una Vida Digna Group

texts.es: Un grupo D. mujeres  que con entusiasmo y mucha dedicación sale adelante cada día. Así son las integrantes D. la alcancía comunal Por un Vida Digna conformado por 8 socias, que tiene un solo objetivo, el D. salir adelante sin importar los obstáculos que se les presentan a lo largo D. la vida. Tal es a si el caso D. la señora Ninfa E. D. 51 años D. edad casada y madre D. 3 hijos. Que en busca D. una mejora económica D. su hogar deciD. abrir una bodega en su casa hace más D. 9 años, esta fuente D. ingresos le ha generado muchas satisfacciones como son los estudios D. sus hijos y la implementación D. muebles para su hogar, en conjunto con su esposo a sabido sobresalir y mejorar su estilo D. vida y D. su familia. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en compras D. mercadería para esta campaña naviD.ña. Como la señora Ninfa E. cada integrante D. esta alcancía tiene un historia en particular pero, todas coinciden en un solo objetivo que es el D. salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, para el bienestar D. sus hogares.
texts.en:
A group of women who with enthusiasm and much dedication, forge ahead every day.  That describes the  8 members of the “Por Una Vida Digna” (For a Life with Dignity) Communal Bank, who have one sole objective – to get ahead no matter the obstacles they face throughout their lives.

That's also the case of Ninfa, who is 51 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. In search of a better life, she decided to open a general store in her house some 9 years ago.  This source of income has generated much satisfaction, as have her children's studies and the acquisition of furniture for her home.  Together with her husband, she has learned how to overcome and to improve her life style and that of her family.

This new loan will be invested in buying merchandise to sell this Christmas season.  Like Ninfa, each member of the bank has a history in particular, but they all coinciD. in one sole objective, which is to get ahead through much effort and dedication, for the wellbeing of their homes.

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE FOR CHRISTMAS SALES

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Reyner

texts.es: Reyner, de 28 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador, que vive con su madre, en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). Esté joven y vital hombre, hace 8 años que se dedica a la agricultura, sus principales productos constan de café y plátanos. En todo este tiempo dedicado al cuidado de sus terrenos agrícolas, pudo conseguir muchas cosas como comprar su propio terreno, con el cual pudo invertir más capital para sus sembríos. Sin embargo lo que más le gusta a él, es comercializar su producción, pues piensa que ve cristalizado sus esfuerzos. En el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, donde la mayoría de los acopiadores lo conocen, mencionan, que es un agricultor bueno, pues lo reconocen por su calidad de grano de café. Por ello más adelante desea seguir mejorando la calidad de sus cultivos. Es el primer crédito con MFP y agradece la confianza depositada en él, pues asegura que con el apoyo de su banco comunal, logrará sus objetivos. Es por ello que ya ha pensado invertir el dinero del préstamo en la compra de 8 sacos de abono orgánico y si el dinero le alcanza invertirá en la limpieza de la maleza que creció en sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Reyner is 28 years old.  He is a single and hard-working man who lives with his mother in his own home in the community of Sanchirio (in the central Peruvian jungle).  This young, dynamic man has been farming for 8 years.  His main crops are coffee and bananas.

Over the years, Reyner has cared for his land.  He has managed to achieve many things, including buying his own plot of land which meant he was able to invest more capital in his crops.  However, what he most likes doing is selling his crops because he then sees the results of all his hard work in front of him.  Most of the traders in the city's wholesale market know Reyner and they comment that he is a good farmer and they recognize the quality of his coffee beans.  In the future, he would like to continue improving the quality of his crops.

This is Reyner's first loan with MFP and he is grateful for the trust which has been placed in him.  He assures us that with the support of his community bank he will achieve his goals.  For this reason he is planning to invest his loan money in buying 8 sacks of organic fertilizer and, if there is enough money left, he will invest it in clearing out the weeds which have grown on his land.

loans.use: To buy 8 sacks of fertilizer and to clear out the weeds which have grown on his farm land

loans.name: Berta Marina

texts.es:
La señora Berta Marina V. tiene 52 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Oscar Armando Guandique quien se dedica al trabajo de construccion, tienen tres hijos.

Berta y su familia vive en la colonia Morazan de la cuidad de San Lorenzo desde hace 25 años, en donde tiene su propia casa. doña Berta quien se a dedicado durante 20 años a la elaboracion de vestidos, blusas, pantalones de vestir para mujer, trajes para quinceañera, trajes de boda ademas los fines de semana hace sopas de mondongo y tamales para vender tratando de esta manera obtener mas ganancias en su negocio.

el credito lo utilizara para la compra de telas y accesorios que se necesitan para la elaboracion de las
prendas de vestir, ademas necesita comprar unos repuestos para darle mantenimiento a su maquina de costurar.

unos de sus sueños es que su familia este bien siempre, Berta es una mujer muy catolica.
texts.en:
Berta Marina V. is 52 years old.  She is married to Oscar Armando Guandique who is a construction worker.  They have three children.

Berta and her family have lived in the Morazan district of the city of San Lorenzo for 25 years.  They live in their own home.  For 20 years, Berta has been making dresses, blouses, women's dress pants, outfits for 15th birthday celebrations and wedding outfits.  On weekends she also makes tripe soup and tamales to sell in order to make additional income.

Berta will use her loan to buy fabric and accessories which she needs to make her garments.  She also needs to buy some spare parts for her sewing machine.

One of Bertha's dreams is for her family to always be well.  Bertha is a very Catholic woman.

loans.use: To buy fabric, threads, lace and spare parts for her sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy natural products such as omega 3, vitamins A and D, glucosamine, omega for children and imported underwear

loans.name: Renovacion Las Aguilas 1, 4 & 5 Group

texts.es:
Nieve es una de los miembros del Grupo Renovacion las Aguilas 1,4 & 5, compuesto por 15 micro-empresarios, todos están dedicados a las ventas de ropa, productos naturales, zapatos, venta de alimentos, etc. Su F. está compuesta por ella, y sus 4 hijos, de los cuales solo uno vive con ella. Vive en la ciudad de Santiago, siendo esta la segunda mas grande del país, cuya economía depende de la agricultura, ganadería y de la producción de tabaco entre otras; también cuenta con una amplia población de dominicanos y emigrantes haitianos que viven en comunidades de muy escasos recursos. Le encanta escuchar musica y bailar en sus tiempos libres.

Nieve está muy emocionada de recibir su cuarto préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente sus préstamos anteriores y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 2 años, el cual inició cuando tomo su primer prestamo. Nieve está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en su negocio, en el cual vende ropas nuevas para todo tipo de cliente. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para arreglar su vivienda y comprar unos muebles que le hacen falta.
texts.en:
Nieve is one of the members of the Renovacion las Aguilas 1, 4 & 5 Group which is formed by 15 micro business people. All members sells clothes, natural products, shoes, food, etc. 

Nieve's family is formed by herself and four children, only one of which lives with her. She lives in the town of Santiago, the second largest in the country. The town's economy depends on agriculture, cattle raising and tobacco growing, among others. The town also has a large Dominican and Haitian immigrant population who live with very limited resources. They love to listen and dance to music in their free time.

Nieve is very excited to receive her fourth loan with Esperanza Internacional after having duly paid her previous loan and taken the step to grow her business. She has had her business for around 2 years. She started it when she took her first loan. Nieve plans to invest her new loan in her business. She sells new clothes to a varied clientele. She will use her income to renovate her home and to purchase some furniture she still misses.

loans.use: Pants, skirts, shirts, polo shirts

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: Agustina, de 20 años de edad, es una valerosa madre soltera, que junto a su hijo Antony de 3 años de edad, viven en unión familiar en la casa de sus padres, ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). A pesar de los constantes altibajos que tuvo, logró salir adelante. Hace tres años que comenzó a cultivar el terreno agrícola que sus padres le heredaron, pues ahora ya tiene responsabilidades y motivos para salir adelante. Sus principales cultivos consta de café y plátanos, según afirma Agustina, en todo este tiempo gracias a Dios, pudo encontrar muy buenos compradores para sus cosechas, los que vende constantemente en el mercado central de su ciudad. Por su trabajo duro y buen juicio, ahora Agustina quiere seguir aumentando sus cultivos con más terrenos agrícolas. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y ya no se siente sola, pues según afirma ahora que ingresó al banco comunal más reconocido de su localidad, siente que ya tiene el apoyo económico que tanto le faltaba para hacer realidad todos sus objetivos. Es por ello que ya ha pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de 10 sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus 2 hectáreas de café.
texts.en:
Agustina, 20 years old, is a brave single mother. She lives at her parents' home along with her 3 year-old son Antony in the village on Sanchirio (in the Central Peruvian Jungle). Despite her life's ups and downs she has succeeded. Three years ago she started planting in a lot of land given to her by her parents. Now she has responsibilities and reasons to get ahead. 

Her main crops are coffee and bananas. Agustina states that thanks to God she has always been able to find buyers for her crops. She often sells to her town's central market. For her hard work and good judgment Agustina now want to expand her crop with more land. This is her first loan with MFP. She no longer feels alone since she joined the most well known bank in her village. She feels she has the financial support she needed to make her goals a reality. She plans to invest the loan in the purchase of 10 bags of organic fertilizer to use in her 2 ha. of coffee.

loans.use: Purchase ten bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es: Cristian , de 24 años de edad, es un hombre soltero y trabajador, que junto a su mama luchan por salir adelante. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). A su corta edad, Cristian tiene muchas ambiciones. Hace 4 años que comenzó en la agricultura, pues según afirma desde niño sus padres le enseñaron todas las técnicas de cultivo. Recientemente adquirió su propio terreno agrícola, donde sus sembríos de plátano y café, ya tienen buenas cosechas ya que el dinero que invertía en el arriendo de sus terrenos, ahora los invierte en el cuidado de sus cultivos, cuidándolos constantemente. Es por ello que la cooperativa de su comunidad, le compra su grano de café a buen precio. Pero las aspiraciones de Cristian es estudiar manejo de maquinaria pesada. Es el primer crédito con MFP y agradece la oportunidad que le dio el banco comunal al que ahora pertenece, ya que según afirma, tiene el apoyo que le faltaba para lograr sus objetivos. Es por ello que ya ha pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico entre potasio y guano (excrementó de animales), los que esparcirá en sus sembríos de café y plátano.
texts.en:
Cristian is 24 years old.  He is a single and hard-working man who, together with his mom, works hard to get ahead in life.  He and his mother live in their own home in the community of Sanchirio (central Peruvian jungle).  At his young age, Cristian has many ambitions.  He started farming 4 years ago since he tells us that his parents had taught him farming techniques since he was a boy.  He recently acquired his own plot of land where he grows bananas and coffee.  He has good harvests since the money that he used to invest in renting his land is now invested in caring for his crops, looking after them constantly.  For this reason the cooperative in his community buys his coffee beans for a good price.  However, Cristian's aspirations are to study the use of heavy machinery.

This is Cristian's first loan with MFP and he is grateful for the opportunity which his community bank has give him since he says that he now has the support to achieve his goals that he was previously lacking.  He plans to invest his loan in buying several sacks of organic fertilizer - potassium and guano (animal excrement) which he will spread on his coffee and banana crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Creciendo Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Creciendo” inicia su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata. Las socias comentan que es una oportunidad interesante el poder asociarse para recibir servicios de crédito, capacitación y salud. Está compuesta por nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varón.  Los negocios son diversos: agencia de helados, conductor de movilidad, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, artesanía y transporte, artesanía, elaboración de muebles, venta de papa, construcción, costura de polleras.

La presidenta de la banca comunal, señora Victoria es una mujer adulta de 55 años, madre de 2 hijos (a la fecha sólo vive el hijo varón).  Este es su primer ciclo, la señora Victoria comenta que fue invitada por los promotores de la Institución.   Desde hace muchos años trabaja tejiendo chompas, chalinas, lluchus, guantes, polainas y vende su producción a una organización que compra estas prendas.   Ella explica que necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar lana y elaborar los productos ya mencionados.
texts.en:
The Cresciendo communal bank is starting its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata Focal Center. The partners comment that it is an interesting opportunity to become partners to receive credit, training, and health services. It is formed by nine members, eight women and one man. Their business are varied: ice cream shop, cab driver, general store, food sales, crafts and transportation, crafts, furniture making, potatoes sales, construction, traditional "pollera" skirt making.

The president of the communal bank, Victoria, is a 55 year old mother of two children (only one living son). This is her first cycle. She was invited by the promoters of the Institution. She has been working for many years knitting sweaters, ties, caps, gloves, leg warmers and selling to an organization which buys such items of clothing. She explains that she needs the loan to purchase wool to knit the aforementioned items.

loans.use: Compra de lana

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy apples, grapes, pears, pineapples, mangoes, bananas, green chilis, avocados, cherries, oranges and plantains

loans.name: Sonia Teresa

texts.es: La Sra. Sonia Vive en el municipio de el Torno, es nacida en el departamento de Cochabamba, hace unos 20 años que se vino a vivir a la comunidad, buscando mejores días para su familia su actividad es el transporte, de carga, venta de plantas, hace unos 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad, su esposo se  dedica a la agricultura, y ganadería, el destino del crédito es para comprar llantas y accesorios para su camioneta ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y necesita hacerle mantenimiento, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sonia lives in the town of El Torno.  She was born in Cochabamba department but came to live in this community 20 years ago, looking for a better life for her family.  Sonia's business activity is transporting cargo.  She has been in the business for 10 years.  Her husband is a crop and livestock farmer.  Sonia's loan will be used to buy tires and accessories for her truck since it has been suffering from mechanical failure and needs servicing.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: To have her vehicle serviced

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: MARIA DEL ROSARIO P. U. tiene 2 hijos  se dedica a la venta de joyería de fantasía  desde hace 14 años  por 8 años,  vendió en forma ambulante en muchos pueblos,  y desde hace 6 años alquila un Local, para la venta de  Joyería  de Fantasía.  Como también se dedica a la venta de Ropa Típica y a la vez  borda  cortes Típicos, todo lo ha hecho  con la  apoyo económico de su esposo,  y su mayor deseo es tener una gran venta  en ropa Típica, por ello solicita este crédito para compra de ropa típica ya que su negocio requiere de mucho capital, su deseo como madre es  enseñarle  a sus hijos un oficio, brindarles educación, y seguir adelante juntamente con su esposo.
texts.en: MARIA DEL ROSARIO P. U. has 2 children.  She has been selling costume jewelry for 14 years; for 8 years she sold it by traveling to many villages, and for the past 6 years she has been renting a location.  She also sells authentic clothing and embroidery.  Everything has been done with the financial support of her husband, and her greatest wish is to have a big sale on authentic clothing.
