She is requesting this loan to purchase clothes as her business requires a lot of capital.  She wants, as a mother, to teach her children a profession, providing them an education and continue moving ahead with her husband.

loans.use: Clothing Sales

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith, de 22 años, convive con Ángel, de 25 años de edad. Producto de su amor, nació Luz Clarita, de 2 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio del Palomar (selva central peruana). Está valerosa mujer, trabaja hace 2 años en la agricultura, sus principales sembríos constan de café, plátano y maíz híbrido; los que con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo mantiene. Ya que tiene que trabajar el doble, para poder costear no solo los gastos de producción, también los de arrendamiento del terreno agrícola. Pero optimista ella, está juntando capital para poder comprar un terreno, de esa manera obtener ganancias e  intensificarse en la agricultura, pues son muchos los compradores que visitan la zona a comprar calidad de grano de café y frutos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP y a pesar del corto tiempo que están trabajando con su banco comunal, se siente dichosa por el apoyo que se dan mutuamente. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado, completar el pago para la compra de un terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Judith, 22, lives with Ángel, who is 25.  They have a two-year-old daughter named Luz Clarita.  This family lives in their own house, located in the community of Sanchirio del Palomar in the central Peruvian jungle.

This brave woman has worked in agriculture for two years.  Her main crops are coffee, plantains and hybrid corn; she grows them with much work and effort.  She has to work twice as hard to be able to finance not only her production costs but also the cost of renting the field.  But she is an optimist and is getting together capital to buy a field.  In this way she will earn more and strengthen her position in agriculture, since there are many buyers who visit the area to buy quality coffee beans and fruits.

This is Judith's third loan with MFP, and despite the short time she has been working with her communal bank, she feels fortunate because of the support the members give each other.  She is thinking of using this loan to add to the capital that she saved for so long and buy a field.

loans.use: Buy farmland

loans.name: Dilia

texts.es: La Sra. Dilia vive en la zona de la Villa 1ro de Mayo, , Ella se dedica a la confección de mandiles, capas y gorros para las peluquerías, los mismos que distribuye en las diferentes peluquerías de la Villa 1ro de mayo y escuelas de belleza. Ella es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 5 años, además de la confección ella cuenta con el negocio de alquiler de trajes de fantasía y vestidos de fiesta que ella confecciona y tiene a disposición para diferentes eventos sociales; recientemente ha iniciado un nuevo proyecto para realizar eventos de graduación para los niños de Kínder.  Ella es una señora muy responsable y emprendedora, ella quiere el nuevo crédito para ampliar su taller de costura comprando máquinas de costurar y comprar tela para los mandiles, capas y gorros que confecciona ya que en esta época del año por las graduaciones de los salones de belleza aumenta la demanda para ella, esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Dilia lives in the area of Villa 1ro de Mayo.  She makes aprons, capes and caps to distribute to the hairdressers and beauty schools in Villa 1ro de Mayo.  She is a single mother and has a five-year-old daughter.

Besides her sewing, Dilia rents out costumes and party clothes that she makes and has available for different social events.  Recently she has begun a new project producing graduation events for kindergarteners. 

Dilia is a very responsible and enterprising woman.  She wants the new loan in order to expand her sewing workshop, buying sewing machines and buying fabric for the aprons, capes and caps she makes since at this time of the year the beauty school graduations increase demand for these items.  Dilia is very grateful to the institution for the support given to her.

loans.use: Buy fabric, buttons and a sewing machine

loans.name: Kenia Yamaly

texts.es:
la joven Kenia Yamaly M. G. tiene 21 años de edad y es madre de un hijo, vive en el barrio San Jose de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, dedicandose a la venta de frutas y verduras en su pequeño puesto ubicado a la orilla del 
mercado nuevo de San Lorenzo, es un buen lugar para vender este tipo de productos ya que por ahí pasan muchas personas que vienen a comprar sus verduras y frutas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de frutas y verduras, en la epoca de navidad que esta por venir se venden muchas manzanas, uvas y peras.
texts.en:
Kenia Yamaly M. G. is 21 years old and has a son.  She lives in the San Jose neighborhood of the city of San Lorenzo, selling fruits and vegetables from her little stand on the edge of the new market in San Lorenzo.  It is a good place to sell this type of product since many people pass by and come to buy her vegetables and fruits.

Kenia will use the loan to buy fruits and vegetables.  In the Christmas season, which is approaching, many apples, grapes and pears are sold.

loans.use: Purchase grapes, pears, apples, papayas, avocados, bananas, plantains, oranges

loans.name: Tereso

texts.es: Tereso, de 52 años, convive con Maritza, de 50 años. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Yeraldo, de 16 y Bryan, de 13 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio del Palomar (selva central peruana). En sus 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura, nuca se sintió cansado, por lo contrario agradece todos los éxitos obtenidos hasta hoy, pues según menciona; gracias a su buena cosecha pudo educar a sus hijos. Ahora sus principales productos son los cultivos de; café, plátanos y maíz, los que cuida y mantiene junto a su esposa Maritza y, cuando ya están listos para ser cosechados, los vende en el mercado central de su ciudad. Pero según cuenta Tereso, en épocas de campaña agrícola, los mismos compradores vienen a sus terrenos, para comercializar su producción. Por ello más adelante desea ampliar sus cultivos, con la compra de más hectáreas de terreno. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y en este corto tiempo compartió momentos muy gratos y felices con los integrantes de su banco comunal, que se apoyan constantemente. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar la máquina que utiliza para fumigar sus sembríos, ya que hace algunos días se malogró, y si el dinero le alcanza comprará abono orgánico.
texts.en: Tereso, 52, lives with Maritza, 50.  They have 6 children, but only live with 2 of them: Yeraldo, 16, and Bryan, 13.  They live in their own house located in the Sanchirio community of Palomar (in the central Peruvian jungle).  In their 20 years of agriculture, they have never felt tired, on the contrary they are thankful for the successes they have had so far, such as being able to educate their children thanks to their good harvests.  Now the main products they grow are coffee, bananas, and corn, which they take care of and maintain together.  Once the crops are ready to be harvested, they are sold in the city's central market.  But in each harvest season, the same buyers come to their lands to buy their products.  Therefore they want to increase their harvest with the purchase of more hectares of land.  This is their third loan with MFP, and in a short time they have shared pleasant and happy moments with the other members of their communal bank, who help each other constantly.  With the loan they are requesting they plan on buying a machine to spray their fields, which recently stopped producing, and they will also buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and a machine to spray fields

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas al Progreso”  ubicado en el distrito Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, la señora estudió solo hasta la secundaria.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 02 años, su primer préstamo  fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de quesos y pan.

Alejandrina solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  invertirá en la compra de quesos para su negocio.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener una tienda de abarrotes y tener un carro.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the communal bank "Azangarinas al Progreso" located in the Azangaro district, Azangaro province, Puno department.  She is 33 years old, in a common law marriage and has 2 children.  She went to school through high school.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 2 years.  Her first loan was of 5,000 nuevos soles, money she used to increase the income from her business.  She works selling cheeses and bread.

Alejandrina is asking for a new loan of 1,000 nuevos soles, money that she will use to buy cheeses for her business.

Her dream for the future is to have a grocery store and a car.

The thing she likes most about her communal bank is the training she receives.

loans.use: Purchase of cheese wholesale.

loans.name: Rosario Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Rosario, vive en la zona de la Villa 1ro de Mayo,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su mismo domicilio, de lunes a viernes sólo vende cena y los días sábados y domingos almuerzo y cena, ella es muy conocida en el barrio por la comida que prepara. Ella vive en casa propia y el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en lo que mas necesita es mejorar el patio y comprar nuevas sillas y mesas plásticas para vender almuerzo de lunes a domingo, ella cuenta con la ayuda de dos de sus hijas que estudian durante las noches y los fines de semana le ayudan. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado con créditos para aumentar su capital e ir haciendo mejoras en su negocio.
texts.en: Mrs. Rosario lives in the Villa Primero de Mayo area.  Her business is the sale of food from her home.  Monday through Friday she only sells dinner, and lunch and dinner on Saturdays and Sundays.  She is well-known in the neighborhood for the food she prepares.  She lives in her own house and she will use the loan to improve her patio and buy new plastic tables and chairs to sell lunch from Monday through Friday.  She counts on the help of two of her daughters who study at night and help her on the weekends.  She is a hard worker who has worked for a long time with loans helping to increase her capital and improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase of tables and chairs, construction on her patio.

loans.name: Luis Alonzo

texts.es:
el señor Luis Alonzo A. Z. tiene 30 años de edad, esta casado. Luis es una persona humilde, trabajadora.
Luis se dedica al destazo de reses, hace como dos años emprendio este negocio en donde a adquirido buena experiencia, nos comento que este negocio le da buenas utilidades, sus ventas son los dias sabados y domingos, el resto de la semana se dedica a buscar vacas y a visitar los negocios que van a comprarle la carne y el hueso logrando de esta manera tener menos riesgo de no vender su carne.

 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de una vaca.
 
su mayor deseo es que su hijo que esta por llegar a la familia nazca bien de salud.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Alonzo A. Zunigo is 30 years old and married.  He is a humble, hard-working person.  He works as a butcher, a business he started two years ago and where he has been able to acquire good experience.  He gets a good income from his business.  He sells on Saturday and Sunday; the rest of the week he looks for cows and goes to the business that will buy his meat and bone, thus reducing the risk that he will be unable to sell his meat.

He will use the loan to buy a cow.

His greatest wish is that his child that is due soon is born in good health.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
Bernarda es socia del Banco Comunal “Bellavista 1”  ubicado en la provincia D. Puno, tiene 75 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene 05 hijos, la señora estudió educación primaria.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desD. hace 05 años, su   primer préstamo  fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para  incrementar el capital D.  su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero utilizará para comprar ropa al por mayor, para damas, caballeros y niños.

Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar el negocio y hacerlo crecer.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal  son las ganancias que generan sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Bernarda is a member of the "Bellavista 1" commercial bank located in Puno province.  She is 75 years old, in a common law marriage and has 5 children.  She has a primary education.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 5 years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, money she used to increase the capital of her business.  She works selling clothing.

She is asking for a new loan of 300 nuevos soles, which she will use to buy clothing wholesale for men, women, and children.

Her dream for the future is to improve her business and make it grow.

What she likes most about her communal bank is the earnings her savings generate.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing wholesale

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
el señor Manuel de Jesus T. A. tiene 47 años de edad, esta casado y tiene dos nietos que dependen de el, vive  en el barrio La Ceibita de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, su negocio esta ubicado en el interior del mercado nuevo de San Lorenzo, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo.
don Manuel es un hombre trabajador que a sacado adelante a su familia, cuando las ventas estan malas en el mercado el sale a vender en un microbus la mercaderia a los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo y Nacaome.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar ropa y calzado de damas, caballeros y niños. se acerca la navidad y esta epoca es cuando mas se vende y quiere estar preparado para cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Manuel de Jesus T. A. is 47 years old, married, with 2 grandchildren who are dependents.  He lives in the Ceibita neighborhood of the city of San Lorenzo.  His business is located inside San Lorenzo's new market, and he sells from Monday to Sunday.  Manuel is a hard-working man who supports his family.  When sales are poor in the market he takes a bus and sells in neighborhoods in San Lorenzo and Nacaome.

He will use the loan to buy clothing and shoes for men, women, and children.  Christmas is approaching, which is his busiest time, and he wants to be prepared to satisfy all of his customers' demands.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes and clothing for men, women, and children.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
In 2002, Ricardo L. and his wife, Marielos, started screen-printing t-shirts in their garage for his father-in-law’s t-shirt business.  After a while, they decided to print custom t-shirts for other businesses.  One business asked them “do you do banners too?”  And they said “of course!” even though they hadn’t made banners before and did not have the necessary equipment. “Anytime they ask me something, I say ‘of course’ and I start doing it – and with a lot of success! … in that fashion, little by little, we grew.  That’s why they say that this is a good business.” 

Now they can print business cards in an hour or two.  “We’re very fast.  … We’ll stay up all night if we need to.  If we resolve our clients’ problems, they’ll return or recommend us.” It takes a while the first time they create a new product, though, because they have to buy materials and access machinery.  “My intention is to do everything in-house”.

Ricardo L. and his wife plan to use this loan to stock up on raw materials, such as rolls of vinyl or rolls of magnetic sheets to print on and cartridges of ink and toner for the machines. He always wants to have materials in stock so “I never have to think ‘I have to buy this, and that, and that.’  So I can think about service and quality - not spend my time on thinking ‘I have to buy’.  You just buy it and then you’re set.”

Without this loan, Ricardo thinks his business would continue to function, but it would have delayed their goals.  

Ricardo and his wife would like to be able to support more people.  “We want to give employment to people – to sustain many families.  That’s always what we’ve had in mind.  We don’t want to be rich; we would rather make it so people have something they can live off of.  We would also like to be very organized, and expand.  It’s been a dream for many years to have many offices in other cities.”

About two years ago, Ricardo and Marielos moved the business out of their garage.  “These have been the two most difficult years for the economy, but we’ve grown!  It’s a blessing for us.  The most difficult times are when you can put yourself to the test and prove your potential.”

That success is also passed on to his children. “I’m proud that people recognize my business every time as having high quality and good service. And of the lessons that it leaves for my children – it’s important.  When you have your own business, your horizon is very large.  Every day is an opportunity to do business.  And the children learn that way of thinking.”

Ricardo has three children. Ricky is in his third year of studying civil engineering, Odette plans to study architecture when she goes to college next year, and Dhais is in high school.

Born in Chicago, Ricardo grew up in Monterrey, Mexico.  He returned to the United States 11 years ago.

Ricardo describes himself as a very honest family man with a lot of faith. He said he “gives thanks to God for what I’m living.  That my business is successful.  That everything is going well with the business and with my marriage.”

Ricardo describes his marriage and business as “a partnership where each of us do what we know best how to do.  She knows how to manage money.  And I know well how to do the work with high quality.”

The advice Ricardo would like to give to other business owners is to “make the client feel like this business is for them; make them feel comfortable.  It doesn’t matter if the business is tiny or huge; treat them well.  You never know which small business will grow huge, and if you treat them well when they’re small they’ll stick with you.”

loans.use: To buy raw materials, such as rolls of vinyl, magnetic sheets, ink and toner

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy ingredients for the preparation of her dishes, and also purchase eight sets of medical instruments

loans.name: Virginia Maria Natividad

texts.es:
Virginia de 54 años, vende cangrejos en su casa y su esposo a las afuera. Vive en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Comenzó con las ventas de cangrejos porque su esposo quería tener su propio dinero con un actividad económica propia y ella le ayudo para lograrlo. Como vendedor ambulante el esposo de Virginia los vende mientras que ella los vende desde su casa para tener dinero adicional. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta terminar su jornada. Diariamente comprar 25 a 30 planchas de cangrejos  (en cada plancha viene 24 cangrejos) para venderlos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cangrejos para tener mayores ingresos. En el futuro quiere tener más clientela y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Virginia is 54 years old. She sells crabs at home and her husband on the streets. She lives in a peripheral area with all basic services located on the perimeter of Guayaquil, surrounded by an estuary.

She began selling crabs because her husband wanted to earn money through their own economic activity and she helped him to accomplish this. Her husband sells the crabs as an ambulant vendor while Virginia sells from her home to generate extra income. They work from 7 am until day’s end. Daily they buy from 25 to 30 sacks of crabs (each sack contains 24 crabs) for sale.

With the loan she wants to buy crabs to generate higher income. In the future she wants more customers and rebuild her home.

loans.use: Buy crabs

loans.name: Ester

texts.es: ESTER TIENE 47 AÑOS CASADA, VIVE CON SU ESPOSO Y DOS HIJOS YA CASADOS ELLA TIENE SU TIENDA D. PLASTICOS DOND. TAMBIEN VEND. REGALOS PARA TODA OCACION, ATIEND. TODOS LOS DIAS D. LUNES A VIERNES D. 8:AM HASTA LAS 6:00 PM YA QUE  ASISTE A SU IGLESIA, LOGRO TENER SU NEGOCIO GRACIAS AL APOYO D. SU ESPOSO QUE TRABAJABA FUERA D. GUATEMALA TUVO ALGUNAS DIFICULTADES Y AHORA QUE NO CUENTA CON LOS MISMOS INGRESOS POR LO MISMO NECESITA UN CREDITO PARA LEVANTER NUEVAMENTE SU TIENDA D. PLASTICOS Y  COMPRAR SILLAS PLASTICAS, BOTES D. BASURA, BANOS PLASTIICOS Y RAGALOS PARA TODA OCACION, Y ASI AYUDAR A LA ECONOMIA D. SU HOGAR Y A SUS HIJOS.
texts.en: Ester is 47 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their two sons who are already married. She has a shop where she sells plastics and gifts for every occasion. She serves in the shop every day, Monday to Friday, from 8am until 6pm as she also attends Church. She managed to set up her business with the support of her husband, who works outsiD. of Guatemala. She has experienced difficulties and now cannot rely on the same income that she received. She needs a loan to re-energise her plastics shop by buying plastic chairs, waste baskets, plastic baths and gifts for every occasion, so that she can help her sons and her home finances.

loans.use: Purchase of plastic chairs and baths, and gifts for every occasion.

loans.name: Gabriela María

texts.es:
La Señorita María P. es socia del banco comunal Por un Futuro Mejor, vive en el cantón Paute, este cantón se caracteriza por su clima templado en donde su gente se dedica a la floricultura, cría de animales y agricultura, mucha de su población ha migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo para ayudar a sus familias.

La Señorita. María tiene 26 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 11 y 8 años de edad que están estudiando en una escuela del cantón, es doña María quien les da todo a sus hijos ya que el padre no les apoya económicamente, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá compartiendo los gastos.

Doña María se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado del cantón, cuenta con su puesto propio hace 12 años, labora de domingo a viernes desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vajilla y víveres para su negocio. su meta es comprarse un vehículo.
texts.en:
Miss Maria P. is a member of the communal bank Por un Futuro Mejor (For a Better Future).  She lives in Paute canton, which is characterized by its temperate climate, and many of its residents work cultivating flowers, raising livestock, and farming.  Much of its population has moved there seeking better work to help their families.

Miss Maria is 26 years old and is a single mother of 2 children, 11 and 8.  They are students in a school in the canton, and it is Maria who gives everything to them, as their father does not support them economically.  She does not have her own home; she lives with her mother and they share expenses.

Maria sells food in the canton market, and has done so for 12 years.  She works from Sunday to Friday from 7 in the morning to 4 in the afternoon.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 2 years, and she will use this new loan to buy crockery and supplies for her store.  Her goal is to buy a car.

loans.use: Buy crockery and supplies

loans.name: Fatima Argentina

texts.es:
la señora Fatima Argentina Y. F. tiene 37 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos.
Fatima se dedica a la venta de mercaderia como ser zapatos, ropa, perfumes, sandalias, carteras y accesorios para  el hogar como ventiladores, termos, juego de ollas. 
este negocio lo tiene desde hace unos ocho años, tiene casa propia y desea superarse cada dia mas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia ya que se aproxima la epoca de navidad en donde vende bastante y desea tener surtido su negocio.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatima Argentina Y. F. is 37 years old, married, with two children.  Fatima works selling merchandise such as shoes, clothing, perfume, sandals, wallets, and accessories for the home such as fans, thermoses, and cookware.

She has had this business for about 8 years.  She has her own house and wants to improve herself every day.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise, since the Christmas season is approaching where she sells a lot and she wants her business to be well-supplied.  She needs the income to cover her living expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of wallets, clothing, and shoes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba  y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Gregaria; ella tiene 60 años D. edad, casada  y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche y también golosinas como chocolates,dulces,galletas entre otros más ,la socia es una persona muy emprendedora y D. esta forma saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación D. productos para su tienda D. abarrotes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Ms. Gregaria, 60 years old, is married and has 5 children.  She belongs to the community bank "LLANKACHINAPAC", located in the District of Urubamba, Urubamba province, Cusco district.  She alternates her daily activities with her business, a grocery store that sells staples such as rice, sugar and milk, and also sweets like chocolate, candy and biscuits amongst others.  She is a very enterprising person and her family gets ahead through the grocery store.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more products for her grocery store.  She is grateful to those who are part of this dream through KIVA and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: To purchase products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es: El señor Emiliano, se dedica a la venta de helados, tiene 42 años. La Esposa y las Hijas son las que le Ayudan a vender, El realiza sus ventas dentro de la ciudad de Santa Cruz y También se va a vender por la localidad de Mora, Sanja Honda y Cabezas. El realiza estas ventas dejando sus productos un día y en la ciudad lo realiza todos los días y para tener mas ingresos el también se dedica a la venta de cosas usadas como ser  Baterías, botellas. Empieza su trabajo desde muy temprano y termina hasta las 5 de la tarde, el dinero del crédito es para comprar una heladera para mantener refrigerados sus helados. Su esposa también esta empezando a vender Cosméticos. Familia Emprendedora con deseos de superación.
texts.en:
Emiliano, 42, sells ice cream.  His wife and daughters help him with sales.  He sells in the city of Santa Cruz and also goes out to sell in Mora, Sanja Honda and Cabezas.  These out of town sales occur on one day and the sales in the city are every day.  To have more income he also sells used items like batteries and bottles.  His work day starts very early in the morning and finishes at 5pm.

The money from the loan is to buy a freezer to keep the ice cream refrigerated.  His wife is also starting to sell cosmetics.  They are an enterprising family with the desire to improve.

loans.use: To buy a freezer.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar, de 32 años, está casado con Reina, de 24 años. Hace poco que unieron sus vidas para siempre; y en unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). Este increíble hombre, siente que su vida se lleno de mucha alegría y amor, pues ahora quiere formar una familia a base de trabajo y mucha dedicación. Y reflejo de ello son sus 3 años consagrándose a la noble labor de la agricultura, donde sus principales cultivos constan de; café y plátano, los que todas las madrugadas, cuida y limpia, para posteriormente comercializarlos a los compradores que constantemente visitan la zona. Edgar ya es conocido entre los intermediarios, por ello más adelante quiere comprar más terrenos agrícolas para sembrar en mayor cantidad, de esa manera generar más ingresos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y se siente satisfecho del apoyo mutuo que reciben en su banco comunal, ya que gracias a ello, puede trabajar con más tranquilidad. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico y si el dinero le alcanza, contratará personal para que quite la maleza de su campo de cultivo.
texts.en: Edgar, 32, is married to Reina, 24.  They united their lives only recently; they live together as a family in their own house in the Sanchirio community (in the central Peruvian jungle).  This incredible man feels that his life is full of much happiness and love,  and now he wants to start a family on a base of work and dedication.  This is reflected in his 3 hours dedicating himself to the noble labor of farming, with his main crops being coffee and banana.  He cleans and cares for the plants every morning in order to sell them later to the buyers that constantly visit the area.  Edgar is already well-known by these buyers, and he wants to buy more land to plant more, and thus to have a greater income.  This is his third loan with MFP, and he is happy with the mutual help that his communal bank gives, thanks to which he can work with more peace of mind.  He plans on using this loan to buy organic fertilizer and, money permitting, to hire help to remove weeds from his fields.

loans.use: Buy bags of organic fertilizer and hire people to remove weeds from his fields

loans.name: Laura Mariela

texts.es:
La Señorita. Laura P. es socia del banco comunal Por un Futuro Mejor, vive en el cantón Paute, este cantón se caracteriza por su clima templado en donde su gente se dedica a la floricultura, cría de animales y agricultura, mucha de su población ha migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo para ayudar a su familia.
 
Nuestra socia tiene de 25 años, es madre soltera de una niña de un año y ocho meses, recibe el apoyo económico del papá de su hija, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive con su mamá compartiendo los gastos.
 
La Señorita. Laura es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de frutas, actividad que la desempeña hace 2 años, cuenta con un puesto propio en el mercado de Paute y labora desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, de domingo a domingo.

Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace 2 años y fue invitada por una ex socia. Su nuevo crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de más frutas para incrementar su negocio. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Miss Laura P. is a member of the communal bank Por un Futuro Mejor (For a Better Future). She lives in Paute canton, which is characterized by its temperate climate, and many of its residents work cultivating flowers, raising livestock, and farming. Much of its population has moved there seeking better work to help their families.

Miss P. is 25 years old, a single mother of a daughter who is a year and 8 months old.  She receives economic help from the father of her daughter.  She does not have her own home and lives with her mother with whom she shares living expenses.
 
Miss Laura is a vendor, selling fruits, which she has done for 2 years.  She has her own stall in the Paute market and works from 8am to 5pm, seven days a week.
 
She has been a member of the communal bank for 2 years, and was invited by an ex-member.  She will use the new loan to buy more fruits in order to grow her business.  Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: Buy fruit.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Lucia; ella tiene 48 años de edad, casada  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de taller de motos el cual se encuentra ubicado en su casa, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo ya hace un par de años atrás, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y de esta forma ella saca asu familia adelante.   

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su negocio con la compra de repuestos para motos,aceite entre otros.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. is a member of the communal bank LLANKACHINAPAC.  This bank is located in the Urubamba district of Urubamba province, Cusco department.  She is 48 years old, married, with 3 children.  She splits her time between everyday activities and her motorcycle store located in her house, which she has had for 2 years.  She works together with her husband.  She is a hard-working woman, so is able to help support her family.

She is asking for the loan to help her business by purchasing spare parts, such as oil.

She thanks those who form part of her dream, and promises to make payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for motorcycles, such as oil.

loans.name: Blanca Lucila

texts.es:
la señora Blanca Lucia C. M. tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera y dependen de ella dos hijos, una esta en el colegio y su hijo que se va a graduar de la universidad. Blanca vive en el barrio Victoria, tiene e 25 años de vivir en ese lugar y en donde se a desarrollado en el comercio.
Blanca a vendido oro, cosmeticos, perfumes. ahora se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
Blanca es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, tiene casa propia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio y asi tener mas ganancias las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos.
su meta es que sus dos hijos se graduen de la universidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca Lucia C. M. is 45 years old, a single mother with two dependent children:  a daughter in high school, and her son, who will graduate from college.  Blanca has lived in the Victoria neighborhood for 25 years, where she has developed her business. Blanca has sold gold, cosmetics, and perfume.  She now sells general goods, and has a store in her home.  Blanca is an enterprising, hard-working woman.  She has her own house.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her shelves and thus increase her earnings, which she needs in order to cover household expenses and her children’s studies.  
Her goal is for her two children to graduate from college.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, sugar, flour, bread, soft drinks, fritters, pastas, sauces, cereal, oats, toilet paper, tooth paste, juices, candles, batteries, matches, coffee

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
RUFINO P. L.



 DON RUFINO P.    TIENE 3 HIJOS MAYORES DE EDAD VIVE CON SU ESPOSA EN UNA COMUNIDAD MUY  TRANQUILA  EN  SU CASA PROPIA  LLEVA 27 AÑOS DE SER COMERCIANTE,  INICIO SU NEGOCIO VENDIENDO ROPA USADA DE CASA EN CASA Y LUEGO VENDIO PANTALONES Y TRAJES DE NIÑO.
DON RUFINO SUEÑA CON PODER TENER DOS LOCALES DE ROPA NUEVA YA QUE ACTUALMENTE  VENDE  EN LA BANQUETA  DE EL MERCADO ROOSEVELT.

DON RUFINO SOLICITA UN NUEVO CREDITO A FAPE PARA PODER INVERTIR EN  PANTALONES DE DAMA Y TRAJES PARA NIÑOS YA QUE DURANTE ESTA  TEMPORADA TIENE MAYORES VENTAS  Y ALQUILA POR DOS MESES,  DOS METROS CUADRADOS DE BANQUETA EN LA MUNICIPALIDAD DE GUATEMALA ,  PARA PODER COMERCIAR PRODUCTOS NAVIDEÑOS Y ROPA.
ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON FAPE POR QUE LE HAN AYUDADO INCREMENTAR SU MERCADERIA POR MEDIO DE LOS CREDITOS
texts.en:
Don Rufino has 3 adult children and lives with his wife in their own house, in a very quiet community. He has been a business man for 27 years. He began his business selling used clothing from his house and later sold pants and children’s clothing.

Don Rufino dreams of being able to have two stores for selling new clothes, since he currently sells clothes in the Roosevelt Market.

Don Rufino requests a new loan from FAPE to invest in women’s pants and children’s clothing, because during this season he makes more sales and is renting two square meters of space for two months in Guatemala City, to be able to sell Christmas products and clothing.

He is very grateful for FAPE, because it has helped him build his business through their loans.

loans.use: Wholesale clothing purchase

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es:
Miriam de 40 años, vende productos Yanbal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes) y accesorios para hogar. Vive con sus dos hijos en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Para soportar los gastos de la casa ya que esta divorciada ella empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos Yanbal y accesorios para hogar. Poco a poco incremento la lista de clientes porque trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, tostadoras, vasos, pinzas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yanbal como perfumes, cremas, electrodomésticos. En el futuro quiere comprar más mercadería para tener variedad.
texts.en:
Miriam is 40 years old.  She sells Yanbal products (a company that offers independent sales to enterprising women) and housewares.  She lives with her two children on the periphery of the urban area, with all basic services.  The place is on Guayaquil’s Beltway, an area surrounded by marshes.

As she is divorced, in order to cover household expenses, she started selling Yanbal products and housewares.  She gradually increased her customer base, because she starts work early, offering the products to her neighbors and friends.  She sells perfume, creams, cosmetics, toasters, glasses, tweezers.  

She wishes to use the loan to buy Yanbal products, such as perfumes, creams, and household appliances.  In the future, she would buy more merchandise, in order to have more variety.

loans.use: Perfumes, creams, appliances

loans.name: Lidia Guadalupe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba  y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Lidia; ella tiene 59 años D. edad, viuda  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. bisutería, la socia hace aretes,collares,pulseras en material D. fantasía y alpaca, la socia lo distribuye a sus amistades y personas que le solicitan, a la vez la socia trabaja en un colegio D. Urubamba como docente siendo esta su profesión. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. material para su negocio D. bisutería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Llankachinapac communal bank, located in the Urubamba district, province of Urubamba, department of Cuzco.
The member is Lidia, 59 years old, widow, with two children.  She alternates her daily activities with a jewelry business.  She makes earrings, necklaces, and bracelets, using material sold for costume jewelry and alpaca.  Lidia distributes these to her friends and people who request them.  She also works in the Urubamba high school as a teacher, as this is her profession.

This member requests a loan to buy material for her jewelry business.

She thanks those who participate in this dream through these means, and agrees to pay the installments per the schedule.

loans.use: The member requests the loan to buy materials for her jewelry business.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Esta es la primera renovación del credikiva que hizo Rosalba y está muy satisfecha porque pudo  hacer todo lo planeado : a pesar de 20 años trabajando con la mercancía es la primera vez que tiene un lugar fijo, ya que antes vendía de puerta en puerta o directamente en las viviendas de sus clientes. Ahora para surtir su vitrinas con motivos de las festividades que mas repuntan sus ventas en el fin de año, ella está planeando comprar mercancias como ropa, calzado, fantasia para vender a sus clientes y ganar mas dinero. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Rosalba ingrese al sguiente enlace: 
http://kiva.org/lend/163633
texts.en:
This is Rosalba's first renewal of her Kiva loan, and she is very satisfied because she could do everything she had planned.  Despite 20 years working with the merchandise, this is the first time she has had a settled place.  She used to sell door to door or in her customers' homes.

Now, to stock her display cases with holiday items that make her sales go up at the end of year, Rosalba is planning to buy merchandise like clothing, shoes and costume jewelry to sell to her customers and earn more money.  If you want to know Rosalba's story, click on the following link:
http://kiva.org/lend/163633

loans.use: Buy clothing, shoes, costume jewelry to sell to her customers and earn more money

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beans, lard, oil, margarine, refreshments, coffee, bread, cookies, soaps, pastas, pills, condiments, toothpaste, toilet paper, juices, sardines, chili, flour, and sanitary napkins

loans.name: María Luz Aurora

texts.es:
La Señora. Luz Z. es socia del banco comunal Por un Futuro Mejor, vive en el cantón Paute, este cantón se caracteriza por su clima templado en donde su gente se dedica a la floricultura, cría de animales y agricultura, mucha de su población ha migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo para ayudar a su familia.

La Señora Luz es comerciante de frutas y hortalizas, actividad que la desempeña hace 25 años, cuenta con un puesto propio en el mercado del cantón, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.
 
Doña Luz tiene 48 años, es divorciada hace 13 años, tiene 5 hijas de 29, 27, 25, 24, 22 años de edad, su primera hija vive en unión libre e independiente, sus cuatro hijas solteras trabajan y ayudan en la economía del hogar. Su casa es propia la cual  compro hace muy poco tiempo y aun se encuentra pagando las letras.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años, beneficiándose de los créditos en su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en el pago de una letra de su casa y lo que le sobra va a comprar más verduras para su negocio. Sus metas son acabar de pagar su casa, agrandarle para toda su familia, comprarse un vehiculo y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz Z. is a member of the For a Better Future Communal bank. She lives in the Paute cantonment. This camp site is known for its temperate climate where its people are flower growers, animal farmers, and agricultural farmers. Much of the population has migrated in search of better jobs to help their families.

Mrs. Luz sells fruits and vegetables and has been doing so for 25 years. She has her own stand in the camp’s market. She works from Sunday to Sunday from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.

Mrs. Luz is 48 years old, has been divorced for 13 years, has 5 children who are 29, 27, 25, 24, and 22. Her first daughter lives with her partner and lives independently. Her four single daughters work and help with financial matters at home. She recently became the owner of her home a few years back and is still paying installments.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 2 years and has benefited from the loans for her business. She will use her new loan to pay for a house installment and with the money left over buy vegetables for her new business. Her goals are to finish paying her house payments, enlarge it for the family, buy a new car, and grow her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and pay a house installment.

loans.name: Doris Yesenia

texts.es:
Doris es socia del Banco Comunal “Bellavista 1”  ubicado en el distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, la señora actualmente cursa estudios superiores.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 03 años, su   primer préstamo  fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de frazadas, colchas y mantas.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  invertirá en la compra de frazadas y colchas al por mayor.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener un carro. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las ganancias que generan sus ahorros.

En la foto se muestra junto a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the VIllage Bank "Bella Vista 1", located in the district, province and department of Puno.  She is 23 years old, has a live-in partner and has 2 children.  She is currently pursuing higher education.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 3 years.  Her first loan was for S/. 300 nuevo soles.  She used that money to increase the capital of her business - selling blankets, quilts and bedspreads.  

Doris is asking for a new loan in the amount of S/. 500 nuevo soles, which she will invest in buying blankets and quilts in bulk. 

Her dream for her future is to have a car.  What she likes most about her Village Bank are the profits that she generates from her savings.

In this photo, she is shown with her daughters.

loans.use: Buy blankets and quilts in bulk.

loans.name: Claudia Lorena

texts.es:
la señora Claudia Lorena C. V. esta casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo se  dedica  a la elaboracion de sal.
Claudia tiene una pulperia ubicada en la colonia Buena Vista de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, su negocio esta en su casa de habitacion. ahí vende carnes, pollo, granos basicos, refrescos de botella, jugos y todo lo relacionado con la canasta basica familiar.
sus clientes son personas que vivien cerca de su casa y amigos que ella tiene, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio.
 
su meta para este año nuevo es reconstruir su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claudia Lorena C. V. is married and has two children.  He husband works making salt.  

Claudia has a small store located in the neighborhood of Buena Vista in the city of San Lorenzo.  The store is located in the house where she lives.  She sells beef, chicken, basic grains, bottled sodas, juices and everything related to basic family needs. Her customers are people that live near her house, as well as her friends.  The store is open from Monday to Sunday. 

The loan will be used to buy merchandise to stock her store. 

Her goal for this year is to reconstruct her house.

loans.use: Buy soap, eggs, toothpaste, toilet paper, pills, candles, matches, hot sauce, beans, rice, sugar, cinnamon, flour, bread, coffee, crackers, lard, oil, margarine, meat and dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Virginia; ella tiene 25 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo; La socia tiene su negocio de venta de productos de golosinas como galletas,dulces,bebidas gasificadas (gaseosas, agua mineral),chocolates entre otros mas, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el terminal de Urubamba, la socia trabaja todos los días de esta forma saca a su familia adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para su negocio. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Virginia is 25 years old, has a live-in partner and 1 child.  She has a business selling confections like cookies, candies, carbonated drinks (sodas and mineral water), and chocolates, among other things.  Her business is located in the Urubamba transportation terminal.  She works every day in order to help her family move forward.  

She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise for her business.

She thanks those that are a part of this dream, through this loan, and is committed to complying with the repayment of her loan in the established time period.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Corina

texts.es: La señora Corina vive en casa D. su Mama quien le dio una parte como herencia, vive con sus hijos, su esposo se fue a España se separaron y es ella quien cuida D. sus hijos. La señora se dedica a la venta D. accesorios D. ferretería ya bastante tiempo como tres años donD. le va muy bien con este negocio ella viaja a Oruro para traer los accesorios porque en ese departamento es mas económico y los venD. a un precio razonable, tiene bastantes clientes porque reparte a ferreterías y es muy conocida. La señora saco el crédito para comprar estos accesorios ya que tiene pedidos y no tiene lo suficiente para poder comprar y poder satisfacer su demanda, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Corina lives at her mother’s house which was given to her as part of her inheritance. There she lives with her children. Her husband went to Spain after they separated and she was left alone to care for the children. Sra. Corina has been selling hardware accessories for three years and has done very well in this business. She travels to Oruro to acquire accessories because they are cheaper and sold at a reasonable price. Corina has enough customers because she delivers hardware and is well-known.

The loan she will receive will be used to buy accessories since she has orders but not enough capital to buy them so that she can meet demand. Corina is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: Purchase hardware accessories such as alarms, plywood, and other items

loans.name: Hjiadi Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama HJIADI, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Lerma, Estado de México, las señoras se basaron en una palabra de origen Otomi, que signifaca  Sol y Luna. El grupo está integrado por 9 clientas, en el se encuentra la señora Remedios S. P., quien fue la persona encargada de reunir a las integrantes del grupo en su domicilio, la señora Remedios tiene 54 años de edad, nos platica que estudió la educación secundaria, se encuentra casada con el señor Miguel Angel Guzman desde hace ya 34 años, comenta que al principio la unica fuente de ingresos a su hogar era el sueldo de su esposo quien trabajaba como ayudante general en una empresa que se encuentra ubicada en el D.F, pero que las ganas de salir adelante con su familia la obligaron a buscar más alternativas llevándola a desempeñar varias actividades desde la siembra de maiz y haba hasta las ventas por catálogo, recientemente la  invitaron a formar parte de un grupo de mujeres que al igual que ella tienen la misma inquietud de salir adelante. Quiere el crédito para la compra de dulces. La ilusión que siempre ha tenido la clienta es que sus hijos  y nietos puedan tener acceso a una educacion de calidad, también sueña con algun dia tener una Fuente de Sodas, ya que su negocio se encuentra ubicado cerca de la secundaria de su comunidad.
texts.en:
This group is called HJIADI and is located in the community of Lerma, in Mexico. These women based their group’s name on an Otomi word that means Sun and Moon.
The group is made up of 9 members, including Remedios S. P. who is in charge of holding group meetings at her home. Remedios is 54 years old, attended high school and has been married to Miguel Angel Guzman for 34 years.
At first her husband’s salary, from his work as a general assistant at a company in Mexico City, was their only source of income. Her hope to improve her family’s situation required her to take on various jobs ranging from growing corn and beans to catalogue sales. Recently she was invited to join a group of like-minded women.
She is requesting a loan to buy sweets for her business. She has always hoped that her children will have access to quality education. She also hopes to one day have a soda fountain because her business is located near the community’s high school.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses

loans.name: Glenda Beatriz

texts.es:
Glenda de 48 años, tiene un restaurante en donde vende pollos asados donde vende cada plato a $ 1.50. Vive con sus dos hijos en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Inicio su restaurante vendiendo almuerzos. Pero como quería tener más ingreso inicio las ventas de pollos asados comprando un horno. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h00 de hasta el anochecer todos los días vendiendo arroz con menestra y pollo, pollos asados enteros con plátanos y ensalada. Cada plato según que contenga lo vende a partir de $ 1.50 hasta $ 2.50 c/u. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, arroz, pollos para tener más volumen de ventas. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa e implementar nuevos platos.
texts.en:
Glenda, age 48, has a restaurant where she sells roasted chicken for $1.50 per plate. She lives with her two children in a periurban area with all the basic services. This place is located along the Perimetral Highway of Guayaquil and surrounded by a marsh.

She started her restaurant by selling lunches. When she needed to generate more income, Glenda bought an oven so that she could sell roasted chickens. She currently works every day from 7am to dusk selling rice with mixed vegetables and chicken, whole roasted chickens with plantains, and salads. Each dish ranges from $1.50 to $2.50 each based on the type of food that is served.

Glenda wants to use this loan to buy drinks, rice, and chicken to increase her sales volume. In the future, she wants to finish the construction of her house and introduce new dishes.

loans.use: Purchase drinks, rice, and chicken

loans.name: Elsa Fortunata

texts.es:
Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal “Bellavista I”,  ubicado en el distrito Puno,  provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y tiene 03 hijos, la señora estudió educación secundaria.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 08 meses, su   primer préstamo  fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas, además cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  invertirá comprando artículos diversos como arroz, azúcar, fideos y otros para abastecer su bodega.

Su sueño para el futuro  es implementar su tienda y estudiar.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la organización y la colaboración de las socias.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Communal Bank “Bellavista I”, which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Puno. She is 34 years old, married, and has three children. Elsa has a high school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for eight months. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to increase her business capital. She sells fast food and also manages a grocery store.

Sra. Elsa is requesting a new loan in the amount of 800 PEN to invest in the purchase of various items such as rice, sugar, noodles, and other products to restock her store. Her dream for the future is to keep her store running and to study. What she likes most about her Communal Bank is the organization and cooperation of the members.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, noodles, and other products

loans.name: Rosa Erlinda

texts.es:
la señora Rosa Erlinda V. G. tiene 47 años de edad,  esta casada con el señor Jose Francisco Sierra quien se dedica a la venta de sal. la señora Rosa Erlinda se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en su casa de habitacion, vende pollo, carnes, arroz, huevos, maiz, cloro y mucho mas. sus clientes son sus vecinos y personas que trabajan con el esposo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia ya que desea tener bien surtido para esta navidad.
 
sus ventas son todos los dias de lunes a domindo ademas se dedica  a la venta de leche y cuajada, es otro ingreso que le ayuda a la economia de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Erlinda V. G. is 47 years old and married to Sr. Jose Francisco Sierra, who works as a salt distributor.

Sra. Rosa Erlinda has a store in her home where she sells chicken, meat, rice, eggs, corn, bleach, and many other items. Her customers are neighbors and co-workers of her husband. This loan will be used to buy merchandise because she wants to be well-stocked for the Christmas holiday.

Her sales are conducted every day, Monday through Sunday. In addition, she sells milk and curds as an additional source of income that helps support her family.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase ingredients used in making ice cream

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Giovana; ella tiene 33 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de bebidas gasificadas como gaseosas,agua mineral,powerade entre otros , la socia compra estas bebidas y luego lo distribuye a machupicchu y camino inca,la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo siendo este negocio el sustento de su familia.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para su negocio. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Giovana is a member of the Communal Bank “Llankachinapac”, which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 33 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Giovana divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling soft drinks such as sodas, mineral water, Powerade, and other beverages. She buys these drinks and sells them later at Macchu Picchu and along the Incan Trail. Giovana and her husband work together in this business in order to support their family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more merchandise for her business.

She is grateful to those have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Acquire more inventory for her business

loans.name: Freda

texts.es: La Sra. Freda vive en la localidad D. el Torno distante a 39 km D. la ciudad D. Santa Cruz , es nacida en el departamento D. Potosí, hace uno 30 años que se vino a vivir al departamento, buscando días mejores y nuevas oportunidades D. trabajo, es viuda hace unos diez años, su actividad es la venta D. verduras, como cebolla, zanahoria, tomate por caja, etc. VenD. en el mercado central, el destino del crédito es para aumentar su mercadería ya que, por fiestas D. fin D. año el negocio tienD. a estar en su mejor nivel, tiene tres hijos D. los cuales ya todos son independientes, la Sra. Freda esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Freda lives in the town of El Torno, which is located 39km from the city of Santa Cruz. She was born in the Department of Potosí. Freda moved to this department thirty years ago in search of better days and new job opportunities. She has been widowed for approximately ten years.

Freda sells vegetables such as onions, carrots, tomatoes, and other types of produce by the case. Her business is located at the central market. This loan will be used to increase her inventory of merchandise for the year-end holidays when the level of her business is at its best. Freda has three children, all of whom are independent. She is very grateful for the support Emprender has provided.

loans.use: Acquire more produce

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina tiene 56 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Ella y su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de helados, producto que lo tiene desarrollando desde hace 7 años, la idea surgió por iniciativa de sus hijos, además cuentan con una refrigeradora, única herramienta de trabajo, desde entonces emprendió este negocio. Con el tiempo se ha implementado de moldes y una nevera más, asimismo gran cantidad de barquillos. La preparación lo realiza durante el día hasta las 11 de la mañana y luego sale a vender repartiendo a las escuelas que se encuentran dentro de su zona; también hay personas que le ayudan a vender y por ello son retribuidos económicamente. La época más  rentable son  en temporada de verano. Sus planes futuros, es el de mejorar los implementos y equipos, para producir en mayor cantidad. Es el crédito número 5 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de productos básicos para la preparación de helados.
texts.en:
Josefina is 56 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their own house. She and her husband make ice cream for a living and have been developing their product for 7 years. The idea came from Josefina's children and they only had one piece of equipment needed for the job - a refrigerator. She launched the business then. With time, she set up popsicle molds and another freezer, and began using a great deal of cones as well. 

She now does preparation work during the day until 11 am, and then goes out selling the ice cream at schools in her area. There are people who help her sell and they are paid for their work. The most profitable season is the summertime. Her future plans are to improve her tools and equipment and to produce in greater quantity. This is Josefina's fifth loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support. In addition, she is glad to be part of a communal bank because all of its members are responsible and very supportive people. She also is thankful to everyone who will provide the loan she is requesting since it will be very useful in the progress of her business. With the loan Josefina is requesting, she will invest in more primary materials for ice cream-making.

loans.use: To buy materials for ice cream-making.

loans.name: Sandra Yamileth

texts.es:
la señora Sandra Yamileth C. V. tiene 26 años de edad esta casada y tiene dos hijos.
Sandra se dedica al negocio de puleria desde hace unos cinco años, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, vende cosmeticos, suero, medicina, shampoo, jabon, papel higienico, granos basicos, maseca, y todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar, ademas tiene un negocio de venta de sal que es manejado por su esposo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio.
desea tener bien surtido su negocio para la navidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Sandra Yamileth C. V. is 26 years old, married, and has two children. She has a store located in her home that she has managed for five years. Sandra sells cosmetics, serums, medicines, shampoo, soap, toilet paper, basic grains, cornmeal, and other food products. She also has a business selling salt that is managed by her husband.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise to restock her business. She hopes to have her store well-stocked for Christmas.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Norma; ella tiene 29 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes vendiendo arroz,azúcar,leche,golosinas como  chocolates, dulces entre otros el nombre de la tienda es JOSELITOS ,y a la vez la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales como pollos y cuyes par luego distribuirlos a los restaurantes y clientes que le solicitan.

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su tienda de abarrotes y para la mantención de su criadero de animales.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Communal Bank “Llankachinapac”, which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 29 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Norma divides her time between her daily activities and managing her grocery store where she sells rice, sugar, milk, chocolates, sweets, and other items. The name of her store is “Joselitos”. Norma also spends time raising animals such as chickens and guinea pigs that she later sells to restaurants and customers who request them. The loan she is seeking will be used to keep her grocery store in operation and to maintain her animal pens.

Norma is grateful to those have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise for her grocery store & pay to maintain her animal pens

loans.name: Velma Ester

texts.es:
Velma  U. vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 13 y 15 años en la Pradera, un barrio al suroccidente de Barranquilla,  donde tiene una tienda llamada El esfuerzo,  que inició  en el año 1999 como una pequeña venta de artículos de la canasta familiar y que gradualmente ha ido creciendo gracias a su disciplina y la capacidad  administrativa innata de Velma. 
En la actualidad está aplicando a sus primer financiamiento, para surtir su negocio con refrescos y  víveres al por mayor, porque a finales de año aumentarán los precios y ella estaría surtida con un buen inventario a un mejor costo y en  la mejor temporada del año. Velma es una mujer de grandes sueños, su principal es  ver a sus hijos convertidos en unos profesionales y le gustaría que fueran médicos, por eso se esmera trabajando  persistentemente. Su negocio presenta una rentabilidad actual de 19,35% y espera que al inyectarle el capital de trabajo aumente a un 25%, por efecto de la época de fiestas que se avecina y que usualmente es la temporada donde se incrementan sus ventas,  su capital de trabajo es de  $ 12.956.480 COP, su nivel de endeudamiento es de 28,8% y su rotación de cartera es diaria. Ella augura que su inversión será magnifica en este fin de año y quedará muy bien en el pago de las cuotas mensuales  de su credikiva
texts.en:
Velma U. lives with her spouse and two children of ages 13 and 15 in the Pradera neighborhood located southwest of Barranquilla.  There she has a store called, El Esfuerzo (The Effort), which she started in 99' as a small sale of household items and has gradually grown thanks to her discipline and innate administrative capacity.
She is currently applying for her first loan in order to stock her business with refreshments and wholesale groceries; prices go up towards the end of the year and this way her inventory would be stocked at the best cost and at the best time of the year. Velma is a woman with big dreams, primarily it is to see her kids become professionals; she would like them to be doctors which is why she works so persistently.  Her business presents a 19.35 % profit-earning capacity and hopes that after injecting working capital it increases to 25% as an effect of the holidays that are near; a time when her sales usually increase.  Her working capital is $12,956,480 COP, her level of debt is 28.8 % and her portfolio turnover is daily.  She predicts that her investment will be magnificent this year and will do well in paying the monthly credikiva quotas.

loans.use: surtir su negocio con refrescos y  víveres al por mayor

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.es:
el sr. Purificacion P. R. tiene 52 años de edad, vive en la aldea el Madreal, Purificacion se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion. Purificacion es una persona de la tercera edad y esta es la unica fuente de ingresos que el tiene.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio, desea tener variedad de productos para la navidad.
texts.en: Sr. Purificacion P. R. is 52 years old. He lives in the village of Madreal. Purificacion sells basic consumer products. He has a small grocery store in his home. Since he is older, this is his only source of income. He will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock his store. He wants to have a variety of products on hand for the Christmas season.

loans.use: Buy eggs, lard, oil, beans, rice, sugar, soups, soda, and juice for his store.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas al Progreso”  ubicado en el distrito Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 03 hijos. Solo pudo estudiar hasta 4to de educación primaria.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 02 años, su   primer préstamo  fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizará para comprar carnes para hacer chicharrón (comida típica)

Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar el negocio e incrementar sus ganancias.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones y lo que ganan sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Emiliana is a member of the community bank "Azangarinas al Progreso," which is located in the Azángaro district, in the Azángaro province and the department of Puno. She is 25 years old, is married, and has 3 children. She was only able to complete the fourth year of primary education.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 2 years. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, and she used the money to increase the working capital of her business. She sells fast food.

She is now applying for a new loan for 600 PEN, which she will use to buy meat to make chicharrón, a typical food.

Her dream for the future is to improve her business and increase her earnings. What she likes most about her community bank are the meetings and the earnings from her savings.

loans.use: Buy meat to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Angela Ramona

texts.es:
Ángela de 48 años, tiene un puesto de comida. Vive con sus tres hijos en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Empezó con una mesa y una silla a vender alitas de pollo y platos de comida a las personas que pasaban por su casa. Poco a poco ha incrementado platos con varias recetas y ya tiene un local donde alquila mensualmente. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 17h00pm hasta las 21h00pm todos los días vendiendo alitas asadas, arroz con menestra y pollos mas bebidas. Con el préstamo quiere mejorar su casa para darle una mejor vida a sus tres hijos comprando con el dinero cemento, arena, bloques. 

En el futuro quiere comprar una cosas en otro sector y hay ubicar un local para su negocio de comidas.
texts.en:
Angela is 48 years old and has a food stall.  She lives with her 3 children in a semi-urban zone that has all of the basic services.  The area is located on the perimeter of Guayaquil, surrounded by a marsh. 

She began with one table and one chair, selling chicken wings and plates of food to people that passed by her house.  Little by little she has added other dishes and recipes and now has a location that she rents monthly.  Currently she works from 5pm to 9pm every day, selling grilled chicken wings, rice with vegetables and chicken, along with drinks.  With the loan she would like to buy cement, sand and cinder-blocks to improve her house and give her 3 children a better life. 

In the future she would like to buy a house in another area and have a place there to sell her food.

loans.use: Cement, Sand, Cinder-blocks

loans.name: Debora Ernestina

texts.es:
la señora Debora Ernestina García G. tiene 30 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos.
su esposo trabaja como pescador y Debora se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva,  visita los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo.
tiene clientes en la montaña, el tular y san lorenzo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa como pantalones, camisas y ropa interior.
sus ventas son de lunes a domingo. 

doña debora es una persona muy humilde y trabajadora.
el sueño de doña debora es mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Debora Ernestina García G. is 30 years old, married and has 2 children.  Her husband works as a fisherman, and Debora sells new clothes.  She visits the neighborhoods and suburbs of San Lorenzo, and has clients in La Montaña, El Tular and San Lorenzo.

She will use the loan to buy clothing such as pants, shirts and underwear.  She works from Monday to Sunday.

Debora is very humble and hardworking.  Her dream is to improve the living conditions of herself and her family.

loans.use: Buy New ClothesM

loans.name: Horencia

texts.es: Horencia tiene  56 años, es una mujer muy noble y trabajadora, vive en su casa de sus parientes,  junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella y su esposo poseen una imprenta, en donde su esposo, es quien ejecuta los trabajos, mientras que Horencia es la encargada de buscar clientes que necesiten del servicio que ofrece su imprenta. Paralelo a este trabajo, vende postres típicos de su ciudad, como es el caso de la mazamorra y arroz con leche, de esa manera recorre las calles ofreciendo estos postres. En estos 8 años de trabajo continuo, ella y su pareja han logrado sobresalir, además que este negocio le da mayor rentabilidad durante la temporada navideñas, ya que son mucho los clientes que le mandan a hacer almanaques en mayor número de tirajes. Se considera una mujer independiente y dentro de sus planes es ampliar su taller de impresiones, para que sus hijos también puedan dedicarse a esta actividad y ganarse su propio ingreso. Este es su 18avo crédito con MFP de Horencia,  y está dispuesta a pagar puntualmente su cuota. En su grupo ha demostrado ser una socia muy responsable. Con el crédito que solicita, va comprar los repuestos de Offset y papelería en general,  para que atienda los diversos pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Horencia is 56 years old, and is a very dignified and hardworking woman.  She lives in a house with her relatives, together with her husband and their 2 children.  She and her husband have a printing business, where her husband completes the printing jobs while Horencia is in charge of finding customers who are in need of the services that they offer.  In addition to this work, she sells desserts typical of the city, such as mazamorra and arroz con leche.  She travels the streets offering these desserts.  

In 8 years of continuous work, she and her husband have been able to do very well.  The business is more profitable around Christmas, because there are many customers that ask them to make large orders of yearbooks.   She considers herself an independent woman, and among her plans is increasing the printing workshop so that her children can also participate and earn their own income.  This is her 18th loan with MFP, and she is prepared make her payment punctually.  In her group she has proven to be a very responsible partner.  With the loan that she is asking for, she will buy the Offset repairs and stationary in general, to meet the diverse orders that she has.

loans.use: Buy repairs for the printer and stationary in general.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 49-year-old married man from Nabatieh and father of four children. He has owned a car wash/garage for 10 years. With his payback record in good standing, Hassan is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the third time. This loan will enable him to add new merchandise to his business, such as car accessories, oils, and lubricants. His previous loans had a big effect on his business and provided financial and social improvement for his family. In the future, Hassan hopes to expand his business by adding the ability to deal with all car issues.

loans.use: To add new merchandise to his business

loans.name: Libertad Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal de “Libertad” está iniciando su primer ciclo en el centro focal de Germán Busch. Esta banca comunal cuenta con la participación de nueve integrantes, las mismas que desembolsaran  por primera vez. La mesa directiva para este ciclo tiene como presidenta a la señora Asunta, como tesorera Martha y como secretaria de actas a la señora Alicia. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: venta de cinturones, venta de café, venta de carne, venta de chompas, ventas de cosméticos, venta de chompas, tienda de barrio, venta de carne, venta de juguetes.

La presidenta, la señora Asunta es una mujer joven, convive con su pareja y tiene cinco hijos.  
Con respecto al negocio de la señora presidenta, ella tiene el negocio de venta de cinturones. 
Ella compra cinturones por mayor y los vende por menor de manera ambulante por la Ceja de la ciudad de El Alto.
Lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer es la oportunidad de contar con la atención en salud y la posibilidad de ahorrar.
Las señoras de la banca comunal "Libertad" salen en la foto con una visita que las acompaña.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Libertad” or ‘Liberty’ is starting on its first loan cycle in the Germán Busch focal center. This communal bank has the participation of new members who will be taking out loans for the first time. The board of directors for this loan cycle has Asunta as president, Martha as treasurer, and Alicia as secretary. The women’s businesses are all different. They include a neighborhood store and sales of belts, coffee, meat, sweaters, cosmetics, and games.

The president, Asunta, is a young woman who lives with her partner and five children. As for her business, Asunta has a business selling belts. She purchases wholesale belts and sells them retail in the Ceja market in the city of El Alto.
